h6wT6La3fOG0PuLPjmP2xQ.review_text: Love this place and I'm so glad it's here! A neighborhood gem. Must try:  the sliders (pickles are homemade), bread pudding, chicken pot pie.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: I never knew this place even existed.  It is nice and cozy.  They have a lot of beer options and French style cocktails.  The waitress was nice and we had a bar table in the front so we could people watch.

PDzYazvBjDFlfb0lDi53Nw.review_text: Came here on a Tuesday night after my boyfriends work.  It's a small cozy place which serves a good collection of beers and wines.  It wasn't crowded during the time we came here--we thought it would be considering it was happy hour.  We were greeted and seated right away by their friendly staff.    Bf had red wine and I had white wine--prices where reasonable.  We ordered cheese plates: truffle tremor--MmmmMmmm --delicious! Nuvola di Pecora, and Vella dry Jack.--they were all good.    For the meat platter we tried:  loukanika, Finicchiona and Piccante Salami.  Our server was very helpful with suggesting which meat to try.  They were all very tasty.    We also ordered their roasted red grapes, walnut & prosciutto w/ gorgonzola flatbread.--it was different.  I didn't cAre for the roasted grapes at all.  The prosciutto didn't taste any close to a prosciutto :( bf and I were somewhat disappointed.  We didn't finished our flat bread and asked for it to go--our server took to the back so he can box it up and to come out few minutes later to tell us that he dropped our left over flatbread in the trash--at least he was honest about it.  He gave us 1/2 off the price and offered to fire up another one if we were still hungry..I said no and thank you.  We'd come back again and try their other food on their menu soon.

b4VMrSIDUQl6T7PDehGH6g.review_text: Tucked away on what seems to be a side street is my new favorite wine bar - Fat Angel. I always have to remember it's angel, not angle.   This little wine bar is so tiny but packs a lot of charm and character. From the dead deer head thingy on the wall, to the corks on the mantle, to the cute little delicate menus to their amazing selection of beers and draft wine, I may have found my new favorite wine bar.  I had their pinot noir on draft ($10/glass, $20/half bottle) and it was so delicious. Fruity and light just the way I am. Or the way I like it.  Their cheeses are really good and I really wanted to try their famous mac and cheese but that will just give me an excuse to come back and try possibly everything on their menu.  We got there yesterday night at 8:30 and the place was packed. We were lucky to find 2 seats at the bar. Definitely go early and if no seats are available, they have heat lamps outside for you to wait while tables open up.  Definitely one of my new favorite bars in the city. I love you!

Yi5JKaD1VY4Edeww92PZWA.review_text: My fiance and I have been here twice now, and as a self-proclaimed beer snob, he happens to think that Fat Angel has the best beer selection in San Francisco. I happen to agree. We had great experiences eating and drinking at Fat Angel and will definitely be returning often. Their space is curated perfectly, and even in the small space, they do have adequate seating. The staff is very friendly and they do a good job managing the bar/register/wait list. They have a great mix of indoor and outdoor seating, as well as a waiting area for people who haven't been seated yet.   Their beer list is rare and extensive. Pages and pages of beer that is rare/hard to find, all at relatively good prices. They have an eclectic mix of beer and wine, and there's always something new and interesting to try on their draft board.   Their food is spectacular. We've tried the pretzel, a bunch of their cheeses and meats, the baby kale salad, the mushroom flatbread, and the mac 'n' cheese. Their portions and large and everything tastes great. Their pretzel is one of my favorites in the city, and their kale salad rivals Darwin's, which is quite a feat. The only "meh" dish is the mac 'n' cheese; the sauce is kinda watery and the pasta could be more al dente.   Fat Angel is a great date night spot, or just a place to grab a special beer. We love it here!

pWoy0WuAz2JDUcghjCOdlw.review_text: I must say that although this was an after hours decision, I have every intention of coming back as soon as I can. We ordered the HUGE creme brulee and a bottle of wine to enjoy alongside. It was decadent, but most of all, I enjoyed the intimacy of the place. Great date spot, or spot to go to with a friend for a "catch up". I liked the look of it, being something like a French cafe that I'd been to when I lived in Paris. I can't wait to go back for some of the comfort food.

8PK3LrgXYcdClgIxzSz1pA.review_text: This was a great restaurant - great beer selection, great service, great food. The waiter was very knowledgeable of the beer selection and made recommendations. He also talked us through the beer and a selection of cheeses when they arrived. Highly recommend!

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: A wine bar with an entire section of the menu devoted to butter?  I'd almost think it strange if this joint weren't sandwiched between two jazz clubs that serve traditional Ethiopian food.  Gotta love a wine bar that offers more snacks than just cheese (not that there is anything wrong with that).  Wine on draft was kind of cool too, though wish they'd offer it in a proper pint...  Fried Capers w/ Sage: I thought fried pickles were cool, but they don't hold a spear to fried capers!  Seemed like caper flavored air-filled raisins.  Each wrinkly skin of caper shatters in your mouth leaving just a wisp of bitter caper taste and a lot of salt.  Great on the innovation front, but felt a little grease overload halfway through.  Best to share.  Maple Bacon Butter: Why did it take so long for someone to offer this?  Two of my favorite things together at once.  Real bits of fresh crisp bacon in a mound of extra buttery butter.  The bread offered was nice, but mainly just a vehicle for me to enjoy this butter because spooning it directly into my mouth would be a huge social faux pas.  Wild Mushroom & Truffle Oil w/ Pecorino Flat Bread: The bread was extremely thin, like a cracker.  Kind of reminded me of a makeshift pizza I once made from leftover whole wheat lavash bread.  The truffle oil wasn't heavily pronounced, they need to use more.  Overall, not so much a fan.  Mac-daddy Mac n' Cheese w/ Bacon: Dense spirals that manage to stick some gooeyness between each ramp.  The dense chewy texture was a nice change of pace compared to the limper elbows often offered.  The bacon was a nice add-in as always, but could have been crispier.  Blueberry Tart: Not on the menu, but a substitute for the dessert they ran out of.  It was more like a mini blueberry cobbler than a tart.  Loved how the freshly whipped cream melted ever so subtly over it's luke warm dough.  Had that great jam-like blueberry texture which feels richer than the flowing berries of a traditional blueberry pie.

ICwMfseYkrB0ZEK8tDUOHw.review_text: Wine on draught!   This place, I tell ya. When it comes to the cozy and classy, it doesn't get much better. The service was also exceptional, especially considering our larger group and my personal indecisiveness. So friendly.  I didn't try much of the food except the butter and bread. Just get it and love it. It looks like a great place for small plates, cheese, etc.  If I lived in SF, this would be my go-to date night place. It's casual enough to keep things light, but actually very romantic. What could be better than plying your date with wine and herbed butter by the spoonful?

6IGMJbGve3Fa5FKFyQ5zdg.review_text: My boyfriend and I were going to a concert at the Fillmore, and we wanted to grab dinner beforehand.  The options of Quickly, Popeye's, or Panda Express (all also within a block of the concert hall) were not tempting us, and then, hidden around the corner just off Fillmore we found Fat Angel.  We checked out the menu and it looked fabulous, and a quick look at Yelp showed us 4.5 stars overall.  We were sold.   When we showed up at about 7:45pm on a Friday night, the place was PACKED.  Every seat in the house (even outside, where it was cold) was taken, and we put our name on the wait list.  We each ordered a glass of wine, and were seated before we finished them.  The staff seemed slightly overwhelmed by the number of people, but they did a good job of handled the chaos, were knowledgeable about the menu when we had questions, and overall we had a very pleasant dining experience.  My wine, a Syrah/Cab blend from N2, was delicious and complimented the food perfectly.  They also have a very unique and diverse beer selection, and I greatly enjoyed reading the humorous and informative descriptions on the menu.  Food we ordered for 2 people, and left stuffed: - Smoked Trout Salad with Horseradish Vinaigrette: Could have used a few more pieces of trout, but was seriously good.  After devouring the salad, we had high hopes for the rest of the meal, and were not disappointed.  - Flatbread with Gorgonzola, Grapes, Walnuts and Prosciutto: Super thing and crispy bread was just thick enough to support the deliciousness on top.  The combination of flavors was amazing.  - Charcueterie of Duck Salami, Wild Boar Salami, and Sopressata (see picture): Served with warm thinly sliced bread and whole grain mustard, the meats were amazing.  We both agreed that the duck was the winner, but all were really good, and I thought about sneaking the mustard home with me, it was that good.    We were too full to order dessert, but plan to come back soon and save room to try either the bread pudding or blueberry cobbler.  I only wish this restaurant were closer to home, as it was amazing.  In fact, it might very well be my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco, and those of you who know me know that I do not give that title out to just anyone.  :-)  Happy 1-year Anniversary, Fat Angel.  I wish I'd known about you sooner, but I will certainly be back for more!

inxj1gVt1lAi_rwf7uhWXA.review_text: Nice spot for fun/different beers, I assume the wine selection is good.  Food is great, we tried all sorts of things and split them.  Food is pretty reasonably priced (~10 bucks for 3 sliders), some of the beers are crazy expensive.  Three of us had:  several great beers, including: Ale Industries Rye'd Piper Ale Industries Dualing Rye I believe it was called, cask aged Arrogant Bastard Casked  Tried two appetizers: Pretzel Polenta fries  :--very good  Tried three "plates": Sliders  :-- very tasty, light on the meat but very good. Pesto Flat bread pizze   :--very good Chicken Pot pie  :---  we were stuffed at this point, but it was excellent.  Probably second to The Townshead across town for chicken pot pies, but very good.    Highly recommend the place.  it is small and crowded, takes about 30 minutes to get a seat inside.  has heaters on the outside for sitting or waiting.  We sat outside and started on beers and pretzel and were inside before we finished the pretzel.  Great starter for a night at the Fillmore.

RagOSUdGuse5dxwg8lj3VQ.review_text: It's a year later. Fat Angel just gets better and better. If you have not eaten here, go tonight.

Hw5cIq9-vbY9pK2zywet4A.review_text: Inexpensive, but not that cheap.  Good wine on tap, but not great wine. Ok food, not amazing.  The service was certainly not very attentive.   I was there on a Thursday night, and there were some drunk 40-something ladies pretending they were the foursome from Sex and The City. Maybe this place is better for the happy-hour crowd.   If you're in the neighborhood its work dropping in, but I would not plan a whole night around attending Fat Angel.

1Jn6Y7x7hMZjpunBki-KUw.review_text: Wow, this place gets a lot of reviews. The beer is overpriced, considering you can buy many of these in a well-stocked specialty store. The food, however, is delicious. I like that you can share easily with 2 or 12, and that the flavors and ingredients are unexpected but work well, like their pizzas or the salad with HUGE candied pecans, blue cheese and mixed greens.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: i had wanted to come here on fri night but ended up at maven instead.  when i was parking before dinner at state bird provisions, i ended up parking right in front of fat angel, and since we had to wait a while for dinner anyway, we came here to get a drink first.  their snack meal is interesting w/ a whole section on flavored butter to be eaten w/ bread.  my friend got the maple bacon one and loved it.  since we were slated to have dinner already, i refrained from eating anything.  instead, i had a glass of cava, and it was a generous pour.   the space is super cute.  i can't wait to come back and have more drinks/food.

NDH7N_TqW7uZPqLBuGTWqA.review_text: The beer and wine selection here was endless. Our party of three decided on a bottle of pinot blanc.   The bartender was a little rude at the end of the night.  I understand that they were closing.  But when we asked for more water she responded only if you "chug it"....rude much?  but........... if you really need to pee...do use their bathroom...I've never been to a bar with such thick and soft toilet paper.  4 stars for that alone!  Would love to come back and try their food.

KPpKkjHvBtUO6anZ72VJDg.review_text: Tables are too close together and small. Service was slow. Flatbread with mushrooms was really good though.

YVA6-PCbvDpNXHjoA4PNJw.review_text: 8:00: (entering the bar) "I love chandeliers! I love deer! I love organ pipes!!  8:05: (waiting for seat at the bar) "I love champagne in a half glass!   8:06: "I did not know that I also love champagne cocktails with bitters in a half glass--so glad that was cleared up.   8:30: (Seated) I love Cabernet Franc/Merlot/Cab. Sauv. blends!! I love wine by the glass!!!   8:40: "Homemade butter?!?! Are you kidding me? I love butter!!!    (lots of eating and drinking and laughing.)  10:00 (after all of the butter, cheese, and wine is gone) "I love life. I love life too, too much."

FIlJ2W-dfrlfVQm4KZsiXA.review_text: I thought they had happy hour but I guess not and they don't serve food until 5:30.   We came here early knowing that we have slightly a lot of people and the place is small, I mean really small!   I'll admit, the food was really good. I especially enjoyed the pot pie and the sliders. The Mac and cheese was a bit spicy for my preference.   You may wonder, if I enjoyed the food so much, why am I only giving it 2 stars? Well, let me tell you, it's because the waitress was lame!! She was not friendly at all, when we asked her for some opinions on beer since it was our first time here, she seemed a little annoyed but nothing too obvious. Although, her true colors came out later. I understand that it was a Friday evening and it was quite busy in there, but like I said, this place was small!!! When I was literally waving to her for her attention, she just kept not looking our way at all and we took up like 1/5 of the place! She had ignored us multiple times to the point where we were gonna just walk out and not pay our bills but that's not the kind of people we are. Instead of trying to catch her attention and waving our arms around like idiots, we just went up to the bar to pay. She basically ruined our nice experienced here with her lack of service.

OtbI3mDUViGFq0GtWWy1sQ.review_text: Yet another visit to Fat Angel proves me right about this little gem of a wine bar. The small plates are excellent, the service is awesome, and the servers knowledgeable about every wine and beer on their menu. Whenever I am unsure where to go, I always head to Fat Angel.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: Came here twice with some girlfriends.  A good quiet place to hang out if you want to talk and have some wine and food and they do have indoor and outdoor seating.  They have a pretty good wine selection here.  My favorite though is the meat and cheese plates....especially with their mustard...so good. Also, they have a good mac n cheese and I normally don't even like mac n cheese but next time I will have to come back to order their giant salad!

Zs88v-TD3DMGvI8tUjuxaQ.review_text: okay so to be honest, I didn't spend a great amount of time here or intensely dissect the menu.  Nor am I a wine connoisseur (or any type of expert for that matter), but this place takes the cake for decor, attitude, service, and style.  of course the beer I had was superior to most others I am drinking, but even if I were downing a PBR, the charm of the place alone would have had me feelin' like a champion.  the flatbread was superb and the beer great too.    tucked just off Fillmore and a little further down than the rest of lower pac heights, this place is a gem worth unearthing.  trust me - treat yourself to all that is the Fat Angel - you won't be let down!

2co-ZDhDxQld2vaWmYRsXQ.review_text: I don't get up to the city often enough, especially around dinner time, but when I do it takes some convincing to NOT go to Fat Angel.  Bajillions of beers (if you like that sort of thing). The best sliders I've ever had. Chicken Pot Pie to kill for. I'm starting to salivate.

spvnzhJ48rpHPFmos_6fZg.review_text: Excellent food and awesome service.  My friends and I stopped by Fat Angel after seeing a movie at Kabuki Cinemas.  We will definitely be back for more delicious food and wine.  Be sure to try the chicken pot pie and the mac and cheese.  The best I ever had!

B-7QSsJYW90NFjmZbyKL_A.review_text: Minus one star for being crazy expensive.  That said? Great food, great beer choices, and funny, kind, and helpful staff. I enjoyed the mac n' cheese immensely. My husband's chicken pot pie was good (he says) and my sister enjoyed her endive salad. My brother-in-law had the sliders and he seemed to find them agreeable as well. They had a wonderful selection of beers but it was just way too expensive for me to go for, so I settled on having one cocktail with dinner - the Pimm's cup, which was delicious!

ehCameIBK2g7dw5rRXpvzQ.review_text: A first for me - 2 updates.  Thank you for serving brunch on Saturdays now because I always end up at Farmer's Market at noon:thirty not having had much more than water since waking up. So I buy all this food, but I am too hungry to walk 3 blocks home to cook it. And there's Fat Angel heralding to all with his trumpet that breakfast is served beckoning with door and windows flung open.  A few weeks ago I had the traditional Ploughman's lunch - meat, cheese, bread, pickles, mustard, fruit, and a beer. All I have to say is that what ye ask for, the universe shall provide. Last week, I had coffee dripped straight from heaven trickled through a Sightglass (sorry Blue Bottle - I still love you) alongside an egg baked over brisket. It's nice to chat with the bartendress at this time, too.  And you get to be serenaded by the strings of the live jazz band that usually plays during the market. All they need to do is add a harpist.   I've also now had the desserts and just about everything on the food menu except for Cy's salty sweet Chinese nuts. Nope, I've never had dose nutz.  Which brings me to one of my favorite quotes about our fair city:  Most people believe the afterlife is one of eternal bliss. The only thing I've never understood is why my devout San Francisco friends are invariably so reluctant to get there.                                                         --- Art Hoppe  If you knew me, you'd know I wasn't so devout in that sense, so while I'm aware of being on this plane, I might as well spend as much time as I can in places that bring me more bliss than I already feel just living in the city limits. Please forgive me for taking so long to give you the last star (if they even matter).

teIu56lnGpctNxULkvCmoA.review_text: This place is absolutely adorable! It's very small and charming but has an amazing selection of beers and wine. The flatbread pizza was definitely my favorite thing off the menu!

HToqdBghDzj5TdfqXuE1Rw.review_text: Came in on a Friday night around 8:30 and had to wait about 30 min for a spot. They'll take your phone number and text you when it's ready so you don't have to physically be there.   We ended up getting seated at the bar, which was fine. But it took about 20 min until someone acknowledged us (only about 3 ladies were working). We were able to sample some of the wines before we decided on what glass to take. The server was super friendly and knowledgable. I noticed it's the same price to drink wines by the glass versus buying a bottle, so it allows you to try multiple kinds! And the pours are generous!   For food we ordered the wild mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and a salad and added rotisserie chicken for $3.   The endive salad was a hefty portion! I do wish there was a bit more chicken throughout, but it was tender and flavorful. I enjoyed that it wasn't overly done, but bf found it to be too sweet for his tastes.   The flatbread was delicious as well! Almost a cracker crust with bits of pecorino cheese.   Prices are a tad bit high for what you get, but I think you're paying more for the location and vibe.

Kqar0e5uAQ3lhMlyUioX2A.review_text: I came here with a group of friends once and we bought a bottle of wine at the bar. This place is pretty small, so probably not the best for large groups. Superb service, the workers are always very attentive and friendly. I didn't a chance to try any of the food, but looking at reviews of this place, it seems that the food is delish! I will have to try it the next time I'm back!

mKMMiiegYGAHmjP4dnDQcg.review_text: Cozy is the best word to describe this place. Something about dimly lit restaurants that play just the right kind of music in the right volume level just makes you feel very welcomed. Either that or it was the *vast beer and wine (draft, too) menu that made me feel all warm inside, ha.  We checked out this place on a whim and though it was small -- and there was a wait, it was worth it. Tried the Spicy Mac&Cheese which was an absolute winner. Tried Finnochiona salami for the first time, loved it..  There's at least *2 pages worth of reasons to come back to this place, and that I'll do, hopefully sooner than later.

ixAzWY0pBHd-1P0gUPFcTw.review_text: Service is generally poor, but the other night we were completely ignored when we popped in for a glass of wine from the cold.    Redeeming qualities include: the butter.  Yes, order the butter - sounds crazy - but it is delicious, do not order 2 - becuase you might hate yourself.

XcpSajScRshBFxCNdoh95g.review_text: I went here on Tuesday night around 8pm after finding it via Yelp.  I was on vacation with my husband and we were looking for a comfortable place to grab some food which had a good beer selection. Fat Angel did not disappoint!  When we arrived there was about a 1/2 hour wait for a table and the bar was completely full with people who were eating.  The bar area itself was very small and a little crowded as there were two other couples waiting for tables who had arrived before us.  Despite it being a little crowded, the bartenders were very attentive to us while we were waiting and constantly made sure our water and beer glasses were full.    As were were waiting we good in the atmosphere- the chandelier hanging from the ceiling, the beautiful wooden bar back, and the dimly lit room with candles set a nice atmosphere.  We got some great beers on draft while we were waiting, some type of double IPA for each of us. They had a good amount of beers on tap and also an extensive paper menu of bottled beers.  For food, we started off with the cheese plate. Fat Angel had a list of cheeses we could selected from.  We had the Bella Dry Jack (based on Yelp reviewer advise), Spanish semi-soft cheese, and a Spanish soft cheese.  The platter was set up nicely and did not disappoint.  For the the meal I ordered the Mac & Cheese- and it was amazing!!! I am a big mac & cheese fan and regularly order it - and this is one of the best I have had!  I loved the flavor and the consistency of the pasta.  It had just the right amount of cheese to not be too cheesy.  My husband ordered the flat bread with the roasted red grapes, walnuts, and proscuitto.  I tried a piece of his pizza and it was very flavorful.    Overall the service while we were at Fat Angel was great.  The service was outstanding and we felt comfortable throughout our meal. The waiter checked on us to make sure we had enough beer, water and everything we needed.  We enjoyed the food, good beers, and if back in San Francisco we would visit again for sure!

ubQyvWpbQsNdezhVSrIYog.review_text: Hung out here after a couple of drinks at Social Study. Love this place! Great food, and great service - low key but nice/helpful service. I will definitely be coming back here for light bites and good wine!

gZNznMMGyqn_dQi8TUihog.review_text: 4.5 stars, but I round up or down accordingly. We were waiting for a walk-in wait list phone call from SBP around the block so we had an hour and a half to kill. We found Fat Angel on Yelp. Sat at the bar and had olives, the smoked trout salad and some drinks while we waited. If I was local I would definitely make a habit of it. The guys behind the bar were super nice and the crowd was agreeable, we almost wanted to stay, even when State Bird called to tell us our "table" was ready.

aD-rsDe2S0e7jTkYD6ULaQ.review_text: Hidden, low-key, small wine bar I really enjoyed.   Cost to worth it rating: 3.5 (~10/glass) Return worthiness: yes  Highlights: - Atmosphere: more like a coffee shop or a pub than a wine bar cause there wasn't a hint of pretentiousness. It's just a comfortable spot to grab a seat at a bare wooden table and enjoy a few drinks.  - Selection: good for both wines by the glass as well as beers - Descriptions: conversational personality infused in the text using words anyone can understand. Categories like "Chubby and Satisfying" and "Bright and Juicy" were fun to see.  - Pretzel: warm, soft, and salt  Lowlights:  - Hidden: unassuming on a side street of Filmore. I wouldn't imagine it was such a cool place, but I did my standard yelp check before I walked in and gave it a try.  I'd love to come back and spend more time drinking here as well as getting to try their food. Mac and cheese was calling my name.

snDjs1hdh7JOWv4jjbXPDw.review_text: We had a fantastic experience. The service was great, the food came out fast, was super fresh, and the protions were not shy. We had the pretzel, a selection of 3 meats and 3 cheeses, kale salad and the mushroom flatbread. Everything was great and the kale salad may have been my favorite and it was HUGE! The also have an amazing beer list. I had the Mosaic Double IPA, I had never heard of this brew before but it was phenominal. Not super hoppy, which I dont mind, but more super smooth. It paired so well with our food as it was clean and crisp not terribly powerful. This place is great! I cant wait to go back.

ZXNwO2bY3QTYP0k_5bhG1A.review_text: When looking for a place to grab a bite before a show at the Fillmore, Fat Angel showed up near the top of the list during a Yelp search.  Noticing that they were a gastropub with a fine beer list made the choice easy for me.  After parking nearby with my friend P, we made a beeline here to quench our thirst and grab a bite. Unfortunately, there was a small crowd of people jamming the doorway and we thought we might be out of luck. After all, the place is really tiny.   Undaunted, we squeezed through to the bar to find several open spaces. I guess everyone really wanted a table.  We didn't.  The draft beer list here (written on chalkboard) was FANTASTIC: all microbrews, including two IPAs, a golden ale, a porter, a weiss beer, a brown ale. a double IPA and even a sour beer.  The bottle list was much longer; The waiter said the total count was over 100!  So many choices that we couldn't decide, and so we left. (yeah right)  The menu was short but we found what we wanted quickly: sliders for me, and chicken pot pie for my buddy P.  Unfortunately, it took about 15 mins to get someone to take our orders. (Staff was very thin.) At least we had tasty beers in front of us and some time to examine the cool decor, including the large glass chandelier (echoes of the nearby Fillmore?) and the back of the bar, which appeared to be made out of an old church organ...pretty Cool actually.  Once we ordered, the food arrived quickly. We both enjoyed our meals and our second, tasty brew.  The night was off to a good start.  By the time we paid up and left, the outside crowd had doubled, and even bar seats were in demand. We were glad we had arrived when we did.  5 stars for the perfect pre-show dinner and excellent beer selection; 1 star off for the spotty service.

2P3HE3f-RmIQX842L9COgg.review_text: Cozy? You mean cramped. But overall, I get you and your charm, Fat Angel. I like your vibe and taste generally. Portions are wowzers generous on their menu items, from the massive (and delicious!) kale salad to the mac'n'cheese plate to the flatbreads. Because the libations menu is so large, I won't comment much more than saying you're bound to find something you like to drink here: a hearty beer, a sophisticated wine, etc. Check the chalkboard atop the bar for what's happening, or ask your server about what's on draft. Finally, this restaurant doesn't take reservations, by the way; snuggle in early, or wait in a line. Also, only one bathroom for everyone, staff and customers.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Ok I listened to you Yelp users and was a bit dissapointed. This place was just ok, it's hit or miss. This is my sober month so I ordered a fresh squeeze lemonade which was very yummy. Let me start with all the yummys: Sliders, Meat Platter. I'll pass food- Mushroom and Truffle Flatbread, tasted like store bought cracker not flatbread. Chicken Pot pie was very close to being a hit but there was too much salt on the top puff pastry and WAY TOO MUCH Taragon!! Woah heavy hand there. There was a good amount of chicken in the pie, a good thing. We shared 4 dishes between 3 of us and we all came out hungry.

UdBtdhH13_DxeJoJxDx6Iw.review_text: After seeing great reviews on Yelp my boyfriend and I decided to try out Fat Angel last Saturday. We arrived at the restaurant around 7:30 and we're told there was one party in front of us as we put our name on the list. Note, we didn't actually write our name down or watch a host write our name down, we just gave our name to a waiter who was supposed to be responsible for the wait list. I never actually saw our name or any other guests name recorded in any way. Anyway, after putting our names on the "list" we grabbed a drink and stood near the entryway with a couple of beers. A few minutes later a couple came in and put their name on the list. Two seats opened up at the seat yourself bar so we sat down. Food menus were placed in front of us immediately, I told the waiter I would rather wait for an actual table, which he said was fine. A few minutes later I see the couple that came in after us being seated. I grabbed the waitress working that night and told her that we had come in first and asked why we weren't being seated. First the waitress tried to argue with me and insist that I must have just imagined to have stood next to them while they put their name on the list and that they probably came in earlier. When I insisted that no, we came in first, we were there when they put their names on the list the waitress rolled her eyes and told us that most people were fine sitting at the bar so the waiter handling the list had probably just taken us off. She then just walked away. I was shocked. She was just so rude. Instead of trying to rectify their mistake she acted like it was so ridiculous to expect the wait / host staff to do their job. I didn't catch her name, but the waitress working 5/19/2012 was probably the rudest waitstaff I have dealt with. I couldn't believe she just walked away, so I grabbed another waiter to try and get the situation resolved. The second waiter (named Sai I believe) apologized and offered to buy us a round of drinks out of his own pocket. Now, in retrospect he probably wouldn't have paid for the drinks out of his pocket the restaurant probably would (or at least should) have an allowance of food and / or drinks that can be comped when there is some sort of mistake on the part of the staff, but since he was saying it would be coming out of his pocket and since he was neither the very rude waitress I had just dealt with or the incompetent waiter who "put our names on the list" I refused the free drinks and just asked that we be seated at a table as soon as possible. A while later we were seated at this little window - bar thing. I thought it  was odd we were being seated there since we refused seating at the bar and this was ostensibly the same or worse than seating at the bar, but at this point I was quite hungry so I just sat down. We ordered cheeses, meat, a salad, the mac & cheese, and a couple glasses of wine. The cheeses, meat, and wine were delivered quickly and were fine. The salad came out after we were finished with the cheeses and meat. The food was fine, not mind-blowing, but not bad. We were about two-thirds of the way through the salad when the check arrived. Both of us were sufficiently satiated so we didn't ask about the mac & cheese, but it was at this point that I decided I had to write a review addressing the subpar service at Fat Angel. The waiter who had offered to buy us a round came with a check that had taken the first round off the bill, which was nice but didn't really make up for all the issues with the meal. To me it seems like most of the waitstaff would fit better at a crappy dive bar, where you don't need to write things down because it really is much easier to remember a few drink orders than the names and order of people on a wait list or several tables food orders and you can be more surly with guests.  In short although the beer and wine list seems extensive & interesting the service will keep me away.

HpBvzMzchFrJ6XJmtRIsMg.review_text: WOWZERS! What an amazing find (yelp comes through again) for pre-Fillmore drinks & eats! And what a serious bargain for city dining!   Everything was in our favor last Thursday evening.. one of those odd nights where hubster and I must have had karma and/or the gods on our side.. rock star parking on Geary directly in front of the Fillmore? Check. The last available (corner) table for two at FA when we walked in? Check. Being seated, ordering, & eating within about 40 minutes and getting to the show just as the lights came down? Check!  Contrary to reviews, service was FAST. And our waiter was super friendly and sincere. Instead of trying to upsell us, he discouraged us from each ordering a salad as they are GIGANTIC and also said if we weren't super hungry, we could probably share the mac n' cheese vs. each getting our own. We opted to each get our own anyway as we weren't ordering any other apps., but he was totally right, we ended up both leaving with a to-go box of mac (which then became our next day lunches!).    As far as the food goes, everything was ridiculously tasty. The horseradish dressing on our arugula salad was super yummy, but the fried capers put it over the top! And the mac n' cheese was some serious comfort food- perfectly cheesy with an amazing bread crumb toasty top, baked in its own mini casserole dish.. yum. We had to use some crazy will power to stop ourselves from leaving in a carb coma.  Finally, the beer and wine is I think what people first & foremost come for; as they should. They have a terrific list not to mention some incredible and reasonable stuff on tap. Once again, our waiter actually suggested to me one of the least expensive wines on the menu, the $6 sauvignon blanc on tap (!) and had we had more time, I would have  loved to have shared a bottle. Super juicy and refreshing, easily one of the best wine deals in town.   As a side note, to be honest, the name Fat Angel was a bit of a turn-off. I thought it sounded a little cheesy, especially after ogling the gold chubby angel that greeted us, hanging prominently above the doorway. BUT, don't be fooled, inside the decor is actually quite nice. I especially dug the gaudy in a good way giant crystal chandeliers and what appeared to be extremely large golden organ pipes behind the bar. The soundtrack was a decent mix of indie rock that was just loud enough to help mask the super loud and slightly rowdy conversations going on around our table.   All in all, Fat Angel is definitely thee place to hang before a show at the Fillmore and if you happen to live nearby, this is sure to become a new favorite. You could easily split one of their $9 giant salads (which are presented at your table in a large wooden salad bowl) four ways with a group of friends. $2 for a quality salad? You heard right.  Yummy beers, wines, eats and treats too, we were especially tempted by the bread pudding a la mode we saw being brought to a couple next to us.. next time I'm hitting that up for sure!

PvczE674Cmq51DxwKPMGyg.review_text: Meal: Drinks  Rationale: We had just finished doing something and weren't going to be doing another thing for a couple hours. Fat Angel is where we took our layover. My boyfriend picked this place because they had an interesting list of beers on tap.  Food: I don't remember which beers we got, but we got a few, and they were all interesting, highly alcoholic, and a bit pricey. We also got a pretzel with mustard. Pretty standard fare, but it came on a slab of wood, which was sort of fun.  Service/Atmosphere: Nothing sticks out in my mind in one way or the other with the service. They had some weird cast iron antique-ish furniture and a big chandelier, which was interesting to look at.  Conclusion: Not sure if I would seek out Fat Angel again unless I was nearby, but I'd have another layover there for sure.

j1VUe41XObdkrbsYmZUctA.review_text: I loved Fat Angel!  Great happy hour food and wines.  The meat/cheeses and flatbreads were really good to share and of course pairs well with wine.  The place is small but it's cozy and well decored.  I can see myself coming back here with a small group of friends again.  It's no place for a large group.

q2q0mZYs9c-iKU4pat31fQ.review_text: Can only speak for the drinks here.  Great beer selection and great place to kill time while waiting for your table at State Bird.

YC4xH6hxgAQks-ngsr_Whg.review_text: I didn't know that the 'hood had been praying for a fat angel, but if it wasn't - it should have been because this place rocks.  The decor is perfect, not trying to hard and filled with quaint touches.  The wine list is nicely edited with amusing descriptions and the food is awesome.  Mac and Cheese is always a hit as are cheeses and flat bread.  I had a goat brie here that I can't stop thinking about, which is incredible because I hate goat cheese and I hate brie.  Who'd have thought that they'd combine to perfection?

P94OgbKTLgU2YRyhPD2tRQ.review_text: What a beautiful place! Though it is tiny and you'll most likely end up in a line, this place charms you like none other.  LOVED the flatbread, mac n cheese, and salads. Chicken pot pie had a strange taste, which was the only disappointing part. Beers were good, and their "wine on tap" selection was good, too.  Go early to beat the rush!

tzsGUTP44maM3xe1JuVZ7w.review_text: Basically I agree with everyone else. My experience included the following pluses--  Great service--we got there early to avoid the rush and glad we did, the place got packed. But the two servers remained super attentive. Our wine glasses were never empty without them offering more.  Great Cheese plate--nuff said  Great wine list---had some off the glass list, but I also tried the Cab on tap. A Preston wine...it was superb.   The proximity to the Fillmore was simply the icing.

oGvWKbeuW6WzGOqqr8N1SA.review_text: Was there this past Friday becoz we wanted to check out wine bars and Yelp listed this place under this category.  The place is small and cozy and the deer head (hope it's fake) hanging on the wall is quite 'out of place' yet eye-catchy.  the place was already full by 6:30pm and we just waited standing at the corner of the bar / also right at the entrance.  We took 2 white wines (delicious) and a salami/parma ham platter while waiting.  Groups of people kept pouring in and before you know it, the wait for a 4 person table, as the server said, was 1 hour.   Menu was very simple and i liked the flexibiilty of choosing my own meat in the platter, and later the cheese (as many as 6 selections, I recall) in my platter.  The nice lady who was seated at the bar ordered what looked like a pizza and we asked her how it was "Very Good', she said.  I will definitely give that a try next time I visit.  So, our wines, salami platter and cheese platter was good.  Though the waitress couldn't tell which cheese was which.  We were seated facing the window after less than an hour, but was worth the wait, especially if you're waiting while drinking.  Oh, and there's this thing called 'draft wine'.  Strange but guess I'll give it a try next time.

HAv257_IVJnQT0ZIL8Nn-Q.review_text: I like this place. It's kinda of small and has a nice relaxed atmosphere. They have a pretty good beer selection however a lot of it is in bottles. The wine though they serve off taps. They have a pretty good selection as well. Really kind and friendly service and just overall a chill place. My favorite thing about this place though ... the food :) It's like comfort food. mac & cheese, bread pudding, sliders? This is a wine bar? Sold! :)

KYfzMJD8LLDoFSHJE8iZNA.review_text: This place is my go to beer bar in the city.  It's a bit of a trip for me but it's always worth it.  They have it all-- great beer selection, awesome wine, fantastic food, and knowledgeable staff that will humor all of your stupid questions.   My favs are the kale salad, red grape flatbread, and a refreshing sour beer.

pZAktka6VfcXmUf4lWlBJQ.review_text: A rocking little wine/beer bar near the Fillmore. Tucked off the street, you really do need the sign to find the place. However, it's well worth the hunt. Delicious wines and beers on tap, plus numerous bottles. The bartenders (including the owner) are super friendly.   I'll definitely be back when I'm in the neighborhood.

5ZXT4BQB-C1XjUpKmh7kaQ.review_text: Fat Angel has been on my to-go-to list for quite some time now, and I finally made it for a nightcap after my birthday celebrations.  This is the type of place where you feel comforted just by walking in the door (maybe it was the yellow lighting and christmas tree, but it worked for me).   We sat at the bar and sipped on our beers for an hour or so, enjoying the company, admiring the tree, slowly fading into the end of our night after a long work week.    Just thinking about it now with the rain outside makes me want to zip over for some chic comfort food and a glass of something swanky.  I like that their beer and wine selections are atypical, adding to their sophistication I suppose.    Friendly bartender, calming atmosphere, lovely space.  I'll be back.  Especially when it's cold out or I'm winding down for the night, but not quite ready for bed.

onVxYeUw4eRcX7amvVFgaw.review_text: Loved the place, loved the food, loved the beer, very nice waiters too, never had to complain once.  What I liked the least was the owner who looked like a total arse hole: not a "thank you" nor a "bye" or even a tiny little smile, even though he is the one you're paying the check to, even though you've added a nice tip to it! o_O  I guess the message is clear towards tourists : "P*ss off" ! I may give it a second chance, just in case he'd prove me wrong...

JG2-Z87cVoVQRiCaTtc7jw.review_text: It's got a whole section on the menu for sour beers. I'm sold.   The food is pretty damn good. I've had quite a bit off their menu--the highlights are the different butters and the salads, which are seriously gigantic. I ordered the chicken pot pie the last time I was there. The portion was pleasing, and I initially was really enjoying it, but the more I ate, the more I felt like it tasted like the pot pies I used to make in the ovens. So, there's your docked star--the pot pie isn't the best thing on the menu.   Great bar though, and bartenders are super knowledgable. Also I love wine on tap.

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: Fat Angel is deserving of its high ratings and it is a welcomed addition to the neighborhood! The space is cozy but not dark and coupley and I loved the large chandelier over the bar. My date and I shared the olives, sliders (so good!), grape and gorgonzola flatbread (yum) and trout salad (large portion but far from great, imo - especially since it arrived last). As everyone else has mentioned, they have an extensive wine list with cute descriptions for each one and the service was very friendly (but also very hands-off - we had to keep flagging them down).  I'll definitely be back!

yLzh-07RGvwdVVVF9le-Sg.review_text: Stopped here for a drink after a show at Great American Music Hall. It's located in Japantown, within walking distance to the Fillmore and just a short drive from GAMH. Sy (sp?), the owner, was closing because it was slow but opened back up for us and let us hang for an hour. Excellent beer and wine selection. The kitchen was closed so we didn't get to try their food. My wife had a Klinker Zinfandel from Lodi. They have six beer taps, all California beers. Here's what was on tap last night: Anchor Brekles Brown Ale Lost Abbey Red Barn Saison Lost Coast 8 Ball Imperial Stout Bear Republic Ryenasty DIPA Ale Industries Peche Sour - can't remember the last tap. I had the Ryenasty and the Peche Sour. Both were very good. They have a bottle of RR Toronado 20th Anniv. that they're selling for $399. That may be sitting there a while longer. Anyway, really nice little beer/wine spot with nice ambiance.

0_NbnQy2AwOUDtDUr4uDTg.review_text: August 4, 2014  Wonderful little place with an exciting menu to go along with a really good selection of craft beers and wine on tap. We were looking for a light meal and started with an order of the Sweet and Spicy Chinese Nuts. Then we ordered 3 sides of BUTTER! That's right, Fat Angel has flavored butters with endless bread. We had the Maple Bacon, Honey and Lemon Caper Sage butters. Amazingly good! We then proceeded to order their Mac & Cheese and Sliders. Everything was quite good.

CZUJGLa5A1fH5VSXg29bzw.review_text: What separates Fat Angel from other wine bars in the city is the unconditionally friendly service from the owners and their thorough descriptions of the wines. They emphasize wines that are not from the CA region (which makes me happy, since I am a wino for Spanish and South American varieties) and they are willing to spend a lot of time talking about the flavors and your personal preferences. They also offer tastings if they think they have a great suggestion for you. It is San Francisco, so the prices reflect that (7-14 dollars per glass) but their 7 dollar glass is of a higher quality, in my opinion, than at most other wine bars. Fortunately, they do not have the all-too-common SF wine snob approach. They have been very good to me every time I come in, and this very quickly became a favorite spot.   Lastly, as someone who avoids places like the Marina and the Financial District at all costs, it needs to be said that I've been in this place on the days when I've been sloppy and scrambling for loose change and on the days when I just bought a pretty new dress and wanted to make an afternoon of it.

Dn2gtoQnMgf261kIXpjLvA.review_text: "people who like to drink light beer dont like the taste of beer; they just like to pee alot"  this is the first thing written on the chalkboard menu.  stopped by here the other night for a couple drinks and some bar food.  the venue itself is tiny. the place was packed and LUCKILY 2 people were standing up as from the bar as we walked in...  after grabbing the bar stools, we sat down and ordered drinks from their extensive beer list...and i mean UBER extensive...their beer list, although probably not as crazy as the beer "encyclopedia" at monks kettle, was very well organized...especially if you arent familiar with all the different flavor notes of different beers...  as we perused thru the food menu, i was a bit disappointed because there wasnt any "food, food" as i was hoping for, other than some mac and cheese...we opted for a charcuterie plate, a pretzel, and some of their overpriced butter (4.50 for a spoonful of house special butter in an array of flavors)  the pretzel was good. the meats (although nothing really stood out) was good as well.  my favorite part of the food was the dollop of mustard that they thew on every dish...great flavor and it really tied the saltiness of the cured meats with the different breads on the plate...  all in all, service was cool because we were sitting smack dab in the middle of the bar...bartender was nice and helpful...nothing great here but definitely nothing bad...very very chill wine/beer bar indeed.

ZPBYTL5yMx8AVP_AOJ2RVw.review_text: What a cute place! I walked in, thought it was a coffee bar, did a double take and realized I was in the right place. Very intimate with some really sweet bartenders/waiters. I had the GSM and the Zinfandel on tap. Both were great, although I think I liked the Zinfandel more. They also have an amazing cheese plate that disappeared pretty quickly among five friends. It was a great start to a fun and random night :)

cLDb8TcSUnbdyR81f0eRcA.review_text: Open late which is great, and they have very friendly and knowledgeable service. We ordered a lot of food. Here's a roundup: The polenta fries are super delicious, definitely get these. We also got the sliders and the mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was good but pretty heavy. The chicken pot pie was massive and pretty good. All of the food tasted like it had just been prepared, which is a plus. Cautionary word - the food is super hot (temperature wise), so be careful otherwise you'll end up with a burned tongue.   The creme brulee was a bit too eggy for my liking. 3.5 stars, but more of a 3 than a 4.

exygIMUwWiMg8HU4L_lNIw.review_text: I've been here a few times just for drinks with friends, but last night went here for food as well. We shared some truffle flavored goat's cheese and some duck liver pate to start. Then we shared a mushroom flatbread and the sliders. The sliders were particularly tasty, but all the food was good. We also shared a half bottle of their on-top sauv blanc wine.  The service was friendly and prompt, and the place has a very cool mellow crowd.

MilelhE5OClJOtg6x4VhBw.review_text: This place has great rustic food: e.g. mushroom flatbread, spicy mac and cheese, and beer selection is beyond. My friends said the wine selection was also great. The server gave us samples and talked about the types of beers as we were trying to figure out what we were wanting. It's a mellow, hip and smart crowd.  There is an attention to detail here that makes Fat Angel worth regular visits to explore the menu.

3lAWNEEejSRbyh7SqCKBFw.review_text: Oh Fat Angel, I really wanted to like you.  Food & Libation...what more does a gal need, right?  You have what seemed to be a very balanced list of libations but you disappointed me with the food part.  Ordered the fried capers and the rosemary manchego.  The fried capers, while good, really how many can a person eat before experiencing high blood pressure?  Fat Angel you definitely gave more than expected which is what I wish you would have offered with the manchego.  Really, 2 thin slices of manchego and a handful of bread.  What am I supposed to do with that?  No, won't be visiting again even if you're a cute little spot.

K4QNhmLIfu2LaB4ugETFwA.review_text: - food: delicious comfort food - atmosphere:  tiny yet adequate  - staff:  mostly attentive - price: fair  additional info: - extensive beer and wine selection

4Y60RExOuhgpWfoBCV-XUA.review_text: Delish!  I adore this place for many reasons:  intimate with small plates so you can try a bit of many things:  We ordered some cheeses (the Goat Gouda) was amazing.  The flatbreads were superb: very thin,crisp and hot.  The cherry tomato's on top explode with flavor.   The grape/gorgonzola/walnet...flatbread was memorable, to say the least!  Then came a fresh, complex salad with Endive, gorgonzola, walnuts.  It sounds like the usual gang of salad'fixin's but it is not!  Superb. When the little cast-iron dish of macaroni and cheese arrived we abandoned all attempts at civility. Smooth and creamy with a mix of cheeses and topped with a smattering of crunchy crumbs.  We finished with the sliders - very good! and stumbled out to the street; drunk on the good food alone.  High thee to Fat Angel.. We stuffed ourselves for about $20 a head, with three beverages.

oo0gy7nuHywgAgpxETiB-g.review_text: This place is a real cool place to hang out.  Very nice vibe going on with the smallish space and the low lighting.  Nice date place.  The food looked really good, especially the bread pudding, wow.    On this evening though Betty and I only had beer from the tap.  Very good selection.  I enjoyed the Hopoholic 4x IPA by Knee Deep Brewing Company.  Uh huh, 15.5%!  Obviously a sipper, but actually very easy drinking.  For dessert I had the Biere de Chocolat by Almanac Beer Co. :)  Very tasty as well.  We came with our friend Daniel who suggested coming here and we were glad we did.  Now if I could only get that bread pudding shipped to Tampa.

AOuz3QvFLMweGC7MQ_IxdQ.review_text: i'm here often.  fantastic vegetarian food, and the wine is divine.   the owners are lovely, it's like they're entertaining at home.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: Wow, I was impressed by Fat Angel. I've only been there once, but I know what I like. Fat Angel is simple and comfortable, yet classy and gourmet. I was in the mood for a good beer, I ordered a La Moneuse Saison on draft for my first. It was excellent, love good Belgian beers. I ordered the House Marinated Olives which are Castelvetrano Olives,  my all-time favorite!! They are large, light green olives that are hearty and light. A must if you are a sucker for olives. Next up, we shared the Cheese Platter. This is an easy appetizer for groups. Pick the 5 Cheese platter - it comes with jams and accents to mix and match on your toasted bread. Yummm... I ordered another beer for the dinner portion of our meal and went with the Christoffel Blond. A nice refreshing German Pilsner. For dinner, my friend and I split the wild mushroom & white truffle oil w/ pecorino flat bread and the Endive, apple, candied walnuts, gorgonzola w/ cider vinaigrette salad. I highly recommend Fat Angel for the beer enthusiast. Here is a copy of the libations - fatangelsf.com/libations Everything was perfect. I love dinners like this. A little of this and that, all quality and very tasty. I can't wait to bring other friends here. There is so much to try and that's a tasty thing.

VcPj1gchy48KWnMk4kMI-A.review_text: hnmmm, i'm a bit torn....this place has some potential...and the fact that the owners seem really nice, i'm gonna give them the benefit of the doubt that my experience was first week (or so) jitters.  the good: 1) orange blossom butter...oh yeah!   2) excellent cheeses. 3) huge-ass salad 4) cool venue that offers something a bit different in that area  the bad: 1) i missed amos lee's and brett dennen's performance at the Fillmore that night (okay, that was my fault, not theirs!) 2) spilled glass of water on my friend....well, at least it wasn't wine or something...the tables are a bit small, which makes placement of food a bit awkward. 3) they added bacon to the mac 'n cheez...which wouldn't be an issue for me, but since my friend is a vegetarian... 4) some stuff was stuck on the bottom of some of the bread (assuming it was just on the cutting board....but it took awhile for us to figure out it wasn't mold or something) 5) could do with a bit larger portion of the cheeses (try this: less salad, more cheez!  works like a charm.)  anyway, i will definitely hit this place again....hopefully they will work out some of the issues by then.

efIJCmF7G2BoSEosqQiP8w.review_text: My friends and I stumbled across this hidden gem.  If you are looking for it, you still may not be able to find it. Great wine and the berry cobbler gave me a mouthgasm. Wine suggestion: Textbook

OpBc5-0dTs8OS7cIPQHeVA.review_text: This place totally rocks! I half hope that less people know about it since the crowds can be a bit much to handle, but the food is wicked good, the drinks are just right and the atmosphere, when not too crowded, is very welcoming.

O4cCkQapWhPRmI6RnOmKJw.review_text: Can't wait to go back! I loved the atmosphere and loved the food. My friend and I had the Mac and cheese and chicken pot pie. Both to die for. Also, I usually don't like beer, but I loved the beer with pear flavors (forgot its name)- very light and refreshing!

lzKkZs1pJUpY8_7IU13_Ig.review_text: More than a hundred beer selection, great food; but usually too noisy for any meaningful conversation; if you can find a seat (or a place to stand) and don't mind the noise, this is a lovely neighborhood germ.

32H700jZvaW2P12__eAwMw.review_text: Soo good. There's really not much I can add here that hasn't been said. Fat Angel came recommended to me by several different people. My roommate and I were just waiting for the right time to make our visit. We live in the area and were lucky to come in around 10 and get seated immediately at one of the tables in the corner. Contrary to some of the reviews here, I found everyone who worked there to be really laid back and friendly. One of the servers even stopped everyone during dinner to announce that two veterans of the establishment were recently engaged. The place is small enough that it's intimate but without seeming exclusive, which is probably why it manufactures so many regulars.  And of course, the drinks. Definitely the most extensive collection of craft beers I've ever seen: the menu had about 8 pages of beer and wine, one page of food, and then another page of wine. I wanted to try a beer from the Bruery but wasn't willing to splurge quite yet and opted instead for one from Pretty Things. I also tried a cheese plate and the smoked trout salad based on the reviews here and wasn't disappointed.   Despite the quantity and deliciousness of the food, this is still a bar at heart, so it makes for an interesting inversion of your typical dinner. Simply by the way the menu is set up, you find yourself ordering drinks with a side of food, and butter with a side of bread. Next time I'm trying the chicken pot pie or the flatbread--just need to wait a while so I don't seem too eager.

d8A4EU8sJlKsRAFYYyCO4A.review_text: Love this place, such a charming neighborhood joint if you want an unpretentious to place to relax with friends over wine, beer and light food. I love the laid-back, friendly vibe.  They let you samples a little wine or beer if you can't decide.  The kale salad (add chicken) is so good (and big enough to split), I dream about it.  The mac and cheese is really good, as is the cheese platter.  Really friend servers/bartenders all around.

pvmvgoVjlQf28Ywz3NuD_A.review_text: The intimidate place was quite packed when we dropped in after visiting the Fillmore. The few tables were occupied but we were able to snag spots at the bar.   Beers and wines on tap, and nibbles weren't too bad.  The cheese and meat platter held us over. I had a bite of the chicken pot pie and I think it's one of these best I've ever had (granted, I don't eat much chicken pot pie).  I'm usually not a big fan of bread pudding but the apple bread pudding here was really good- hot, fresh out of the oven, served with a side of whipped cream.  Only complaint is I wish they served it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream instead of the whipped cream.    Something like they reuse their wine bottles and they are made with a different material in order to be more 'green'. I'm a fan of the low-pressure atmosphere here so I definitely can see myself coming back.

G9Vb6yQ047TC3O_-GG4WZA.review_text: With wines made of unicorn tears, pixie dust, crystals and even one guaranteed to take you to Pleasure Town, how can you not adore Fat Angel?   Love this new neighborhood wine bar nicely tucked away off of Fillmore - this tiny spot is great for chilling out with some friends, canoodling with a date or even hanging out solo and chatting it up with the super friendly owners Cyrick and Jason. Also a great place to grab a glass of wine or two pre- or post- concerts at The Fillmore or Yoshi's.   Their wine list is rather diverse with hilarious little descriptions of the wine written by Jason, which actually is what drew me to certain wines over others. I mean how can you not want to try a Syrah that is "Proof that God loves us. This wine will take you on a magic carpet ride to Pleasure Town. Worth every penny. Funky, freaky, delicious." Right? The "Cosmic" Syrah will take you on a trip, and the Tempranillo is magical. For Spring-in-a-glass, make sure you get the Grenache Blanc, and the Chenin Blanc is lovely.  There are also bar bites, cured meats, cheeses, salads, dessert and BUTTER. Get the maple bacon butter - you'll wish you had a jar of it to make a MBB&J sammich at home. The angus beef sliders are crazy good. You'll want to up your order to 4 instead of 3 because they're that delicious.   After several glasses of wine and nibblies, I walked out of here feeling a little bit like a fat angel. Btw, the name has a Chinese connection. My peeps and their silly names.

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: Here's something about me that may or may not surprise you: I grew up Catholic.  Not just church every Sunday, but Christian Bible Preschool and Catholic School for K-6.  I had nuns for teachers.  I had to wear an ugly uniform.  I used to have to read the Bible during class (we got to pick what we read, however, so usually I read the Book of Ruth.  It was only 4 pages.  Or Revelations, because it was cool).  I've completed the sacraments of Baptism, First Reconciliation, First Communion, and Confirmation (Mary Magdalene was my saint).   Despite (or perhaps because of) having spent 18 years as a Catholic, I am what one would consider "lapsed."  I don't go to church.  I don't pray.  I call out God's name in vain all the time.  I am most likely going to whatever hell Catholicism believes in, even if I no longer do believe.  Although I am lapsed, there is something extremely comforting about entering a church, sitting on a cool pew, hearing the sounds of an organ wafting through, eating the wafer, and having some of the Blood of Christ.  Fat Angel is cool and comforting.  As part of a non-traditional St. Patrick's night adventure, a very cool friend (I was cool enough to come here by association) suggested we come here as a last stop.  He had mentioned that it was his favorite "local" many times so I was anxious to try it out, but hadn't the opportunity (meaning I'm clearly not doing a good enough job stalking him).  As this was the end of an already fun evening, I will definitely have to go back to gather more details.  Here's what I do know:  -The owner/bartender is awesome.  He probably thinks I'm less awesome since I was saying lame things, but people really should get used to me saying lame things.  Answered all my questions, even if they were completely random and not appropriate.   -The decor is primarily made up of a church in Napa that was about to be demolished, complete with pews and the pipes from an organ.   It's a place where you can relax and have a soul-searching conversation with a friend, or have a first date.  This place is devoid of snobbery. -Although they don't have a full bar (which I prefer, keeps me out of trouble), they have wine on tap.  I really like this way of doing wine, especially since they have tastes, glasses, half-carafes and full carafes.  I also got a sample of a unique beer. -They have noms.  Really good noms.  An assortment of cheeses, accompanied by crusty bread?  Yummy.  A couple of salty meats?  Double yummy.  My cool friend?  Triple yummy.  Oh wait, he's not on the menu.  Tried one of the sliders as well, which I believe they said they could make without the onions.    Bottom line?  This is my new local, even though it's nowhere near local to me.  I have fallen madly and truly in love with Fat Angel, which probably has Eros hidden somewhere.  Oh god.  Oh FYI, we're having a UYE here.  Soon.

q6QsCHW-ZrJqWYTDLbpF_w.review_text: I was here with my friend exploring new restaurants. We decided to give it a shot since the restaurant is always packed. We ordered a chicken pot pie, pizza and wine. I love their chicken pie, so creamy!! And the pizza is so crunchy! If you are a wine drinker,  you have definitely drop by here!

-qZRwiX6Gr5GOf0fNdmjSg.review_text: This place has awesome food and awesome beers, however the short man with pig tails is very unaccommodating and has terrible customer service skills he refused to sit me and my girlfriend at a "table for 3 or more" as the place was emptying out. Look out for short pig tails man, otherwise this place is 5 stars.

tFId1_3TcZLzp4lhrjYLWg.review_text: This is a perfect spot to grab a bite and a drink before a show at the Fillmore. Warm, cozy, and laid-back all at the same time. Large selection of beer and food that's perfect for sharing among friends - the food here is refined (think cheese and meat plates) without being stuffy (think mac and cheese and sliders). The space is small though, so I wouldn't roll here with 6+ people.  Their mac and cheese was out of this world! There's something in there that gives it a kick - mustard, maybe? Couldn't puzzle it out, but it was delicious!

sx8ZjJCyLFqRwDp0FwVc8A.review_text: I've been to Fat Angel a handful of times and each experience is better than the last!  My first visit was just for wine- which I love having on tap!  The guys behind the bar have great taste and make fantastic suggestions.  Second visit was with a small group and the fun, casual vibe of the bar was perfect.  Third visit was for my birthday and Fat Angel took great care of us.  We were able to snag a few tables and they were attentive, helpful and festive.  Everyone adored the place.  The extensive beer list pleased the dudes and the wine list suited all of our varied tastes.  Bonus, this was the first time I tried the food.  So so good!  Even my pregnant best friend wanted to come back for the pot pie-- and she can't even enjoy the great wines and beers!  Most recently, I tried the bread pudding.  How did I not know of this before!?!  It took four of us to finish it but it was easily the best bread pudding I've ever head.  It's going to have to be a rare treat, though, or I will start to resemble the bar name :)  Fat Angel is perfect for girls night out, small birthdays, dates and... well, any excuse you can come up with!

rtTpEZSTIDSurdw12xZK1Q.review_text: Really chill spot... Came here or hh at 5:30... O problem getting a table.. By 7:30 this place was packed! Started with their fried polenta fries... So bomb! Their Mac n cheese has a lil kick to it and it was soooooooo good :)  one of the best around! I'd definitely go back for the Mac ... Also try their flat bread n chicken pot pie! This is a perfect lil place for great food, wine n catching up with friends!

okXoknbdMCceu_54ryaCvA.review_text: Awesome drink selection and atmosphere.  Perfect place to bring a date for a drink and chat....  Bohemian style

nlOXKiMFj2TI3v8AzFMImQ.review_text: Great place.  Love the ang out and the location.

gAuFcVsETZcod_WKA7lAvw.review_text: Great food, great beer, terrible service.  Don't go with a large group.  Nothing over 4.  We went with 9 people and it took us 1:15 for us all to get our food.  Kitchen's just too small (according to the staff).  Seems like a nice neighborhood joint though.

TEtzbpgA2BFBrC0y0sCbfw.review_text: Loving this place, desperately, though I should note that I went back a few times and discovered Angel's Share is no longer on tap (they still have it in bottles). Apparently, when they finish a keg, they replace the beer with something new. But that's life, isn't it? Out with the old and in with the new... ever on the quest to new human frontiers, the discovery of uncharted experiences to further the depths of the personal mind. The soul, unhinged by time and fueled by the passion of undying persistence, released into the bosom of the night...  I'm still talking about beer.

5Vh7WnVpII9Qtrx45ExtPw.review_text: Tonight I went to hop into my car and found my window busted and my stuff ransacked. So I was sad, called all the people I needed to call to report everything, taped it up, and then needed something to calm me down and lift my spirits.   A friend had told me he'd had a really nice evening at Fat Angel the other weekend, so I made my way over and snuggled up to the bar. I was one of those annoying people who wasn't sure whether I wanted a draft Syrah or draft Stout, so I made the bartender help me figure it out. Star #1 is for the fact that they had both draft Syrah and 2 stouts (among other fantastic drink options), and Star #2 is for the sweet bartender who was patient enough to help me find my way to a fantastic stout that hit the spot.  Wanting to eat my feelings -- but just a little -- I then made the bartender help me decide between a cheese plate and a butter plate. I went with the Chocolate Cinnamon butter with toasted bread, which earned Star #3 because it. was. perfection.  Star #4 is for the ambience. I felt totally comfortable writing birthday cards to family and friends while sitting at the bar with my stout and butter. Laid back, not too pretentious -- unless you were one of the fancy pretentious people there, then I guess it could be your scene, too. What I'm saying is, the place is as fancy or low-key as you wanna make it, which I really appreciated.  Star #5 is because I left so happy that I almost forgot about my busted window.

iC1qdNGeFwx_FQd0L8mASA.review_text: To be clear, I can't comment on the food.   Fat Angel is incredibly charming, and it has an incredible beer list. What it lacks is service.   First off, we were quoted a 40-minute wait -- not bad for 7:30 on a Saturday -- but that 40 minutes quickly turned into an hour wait. With no end in sight, we patiently sat at the bar... For another 15 minutes.   Just as we were nearing our breaking point, a couple who had JUST walked in was seated immediately. As it turned out, the front patio -- which had been mostly empty durning our wait -- was first-come-first-served, that just isn't disclosed. The hostess made it seem like we should have known that on our own.   Overall, this is a great place for a beer, but it would appear that they treat guests like cattle -- herded when convenient, and unremarkable. We won't go back to find out what we missed.

QnoN3SNip50oBtgjXmfGYQ.review_text: Get the mac & cheese and the sliders! The mac & cheese is big enough to share and has a delicious breadcrumb/bacon crust and the sliders are so tasty! Perfect with the jalapenos.   If you're a pinot noir fan, definitely try the Ministry of Vinterior pinot-- smooth and delish!

yyMFryM7SGiaUk-n-veWBA.review_text: If you enjoy being condescended to by someone who makes less than $30,000 a year, this is your place.

VZCIRWl-9KCs-OKV9F0uQA.review_text: I love Fat angel! It is an excellent atmosphere, fantastic beer and wine selection, and those sliders...forget it. I have a hard time ordering anything but, the sliders when I go even though I know there are some other really great options, I think it's the aioli and sauteed onions that do it. If you are looking for a small but fun place to bring a group of friends, this is the place. Love it!

5isObQlrdJsGTcgrcoQSxg.review_text: Perfect ambiance. Music, lighting, decor---all lovely. It is an intimate space, and they don't take reservations, so plan accordingly.  I had a 3 for $14 cheese and meat board. This also comes with bread, quince, figs, mustard, and assorted nuts. Very nice presentation. They also appear to have a fine selection of wine and beer. Romantic and cool, I love this little place.

d1sLYlfSzHo6WCpfe-j7zg.review_text: My friend and I were roaming around just bar hopping around the area.  I saw that Fat Angel was around and wanted to come here since I found out about it.  We went in and had a few beers.  Love that they had an eclectic beer list and wine list.  It was super late almost closing so we just decided to drink and have a good conversation.  I'd definitely go back just to try some of the snacks and such...Intimate small place good for a few friends and/or date.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: Um...well a bit Marina-eech-yuck! and Angels should be glamorous in my vision it's just ..too blah for my palate, but go there if you need an squeezy place to venture into I guess it caters towards the high rise clientele across the street that is in the mood for this type of place..

z24TlX4zmefe6BCmk2gMfA.review_text: So, I was given the task of finding a place to go for dinner/drinks before going to see MGMT last night at the Fillmore. I searched around on Yelp for places in the area so we could just park one time and walk over to the show afterwards. I found this place on here and saw the good reviews so we decided to try it out. We got here around 6 p.m. and sat up at the bar. The bartender was very attentive and nice! The place became very crowded as the evening went on, probably because of the show at the Fillmore. It was fun, classy and overall a stellar time! It was a place to go for food, wine, good beers and you can laugh in there without the whole place noticing even though it is a smaller place. We ordered the boar salami, truffle oil mushroom flatbread, a bleu cheese, maple bacon butter, lemon caper butter, bacon macaroni and cheese, sliders and chicken pot pie. This was more than enough food for four very hungry people!  All of the food was very good with the only disappointment being the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was only luke warm and very bland. Next time I would opt for a salad because they were huge and looked amazing. It seemed like the kitchen was a bit disorganized if they were busy but I am sure that will be worked out in time, they are fairly new. As for the drinks we ordered the Pinot Nior on tap, Pranqster beer, a specialty bottle beer and a glass of each of the two Pinots. The 2006 Carneros Pinot was out of this world, highly recommend it. The highlights definitely were that Pinot, maple bacon butter, macaroni and cheese and the truffle oil flatbread. I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere and experience and will go back soon, even when I am not going to see a show at the Fillmore.

TZfzRkGpPdmqUcqNhXMB3A.review_text: Hrm... was it just me? So many people rave about this place and I came with high expectations but I was a little disappointed... I guess I expected everything to taste a lot better but nothing really was to my liking.  Polenta fries: first few bites was good... sorta seemed like I was forcing myself to eat it... the taste was a bit weird to me, kinda tastes like a lot of olive oil, and found myself drowning the fries in ketchup to kind of make it taste better... When the fries became cool... it tasted just awful. Wasn't a fan.  Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage flat bread: this was pretty good. I really liked the ricotta and sausage!  Mac n cheese: The toppings were delicious and perfect but below the toppings seemed really dry... a bit hard to swallow? Regardless, the toppings made up for it, I guess.  Sliders: no no no! First bite was SOOO GOOD... then it just felt really oily and buttery and eck... made me feel a bit sick after.  Chicken pot pie: I've had better... a bit too thick and creamy for my taste.  I dont know... I really wish I could give this place more stars but I really wasn't impressed. Maybe it was just an off day for the kitchen... I'd like to come back and give it another go though. (:  Really nice ambiance though!

V-FQrY4cAOJ6fWN0OyHh4Q.review_text: Love this place. It's romantic and cozy. A lot good drinks and food.

CCXOjIfqaYNL4poA-dTRSQ.review_text: The food I had in Fat Angel was pretty good! I felt so lucky to have ordered chicken pot pie, it was incredible delicious!!! The crispy pie was filled with tender chicken, and creamy potato soup, tasted really good! The price came out reasonable too.   The ambiance was good to people hanging at the bar as a group, but maybe a little bit loud to sit at the tables. But generally for the service we got, I'd give Fat Angel 5 stars!

PMSaoh6ej_SzJaCoWgSJLA.review_text: Wine: Sauvignon Blanc Ambiance: Cozy, quaint, great choice of a playlist (; Service: 1/2 of the ownership was managing the place the night I came in and he was incredibly quirky and very helpful.  Selection: Their beer selection is pretty extensive. Their wines could be added to. I'm a big riesling fan and dude tells me that it's rather dry. I didn't understand until he gave me a taste test. SO DRY. Like a dessert IN YOUR MOUTH. Just kidding.   Came back home to the bay for Spring Break and popped in here after Barrique closed at 10pm (why would ANY place that serves alcohol close at 10pm on a Friday night?). Awesome replacement.   If this place has an actual sweet riesling or a moscato the next time I drop in, it's an automatic 5 star :D

0G-QF457q_0Z_jKqh6xWiA.review_text: Ohhhh, sweet darling Angel... you have wine on tap . Good wine. And every inch and ounce of this place is lovely!! Sweet, darling Fat Angel, will you marry me?  The wine on tap thing is a novelty that some bars will make you pay dearly for. Fat Angel offers up an affordable full glass. Never say cheap. I need not go on about the bread and butter you should order. By the way, I never *ever* say you should order bread and butter. In fact, I would normally never say the bread and butter that is given to you gratis in most restaurants is something worth filling up on. So, trust me on this one.   What really made this place for me, though, is the hospitality. The place was packed and I walked in with a rather large group that would have flustered the best of 'tenders. I shockingly embarrassed myself (/sarcasm) by leaning on the wall and making the lights go from kindly dim to harsh and bright... I know, I know, how dare I? The lady bartender fixed the problem without issue (if it were me, I can't deny there'd be some snark involved). By the way, this same bartender told us that we were a beautify group.   I might add that this was *after* the brightening incident.   Fat Angel, you are, so so very fat...if by "fat" you mean generous in spirit.
