vH4ac_IkrPtVyBP-i0GTBw.review_text: i was excited about trying out a new spot - fat angel had a promising wine list (in variety and price), fun food options, and a cute neighborhood spot... but my optimistic outlook took a turn when an unruly patron was seated next to us.  he was clearly drunk and largely incoherent, and yelled at his date in between taking swigs of wine and slamming his glass onto the table.  i have to admit, his abrasive presence tainted our experience.  and the management didn't seem to mind - i think he might have been a friend, but it really detracted from the atmosphere.  in any case, the wines were decent (one of them, a chocolaty red was actually quite delicious), and the flatbread was tasty.  however, the cheese plate was rather scant, and the fried capers were greasy and burnt.  service was very friendly, but overall experience was rather disappointing.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: What a Fun neighborhood gastropub!  - Great service: everyone running the bar was friendly and fun despite the Craaaaazy Saturday crowd. Wonderful ambience too  - Very generous with their drinks  - Skip the Apple Bread Pudding- i'm sorry, but it was really disgusting; the worst dessert i'd eaten in a while. Texturally gummy and hard, flavor-wise- absolutely flavorless. It was like chewing a gummy flour ball swimming in a plate of whipped cream (or was it melted ice cream? i don't even know)  - My friend seemed to enjoy the mushroom flatbread, so i guess the food is not entirely bad. Just the bread pudding  HIghly recommend except for dessert (please do something about it! I really want to get a good dessert there!)

_aSs5dSAabuwnXUGBPzASw.review_text: Date & Time:  Friday February 5, 2010 @ 6pm Crowd:  Good Mix of  Unpretentious Neighborhood Peeps Dining Solo & Couples in North Face Vests Vibe:  Casual & Charming     Music:  Cool Mix of Alternative & Jazz- Sarah Vaghn & Etta James  Decor:  Rustic & Cozy.  Candle-Lit,  Wooden Bar, Ornate Chandeliers, Train Station Benches, Leather Club Chairs.  Service:  The Owners are Nice, Genuine & Earnest.  The Best Ever. Imbibe:  Extensive Wine List.  We had Beer & Espresso to Top off The Meal Devour:  Complimentary Homemade Cured Olives, Bread Served in Lunch Bag, Plate of Sopressata & Hot Coppa w/ Housemade Jelly & Nuts, Chicken Pot Pie, Sliders, Mac & Cheese Total:  $53.65 Note:  My Top Pick

zSLVUcFSpMYFWT7FxT1J6g.review_text: Sumptuous.  Humble.  Smart.  A hidden diamond in the rough of the Fillmo', upon entrance, Fat Angel could be mistaken for a lost Marina wine bar.  Upon closer look, however, you'll find two adorably scruffy males unpretentiously traipsing around, dispensing their genuine charm.    The love and dedication of  pals and owners Cyric (?) and Jason is evident in their thoughtfully honest plates. Subtly sweet roasted grapes complement pungent gorgonzola pebbles on warm flatbread.   Unsnobby wine snobs can finally be as cool as the beer kids and order a variety of wines on tap. Talk to Cyric or Jason about the science behind this madness. Cool!  Think up-scale hole-in-the-wall. Great for splitting plates and second dates :)  ~$20-30 for a good time/person

LRoOy5XCalclmzkoI6XK1g.review_text: This place is a great asset to our neighborhood. Jason is super friendly, the food is good and the selection of wines is really fun. You can tell that these people have poured their heart and soul into getting Fat Angel going, and I plan to support it with regular visits.

Lw6agCKyeuFa0yR_JzQALw.review_text: Great little establishment close to where we live.  Great for a small bite, such as their wonderful flatbread with different toppings, cheese tray etc paired up with a glass of wine - large selection or draft beer.  Prices are reasonable and perfect for that late afternoon, early evening "snak & drink" .

xi94GOYwC9SXlxy3G1ZoZg.review_text: Mac and cheese + endive salad = life changed. what a gem to find! and totally impressed my mom who loves good wine and small places!

mvK1pv-x0Z5rP4Hz9cWBWw.review_text: **GOOD COMFORT FOODS AND GOOD WINES**  Perfect place to grab a few bites and quench your wine thirst before hitting an 8PM performance at Yoshi's.  Small, comfortable, and chill.  Flat breads, sliders, and mac cheese were ordered.   I liked the flat breads the best. Thin, flavored well with the gourmet cheese and mushrooms.  I had a refreshing Reisling which went well with the small plates.  The staff was friendly and efficient.   Food came out quickly.  It was not a wine bar.   Beers and other appealing cocktails were also on the menu.  Check out the overhead chalkboard for ideas and specials, too.  RECOMMEND for FILLMORE.

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: What a great spot - I wish I had a neighborhood bar like this. It's a small little place where seating is reserved for people who are dining, so bar patrons are limited to about a half-dozen bar stools.   They have an extensive menu of beers on tap and by the bottle and wines also. The bartenders were gave good, honest recommendations (one of them steered my friend away from a beer that he wouldn't recommend) and were really friendly and responsive.   It's the perfect place to pop in for a drink (or two) while you're waiting for your table at State Bird Provisions.

d-_qOGepn5PURfl0DEfXGg.review_text: This is a cozy spot with a handful of tables in addition to window and bar seating.   Contrary to other reviews, we arrived later and didn't have trouble getting a table.  I did seem to fill up and clear out in waves though.  The vibe was laid back and intimate.  It is a great place to relax with a drink and good company and conversation.   They had an extensive beer and wine selection.  They also had wine on tap (!!!!).  It was reasonably priced and delicious.  The service was also very attentive and friendly.   We didn't try the food but we certainly did a lot of ogling of others' plates.  We will definitely be back to try the sliders and mac & cheese.  And of course, more wine on tap.

wQXRDOf7Wnu6K1cKO_bjzg.review_text: Had this place bookmarked for a while, finally had a chance to try it Thursday 5/3/12. Walked right in with a friend of mine around 7pm.  Nice dark and intimate atmosphere; perfect for a date, or catching up with an old friend.   I'll cut right to the chase. Here's what we ordered... -House Olives $4 Simple marinade of olive oil and maybe garlic. No variety, only the green olives not pitted. Where my Kalamata's at?! Got very redundant, needed more herbs. -Maple bacon butter w/ bread $4.50 Some wheat bread and maple bacon butter. Maple Bacon butter was interesting. Overall meh. I was sold with the maple bacon butter. s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… -Wipeout Lager 23oz $8.50 Nice full bodied dark beer. -Peter Brown Ale 23oz $8.50 -Sliders $10 for 3, we added $3 for 1 more. Delicious!! Bun was soft, bacon, caramelized onions, aioli. Came together so nicely, best slider I have ever had, hands down.     -3 cured meats ( duck salami, speck, chorizo)  $15. Duck salami was melt in your mouth, chorizo was a bit oily, but the mustard and bread countered it nicely. Had to ask for more mustard, they only give you a small half dollar sized dollop. Tons of those little baguettes.  This was perfect. s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com… Conclusion: We ordered a lot, since it was our first time, we wanted to get a taste of everything.  Next time I come back, which will be very soon, i'm going to order the sliders, 3 meats and a few beers.  Skip the apps, olives, bread, go straight for the good stuff! Total was $58.05 for two, before tax.  Quite reasonable, given how much we ordered. I definitely recommend this spot.     s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com… -1 star for the waitress explaining to me that butter is churned milk.  I won't go into that, but thank you; I now know what butter is.

kkteyLV-nBhNcyi-mwUIBw.review_text: Cute place.  Great wine - got the 'draft' pinot which was cheap and fantastic.  The downside?  The food.  Sliders: overdone and the buns were burned.  Badly.  The mac n cheese needed more better, stickier cheese and wasn't warm enough.  So go for the wine and atmosphere.  And go down the street to eat.  P.S. the flat bread did look really good but I did not get it.

wnwSsp30k5nSdkUiRVlIpw.review_text: Wine list is great.  Beer list is great.  Ambiance is really nice - casual but not divey, pretty interior, not ridiculously loud even though it was pretty packed.    Service was super friendly and helpful, and everything we ordered was really tasty.  The little wine descriptions are hilarious, too.    If I lived in this neighborhood, I'd be a regular.

XxTf-dF1lfOBgLGV-mbyfg.review_text: Chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie, chicken pot pie!  The best ever!  Along with an outstanding beer list, delightful wine selections, cheese plates and charcuterie boards, this place is far, far better than the State Bird...seriously

nBjDbEt7c3210153O9PV-w.review_text: This nice and cozy gastropub located just a stone throw away from Japantown offers great wines, beers and eats.  The eclectic mix of various new and old world wines is certainly more than adequate for a night of drinks and food. It probably wouldn't get noticed by WineSpectator, but the selection should be satisfactory to all but the most snobbish wine drinkers. The beer list is several pages long and quite a few are on tap as well. I'm more of a wine drinker than a beer drinker myself. But since this place is clearly known for the beers they serve, I just told the bartender that I liked hefeweizens and just give me whatever they have on tap that was closest to it. I don't remember the name of the beer I got, but I was happy with it.  From the kitchen I ordered the Basil pesto, black olives, roasted tomatoes & sausage w/ ricotta flat-bread. The bread itself was paper thin and crunchy yet still strong enough to support the tasty toppings. My only complaint is that I think sausage is a bit overpowering flavorwise. It still went well with my beer.  The waitress suggested I try the mac n' cheese which I ordered as well. She warned me that it was very hot. I dismissed her warning thinking she probably has to say that to everyone because she has to deal with a lot of people who are not used to eating spicy food. When the mac n' cheese arrived, I was a bit surprised because it was hot! Not so spicy that it was inedible, but spicy enough that you really wanted that beer to take the burn away.  Only two bartenders were holding down the fort all night and I must say that they did an excellent job of making sure everything was ok and getting all the drinks out.  This place is super popular with the locals. Either get here early or expect to wait.

CRQxUA153gfihCM7eR8psA.review_text: I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. My friend can't get enough of this place because the Wine and Beer selections are so unique and plentiful. I guess for that alone most who want that should give it 4 or 5 stars.  I admit that the space is unique. I guess it used to be part of an old church or something because the remanents of an original organ is in there and there are some restored wood seating (pews?).   It always seems to be happening, but it's just so tiny, it seems the other tables are always on top of you and when it's full it's hard to hear anything over the din. Some unique and decent food like Flatbread and Good Mac and Cheese. If it was a little cheaper, I'd go more stars, but a solid 3.5

qHlqfLpkHMkv9GWO21vtTA.review_text: My all-time fav. I used to live in the neighborhood and this was my favorite restaurant. It's so warm and cozy inside, with good energy and great decor. They serve amazing cheese and meat boards and they have a wonderful beer and wine selection. Love Love.

zAxVTy0LH5QHxEQfzpk3sg.review_text: I've been coming here since opening day, I can't believe this is my first review of the place. I have loved it from the start, not too many places this close to home with such an incredible beer selection. They also have an awesome list of wines, my favorites being on tap. I have tried the flatbreads, mac n cheese,sliders, and the caeser salad, all of which were very tasty! The salads come family style, sharable 3-4 people. And delicious!! The vibe in here is cool and casual, with a beautifully lit ambiance from the candles and smooth reclaimed bar,equipped with brass pipes from an old church organ. On a warm night, drink/dine at one of the outdoor tables overlooking the Fillmore Center Plaza. From my long-winded review, I guess you could say I heart Fat Angel:)

UVs_7nPjqK_W_ap96IClpA.review_text: Had my last meal here before I headed off to Taiwan!  My boyfriend, my mom and I arrived around 5 PM and we were the only ones there, which was nice because we had the undivided attention of the servers. We ordered the sausage flatbread, the endive salad and the smoked trout with greens. My mom also ordered a coffee which was freshly made, one cup at a time. It was delicious!  The food didn't take long to come out but at first we thought they had forgotten to give us the additional chicken we ordered for the endive salad. They didn't forget, they just brought it out later so no problem there. I really enjoyed the sausage flatbread because the bread was really thin and the arugula went really well with the sausage and tomato. I think I ate about half of it by myself lol. The endive salad was pretty good but I wouldn't recommend ordering the chicken as a side, because it was pretty dry. The trout on the other hand was very tasty, and the greens were delicious.  We didn't order any drinks (aside from the coffee), so I can't comment on that except for the fact that 75% of the menu encompassed libations which was interesting. It also can be a bit difficult to flag down your server once it gets busy; my mom needed another coffee and she had to go up to the bar to let them know.

zbpgJq1wytWcD-msl_xySQ.review_text: Yikes! Terribly (and I mean TERRIBLY) rude waitstaff; I have been here twice and both times witnessed the male server snap at someone at my table. Seriously, why the need for the major attitude?   Giving it two stars only because they have wine on draft and a delicious mac & cheese. This place could be a favorite of mine if the service weren't so bad (and if it weren't so cramped and difficult to get a table).  Sadly I won't be back.

8DNiwBb0__aB3WehK4JYCg.review_text: Why have I been avoiding wine bars for so long? Oh, right, it's because all the ones near me are jerk-saturated. Fat Angel, however, is not. This lovely little wine bar is sort of out of place in Western Addition, but it attracts an incredibly nice crowd of people. I was pleasantly surprised by how chill everyone was at this place. Definitely a refreshing change from the pop-collarey in the northern part of the city. Plus, the wine selection is quite extensive (as it should be) and the decor is comfortable. I'm definitely coming back here and ordering food. And more wine.

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: I wish I could say that this place sucks and persuade Yelpers to not come here, but that of course would be all for selfish reasons... so that it wasn't so damn busy all the time I have a craving for their Textbook Cab and Endive salad!  I must admit that I probably come here too often with my random dates. So I'm pretty sure the bartenders & rest of staff find that pretty comical, but hell if a guy asks me out and asks me for my suggestions, well Fat Angel is definitely on my list!  It's a perfect date place. I love that it's not  huge or generic. The vintage cozy decor reminds me each and every time why I love living in the city. The cool inviting bar with the organ-like pipes way above, the enormous elk greeting everyone who arrives, and my favorite: the chandelier that reminds me of the one on James Cameron:  The Titanic. Oh I forgot the  charming dining area has actual pews from a church. The overall vibe and clientele is somewhat eclectic and granola, so no need to dress up, but who really does in SF unless it's a high-end sit-down dinner.  Small food menu but amazingly delicious. My favorites as mentioned earlier is the Endive salad but also love the flatbread with mushrooms with truffle... yummmm:) It's just beer and wine here... not  a beer drinker, but they seem to always have  quite a list. Wine... well another reason why i come here.  Jenny the sommelier has great suggestions; she's usually behind the bar. The only negative thing i have to say about this place is when it is busy, service can be painfully slow. So I try to come when it's not:)

e05okiXJyLGWq2BVm8sTKw.review_text: This place has horrible food and service. They have a limited menu and can not master the items on it! The staff took forever and were rude (always pointing at the costumers). If you are into the local brews, this place offers an interesting variety. Not being from the area, we asked both the bar tender and the waitress about the beers and they had no type of description that would be helpful.   Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone.

N4vrCmOtE830eeNCXnTL3g.review_text: I love Fat Angel. I cannot say enough kind things about this place. Such a charming & inviting place. I loved that the owner remembered us from our visit a year prior. A cool guy. You can tell he has a passion for wine, beer & good eats.  The wine & beer menu is attractive and everything on the food menu that we have tried has been a winner. This includes: The 5 butter platter (Who wants to eat butter by the spoonful? Not me, that is not until I sampled the Mmm, Butter! platter. Holy crap the cinnamon chocolate butter was insanely delicious. I have since internet stalked Mmm, Butter! so I can buy her butter by the tubs). The 5 cheese platter, awesome. The Sliders, simple yet really flavorful. Endive salad, decent & yummy. FA's Chicken Pot Pie, oh snap. Mac-Daddy's Mac & Cheese, sinful! The Apple bread pudding w/ Chantilly cream, so fantastic that I'm salivating just thinking about it. And lastly, the Blueberry Cobbler, YUUUM!   It's a good thing I live 40 miles away from this place. Otherwise I would be a frequent visitor and I'd put on a bunch of weight.

yXaoYUkBiLbKaCW0TdGMZg.review_text: Very cool casual-elegant lounge in the Fillmore. Wide and interesting selection of unique beers and wines on tap for decent prices with a selection of snacks like cheeses, salami, mac and cheese, sliders, etc. Not really a dinner place, more of an after-dinner/late-night spot. The wine list is written in a fun, accessible way.  Perfect for hanging with any amount of friends, whether it's catching up with one pal or filling one of the bigger tables and getting stuff to share. In my experience it's been crowded/full but we never had to wait... it's relatively noisy but that's to be expected where people are drinking, eating, and making merry :) In its way it kind of reminds me of an old fashioned tavern, though the decor is classy.  Servers are efficient and friendly enough, but not overly so.  This is more of a 4.5 review. The only thing I really had a problem with... and this is just my preference, at the time I went they had a lack of any quality "lighter" beers. For their entire list/selection, even after I asked the bartender, there was only 1 lager that was very cheap compared to the others. I really enjoy Belgian beers, wheat beers, etc, and from a place that aims to have an extensive beer list I wanted more of my favorite beer "genre" to choose from! Although... checking their menu now I see a Belgian listed called "Beer of the Future".... I MUST RETURN FOR THAT. Further scrutiny shows that more such beers have appeared on their list, so I guess I can give them a whole-hearted 5 stars next time!  Oh yes, and did I mention they have MAPLE. BACON. BUTTER.??  EDIT: They serve brunch now on Saturday (during the Farmer's Market in the Fillmore area) and have an unusual/different selection, although you could get "normal" items too (eggs, sausage, bacon, etc). I had a really tasty breakfast sandwich. My roomie got a pink mimosa (pricey but good) and the breakfast potatoes, which were seriously good and a pretty big portion for $4! My other friend got the "Ploughman's Lunch" which is a nice little salami/cheese/fruit plate that comes with a small beer (though he traded it out for OJ, ha). Overall it was enjoyable but getting any "adult" beverages hikes up the tab quickly. The food/normal drinks are reasonably priced.

dmyZ4TDN18z1-mRRdzY_8A.review_text: Pretty impressed with the Mac-N-Cheese. I mean, it's not like grandma used to make, but what is... right? Still, it was good. Kinda had a zinger feel to it. Or maybe that was the Mikkeller sour I had, which was equally delicious.  My friend got the salmon salad. It was also really good. Chunks of potato(e), and a tasty vinaigrette. She had the Coronado 18th Anniversary (two, actually), which was delectable. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and attentive.  I definitely recommend this place!

6AkCF3KmnDU2Z-s3vjH8sw.review_text: I lived around the corner from this place and after a while mastered the "go-to" hours..  Perfect date-nite location, very small and intimate.. I was partial to the caesar salad with rotisserie chicken... yumm  The mac and cheese is also killer..  This is the place where you go, sit and enjoy the ambiance. There aren't many of its kind left.

xT15DPvgtyU799LLXpKzIQ.review_text: I really really like this place. You can eat butter like cheese, great wine with even better descriptions. Food and service are tops. Fantastic place to meet up with friends.

1eFJXbzad-ye0heUyI-1Qw.review_text: We came here after walking a friend home to the Fillmore Center.  This establishment doesn't fit the norm of the other places in the neighborhood.  The neighborhood are a mixture of Korean restaurants,fast food establishments, Jazz bars & Yoshi's.  So it was a pleasant surprise to stumble upon this place  Nice choice of wines and beers.  Friendly knowledgeable staff.  The prices were right in line with other wine bars.  I can't comment on the food since we didn't order.   Will come back.

599lvnTQ2tLYEhkIbUeL4w.review_text: I really like the ambiance here. It's small and cozy, but hip and modern. The wine list is superb, the bartender (and only person working the front on a Monday night) was friendly and knowledgeable.   We tried the special zucchini flatbread and the mushroom flatbread. Both were exquisite. Healthy pizza on a cracker.   Also worth mentioning - the softest toilet paper I've ever experienced in a public place! And I usually don't care about such things.  My only complaint was that it was a bit pricey. My friend and I had two flatbreads and two glasses of wine each - we shared a third - and we spent about $60. If you stick to the Happy Hour menu, you could lower that considerably.

IJABCqLsGgT8DxqujUQmiA.review_text: On the one hand, I want this to remain a hidden gem and not be flooded by hipsters who don't live in this neighborhood. On the other hand, the owners were awesome and I want this place to succeed so I can continue to indulge myself. So, I fight down my bad angel and write a five star review for Fat Angel.   Wine by draft (who knew?) was good, beer selection was totally awesome and the food was GREAT. The owners were working the place and I just adored them. And lots of drinks and snacks for four people was well under the usual price tag for SF.  The owners are gonna know me and hubby by sight in no-time.

yUss9L_5fZVDK-5pBgagFA.review_text: Just went here for beers before a show at the Fillmore. Small space but great selection of beers, servers/bartenders were super attentive and nice, and had a great vibe all around. Didn't eat here but definitely will come back so I can.

hcRNyf83QjKtVeTdEuowtQ.review_text: This place is really close to my apartment, which is already a big plus. But the chicken pot pie is what really gets my attention. So delicious! And very pretty on the plate, too. Aside from the pot pie, I also got some slices of bresaola as a starter. The bread they had to go with the meat was good (not amazing but solid). One of these days I'm going to go back and try the Mac and cheese... but it will be hard to turn away from that pot pie.....

Z2PISdtGHThSUUbFccGkrA.review_text: Who you calling fat?  Exotic, rare beers on tap.  Capers in their take on the Caeser salad MMM.  Usually busy, but tables turn fast. They won't disappoint.

RvKrK-s5wN6FwxKWH2Ltug.review_text: I aim for variety when it comes to food/drink, especially since our fair city lends itself well to culinary discovery. However, when it comes to establishments that do it well (and consistently), I am a creature of habit.   Fat Angel does not have an extensive menu, but what they do have is a well-balanced selection of basics. The outlined food categories nicely fit one page... and it covers the necessities: Appetizers (Angel's Share), Cheese, Meat, Butter, Greens, Flatbread, Plates. The kale salad is unmatched - marcona almonds,  bacon, and the right touch of champagne dressing. No arguments about the chicken pot pie, as it is exactly how I envision a perfect savory pie to be (probably used a cup full of butter to have reached said perfection, but who's caring?). The spicy mac/cheese is pure bliss on a mini skillet. Still want more, you say? The Grape/Gorgonzola/Prosciutto flatbread is the way to go.  Are you judging my diet yet? Did you miss the part about me crushing on a salad?   Oh the beers. Amazing beers on tap that rotate frequently based on season and featured microbrews. Some of the best variety offered in SF, but you end up liking one - drink up, as chances are that beer will be gone in 2 days and it may be while until they get another limited batch. They also have an excellent selection of bottled beers that covers a range of palates. Wine on tap more your groove? I've only tried the Sauvignon Blanc (Martella?) and Pinot Noir (Copain), both decent, but in a place like Fat Angel - with all the beer selections and so little time? Go for the brew.   The staff knows their stuff. Friendly, fun, and - I'll emphasize this - patient. You in need of figuring out what kind to get, given the otherwise intimidating selection? Engage them in conversation, and they'll make several recommendations (armed with samples)... after which you complete your selection and indulge happily. Let this be a lesson to other establishments: It pays to have a crew who is knowledgeable and passionate about the very things the place stands for. Need I spell out why? Because they generate fans who, not only (willingly) shell out $XX regularly for food and drinks, but ones who give gratitude over a public space like Yelp - even at the risk of getting a longer wait for a table on a Friday night.

yN3cBeSdhtFRcFPdLgDlbw.review_text: When I think of angels, I think of Charlie and his bevy of beauties, or those svelte VS models in their underwear and stilettos (because thats is EXACTLY what women do at home boys..we like to do housework in matching lingerie and 4 inch heels..pfsh).  Anyhoo... When I think of fat angels I think of cherubic funny little butterballs with wings and trouble on their minds or me after I have eaten a donut.  So imagine my amusement when I saw in the pouring rain, the way to Fat Angel because of the shiny golden angel they have floating above their entrance. It is SO like a sign from the heavens right?!?  WELL....this place is an utter and absolute gem. It is smaller than what I thought, but it made for a really cozy, intimate atmosphere which is perfect for a girls night out, a romantic date or a nice glass of wine by yourself at the bar after a long day. The gorgeous chandelier is brilliant in its sparkly goodness (yay sparkles!) and the decor is rustic old man cigar  room charm.  I ordered a nice glass of viognier and enjoyed some cheese and salami appetizers and then had the sliders.                                          OMG.  The sliders? What can I say? They were pure, unadulterated deliciousness on a lightly buttered bun with this amazing garlic aioli that had me licking my fingers  and moaning with pleasure like some sort of porn star. A--mazing. I don't know how the mac and cheese or the pot pie taste, but if they are half as good as the sliders, I'm going to have to watch it before I make a one woman spectacle of myself in the corner.  The service was great and friendly. They were busy so it was a little bit of time before I got my order in, but it was also a small staff serving a bunch of people and I was in absolutely no rush. But the bartender and the servers were super friendly and down to earth.  I am excited to have this great place in the neighborhood as the Fillmore needs some more down to earth and classy establishments (without the hype of a place like Yoshis).  It adds a nice member to my repertoire of places to go out and I highly recommend it.  *Unless of course you take up a seat when I want to go there in which case move it buddy or else a fat angel is going to be coming for you.*

xabFKJmDfca06U501y5fQQ.review_text: This is a nice new spot in the Fillmore. They have a great wine list, and have both wine and beer on tap!   We stopped in last night before heading to the Kabuki Theater to see a movie. Food portions are more like tapas style (but American cuisine). There isn't a ton of variety, but we had a nice cheese plate, a LARGE salad with smoked trout, and a serving of homemade mac & cheese. The trout was delicious & fresh. The mac & cheese was very nice, but probably not worth $9.  It's a little on the high-end for it to become a regular spot, but it's a great place to come in for a drink and a bite to eat before going out in the Fillmore.

UD1ENQnxnx5vfAQX6hg_sQ.review_text: Visited this place after lounging at Sheba Ethiopian Piano Bar: yelp.com/biz/sheba-piano….  Within walking distance and what an amazing find!  Quaint, unpretentious wine bar with an impressive grape selection.  Ordered a tasty cheese sampling with preserve accompaniments that topped off our wines beautifully.  Staff friendly, willing and able to converse in conversation.  Spoke with the owners and they mentioned that the bar was made from a gutted out pipe organ and surrounding wood reclaimed from an old chapel.  The dramatic chandelier was brought in piece by piece from Pennsylvania. Nice ambiance with just enough wood, low lighting and a marble bar top.  Seriously wish this was in my neck of the woods.  Relatively new addition and from what I gather a welcome injection into a burgeoning neighborhood.

bdJqgpcvSQSzxnpBVz4VCg.review_text: BBJ like.  Huge selection of wines by the glass and bottled beers.  Supposed to have draft beer as well, but I didn't see it nor was it mentioned.  Food was good, prices fair, and good portions.  Friendly service as well.  The chicken pot pie was uniquely presented.

3ZryDbh4uD2RmqaAip2okA.review_text: I'm always a fan of great food, great beer and reasonable prices! The beer selection is extensive, and everyone working there seemed very knowledgeable and willing to answer questions.  The food was shareable, so we tried several things and really liked what we had.  We started with the polenta fries, which were crispy on the outside and soft and delicious on the inside. I liked the mayo sauce, but the herbed ketchup was a little strange.  We also got the truffled mushroom flatbread, which was good, but I would've liked a little more cheese and a little less salt. The sliders were simple and delicious. The meet was juicy and the cheese was melty. Our last dish was the mac and cheese, which was also delicious. The cayenne added a kick! I would definitely go back.

kUsBcitmM0_vY9uLba5VQg.review_text: The food was ok.  The server forgot to put our order in - honest mistake but it doesn't make up for the fact we waited too long for our food and she didn't even comp one drink.  I'm all about customer service, and to keep a customer you at least need an apology and offer to comp a small item - a cheap one for that matter.  On top of this the hostess said the wait was going to be 40 minutes - once again a fair assessment, but we weren't seated until an hour and a half had gone by.  Once again, not their fault, but they should know how they usually operate and give a better estimate.

QH1EXfQ7cQhImKfVnKwJxA.review_text: Fat Angel is located right next to the busy Fillmore St., and is obverse to a small park. At nighttime, the whole park is lighten up by a blue LED light projected from the top of a marvelous building. The effect turns the park into a visionary scene from the movie Avatar. It's really quite beautiful.  The cute fat angel statue is hanging on the restaurant, smiling and waving to every incoming customer.  An interesting fact is that Fat Angel doesn't carry mainstream beers. My beer-drinker boyfriend had no idea what to order when there were strange beer brands from that stretched from England to the Netherlands and everywhere in-between. Finally, the owner recommended us to try an English bitter: Engels Brouwerij De Molen. The beer had a similar taste to my Alan's favorite beer, Blue Moon. Compared to Blue Moon, the body of Engels is a little bit lighter, but very smooth.  A lot of previous customers of Fat Angel recommended the Chicken PotPie on yelp. I decided to give it a try for this first time visit, which I found to be quite an interesting dish indeed. For the chicken potpie, the owner recommended me to pair the pie with a white or red wine with a light body. I craved for the red wine on this beautiful night, so I went with the glass of red to soothe my cravings. In the end, I decided to go with what the owner had suggested, a Grenache from Santa Cruz, CA, Birichino 'Vieilles Vignes.'  My, was it wonderful.  Although the look of Fat Angel's chicken potpie was different from a traditional potpie, it still has the ability to fill up a gigantic stomach. My stomach was about to explode after I've barely finished a half of the potpie. All ladies have to be ready to ask their boyfriends to finish what is left from this gigantic dish! The powdery sauce was smooth, thick, pure, fresh and brisk. The Pot Pie and Grenache from Santa Cruz paired quite well with each other, but they where not perfect. I couldn't help but keep my mind stimulated by looking for another pairing to perfect this wine and potpie collaboration and  build a stronger relationship between the taste buds within my mouth.  I will definitely go back to Fat Angel to give a second look at their well-known cheese served w/ organic Firebrand Bread and seasonal accents.  Cheers!

MAbvtRQIJZAudR8nn6KEKg.review_text: Went in early evening on a Sunday. Three of us split mac and cheese, mushroom flatbread, and sliders.  Service was great, ambiance pretty nice, many other customers seemed to be on Ok Cupid (or similar) dates. Flatbread was more of a cracker bread thing. It was ok. Sliders and Mac and cheese were very good. If I go back, next time I'll get a salad because they looked really great and the portions were giant. If you eat what I ate here too often, you'd definitely be a fat angel.....

zYJgtlVZLYVrxleKpZ20vA.review_text: Went here for the first time before catching a movie at Kabuki Sundance Cinemas. Our hostess, Jessica, was awesome! She recommended some really neat beers and we loved it. Beers were a bit on the expensive side but they have a great list to choose from. Food menu was limited, but the food was great. We ordered the sliders and the Mac n Cheese. Both were yummy. We'll definitely be back and if they expand their food menu a bit, we'll be back more often!

DNBQ8iya6EDsGlAqH9QWvQ.review_text: This place is legit. Wine on TAP?! Genius! In the newly vamped up Fillmore area, but still sketchy enough to have street cred, this place is just a great spot to grab some wine and snacks with friends and unwind.   Decor can't be beat...an old church organ? Who thinks of that??!

VCROW1kVZhf1XYzBwQ8B-w.review_text: Classical Revolution was invited to play chamber music in this wine bar and I was performing a round of concerts with CR on the day we broke ground here. While I don't know if that will be a lasting relationship, I have to say I was still impressed with this establishment as a business of its kind.  I had not known of Fat Angel despite the fact that I live 4 blocks away. I hang out quite a bit on Fillmore street - more around J-town/Pac Heights area, but still, Fillmore street has everything my Webster street lacks. I was pleasantly surprised to be invited here one night and discovered that not only is this a "bar", it's a wine bar - WITH FOOD. Great food.  On a busy Sunday night there was one man running the show. He was behind the bar mostly making drinks. But he was also somehow waiting all those tables, cleaning up after tables (right away, too), and doing his job with such quickness that lacked the appearance of chaos. He didn't even lose his cool or raise his voice, NOT ONCE. The place isn't too big - maybe seats 25 people, max. But the place was PACKED. And it's easy to know why.  They not only have great wine and beer selections (I had some FANTASTIC IPA and more pinot noir, on the house) they also have wonderful fare. I had some of the best Mac&cheese of my life, a tasty and crispy flatbread, and the absolute best apple bread pudding of my life, served with a huge dollop of real whipped cream and vanilla bean ice cream. It was a large serving of desert for only 6 bucks, a portion large enough to go around between probably three people. I don't know what they put into the bread pudding - nutmeg? But it was killer, not like any other bread pudding I'd eaten before. It was perfectly creamy and eggy but there was something else about it I haven't found in other bread puddings. It was creamy, crispy , rich, warm, gooey, not too sweet, and subtly spicy in a way I can't describe, really.   What an awesome place to hang out in the neighborhood. Furnished with a curved bench, individual marble tables and matching antique chairs, antique sconces, matching mirrors, and beautiful, dark mahogany wood and cherry blossoms, this was a great spot for me to enjoy a low-key night with good musicians and better friends. Since my roommate and I are on almost exact opposite schedules except about once a week, once she turns 21 I have a feeling date nights are going to happen here often.

ioyphfz9o1uERdc9G70CFg.review_text: We arrived early and waited for 2 minutes after the posted "open" time but it was still closed. We went for a walk and came back half an hour later and it was filling up. The menu had some food stains on it which was a little gross. The waitress though was great she was very knowledgable about the menu and was able to suggest things. The food was great too and tasted better than I expected. I had the mac and cheese and my friend the flatbread. We had some meat and cheese appetizer too which was very small for the price but good quality. I will make a point to come back again based on my first experience.

w6AyGgbbFv7Ojb0JxJ8HOw.review_text: my friend suggested to have dinner here after reading the great reviews on yelp and i'm so glad that we chose to come here! found a parking spot in front of yoshis, a block away - score! a group just left and we got a small table for 3 right away score! (the place is small and we came on a monday evening around 7pm and it was pretty packed so i would imagine on other nights there would be a wait!) we sat down at 6:56pm and they let us take advantage of the happy hour (till 7pm, $2 off flatbreads and $1 off beers and wines on tap) - score! i got a pinot noir on tap - really good my friend got an Inception Triple Voodoo - really good Belgian ale. 3 of us shared a wild mushroom and white truffle oil flatbread, the sliders, the macncheese and the chicken pot pie. Everything was really solid, although a bit on the heavy side - but hey - it's really good comfort food. in order, i liked the chicken pot pie the most, then flatbread next, then the macncheese and then the sliders would definitely go back!

9x9vn1jq7h0CHhaMWGEMKQ.review_text: I have been here twice, and both times my experience was fantastic.  Although the place was packed, my boyfriend and I got seated within 20 minutes.  The service was friendly and attentive, and the food and drinks were to die for.  I highly recommend finishing your meal off with some of their great coffee.

MLu4QeIXt1uSNQ2SKh6Idw.review_text: CUTE place. NICE wine but those barstools HURT your butt if you plan to sit at the bar for a longer period of time :)   It is small so the layout is compact but I got there right at opening for wine with a friend. Bartender was super nice, and friendly.

XrRbDfhofoq-Cys6oKXdJw.review_text: I LOVE Fat Angel.   The flatbreads are amazing ... try the Basil pesto, black olives, roasted tomatoes w/ ricotta & sausage. Yummmm  Even better? The chicken pot pie... best one I have ever had... EVER.   Huge and delicious salad portions.... great to share.   A great LITTLE spot... come early or you wil for sure have a wait. But service is always nice and they also have a few seats outside under heat lamps :)

RoSO1yEbzVh4p3N5_uWf5A.review_text: Awesome beers here and their food is great too. Cozy atmosphere, we came at 6 and there were seats but by 7 it started getting crowded.

LlMFVJAzorfXCcaGJjXthQ.review_text: Beer/wine selection: outstanding   Customer service: 1 million gold star points to infinity (so so so good for real)  Olives: Yes please  Romantic: Hell yes  Cozy: Handled   Chocolate cake: Perfect  Hot Tea: In it's own press ftw   I came off my Yelp cleanse to give this place five stars. Tucked away gem. No more details for you! Just go!

-4fxqCZF-K3j0LeQ-1b4Yg.review_text: Casual yet elegant. You might want to think twice before leaving alone after dark... but great first stop before working your way up on Fillmore. I typically suggest this place to friends visiting San Francisco - and they tend to come back raving. Nice selection of both wine, beer and food!   I was here with a party of four during a really crowded night (place is tiny!) but waiters managed to keep everything under control and we got our food relatively fast. Between the four of us we had plenty of special diet requests, but again, waiter didn't look bothered even after the fourth round of questions and managed to get all of our requests met, no slip-ups.   A great place for afterwork drinks, third dates and/or people watching!

Rkhm3bht88rhk5pR3kF3FA.review_text: This place definitely has hit something with a fun atmosphere--almost feels like when the Spotted Pig first opened up in New York. They do really cool stuff with their butters (normally I would never order butter, but you have to do it here!), especially the maple bacon butter which is a "must try."   The cheeses and cured meats are great as well, and you can do mac and cheese and flatbread while you're at it.  Also don't forget this is a wine bar, but they do a great job with small food items.  The only improvement would be if it was on Fillmore itself instead of on a side street, but you can't have everything.

wOxFDWsIhL8QuMQFoh6hgw.review_text: Visited San Francisco for the first time and came across this little place. Great food and an amazing selection of beers and wines. I would definitely recommend checking it out if you are in the area.

IHnV-DVcxVkwVdDq3bhufg.review_text: The place was nicely decorated, but the service was horrible so we left before we even got to taste the food. Firstly we got a glass of clearly moulded wine and the waiter said it was just a French pinot with a 'funky' taste, and secondly we asked the waiters three times for a table but they let others go before us. After waiting for an hour we gave up and left and decided not to come back. The place looks nice, if only the service could match that..

GkOW-Gz3cxi59e33-_IUUA.review_text: A 3 star is the average between my husband's and my review. He had chicken pot pie and sliders, he loved the chicken pot pie. I had the mac and cheese which was extremely SPICY! When telling the waitress she simply said that the kitchen staff is from Mexico and that's why it's spicy.... ??????? Never heard such a thing B4. Wines were good but service was non-existent. After seating at a table for 15 minutes we had to get up to order at the bar. When they brought us the food there was no napkins, silverware or water until we got a glimpse of the busboy and asked him for those items. Even to ask for another wine and the bill we had to go to the bar, but a group of girls next to us had a waiter coming to them all the time... Would not recommend.

dy4OvKg-9GBhgGaZFaKqTQ.review_text: If you're a beer fan this is your spot,  and also nice wine list. Flatbread was amazing and kept us from not starving waiting for our table @ the bird. I've had the sliders before and they make some of the best in the city, I'ts my fave in the city as well as there mac n cheese.

f2PvxaRfZ3c0vJm4Q0rJTA.review_text: I've never had the food here. I have however had a few different beers.   Very reasonable prices for SF (6 USD)  It can get very crowded, which is annoying at times.

ObdEx0uci1jRa4dDM73AYg.review_text: I found this place on Yelp and took my out of town guests. I'm happy to say this place didn't make me look bad :).   My friends are really into beer and this place has a great selection. Not only that, it seems like the staff is really passionate about it. My friends and the waiter got into a really enthusiastic conversation about one of the beers and the brewery that makes it. He was definitely very knowledgable.   The food was also delicious! We ordered the garlic chilli butter to share and my boyfriend couldn't help but eat over half the butter himself. It was really flavorful. We also ordered the mushroom flatbread, the sliders, and the mac and cheese. My friends really like the sliders, especially served with the pickled hot peppers. The Mac and Cheese was probably one of the best I have ever had. The flatbread in comparison was just okay.   Note that the place is small so you may have a long wait. We waited probably 40 minutes, but we really enjoyed our experience so I guess it was worth it.

H17YNt0Qfrb3g0l5mKTv7w.review_text: This is a great place if you are looking for a large selection of craft beer. The beer menu has beers grouped by type and the wait staff are very helpful with suggestions. The food is also very good and compliments the beer. The baby kale salad is excellent despite its simplicity.

Tf9rV21VCEikyjB14qM5VA.review_text: Came in here after a show at the Fillmore. Wine on draft was good. Will be back for food.

dKA5pV924YpE3zmAzShLcw.review_text: The line at State Bird Provisions was unacceptably long, so we wandered around the corner and voila -- beer, snacks, and tables without a wait.  I don't have a lot to add that others haven't said recently. Kale salad was great and the portion was huge. Mac and cheese was spicy and the portion was huge. Sliders and pate were delicious. Wish they had fries - then it would be perfect.

yrFkZTQJoJZh0sA2D0Hcww.review_text: I Love this place! I live super close so I frequent Fat Angel.  They have wine ON TAP! Yes, ON TAP! The Syrah on tap is my favorite. But the wine isn't what makes this place so great...try the Food! They actually have Butter on the menu...different flavors of butter served with bread.  And the Mac and Cheese is sooo good.  It's kinda close to 1300, which gets undeserved praise for their mac and cheese and Fat Angel's is way better.  I've also ordereda salad there and it was big enough to feed me and 2 friends...Great place!!

jOijuMpaFg74SD1_fA9QLg.review_text: After walking 1.5 miles we made it!!   love the chicken pot pie and the mac n cheese. Will be back very very soon to eat it all AGAIN!

J0m0GUv6iSmo7urOYWrU3g.review_text: We won't be back there. The food was decent but the service was terrible. We ordered, among other things, the sliders. We were disappointed by them: The patty was small compared to the bun, overcooked and the sauce wasn't very good. We each had one and left the third one untouched. I told the waiter that we had a nice meal that was let down by the sliders. There comes the weird part. The waiter became very defensive and started offering a partial refund of the sliders. His argument was that we ate two and left one, so he could refund us 33% of the sliders. WTF is this? I didn't ask for any refund and was not expecting one. But offering a refund of 33% of $10 is just a joke. I told him so, and he went to talk to his manager. He came back and told us that we will be completely refunded.  So, decent food (overall) and good beverages, but terrible service.

b8EnjL9DwA6rNDQ9yoIwWg.review_text: I can't comment on the food because we just came to grab a glass of wine before our dinner at State Bird Provisions.   Very nice selection of wines and beers. If you're in the area and need a quick sip or a few hours of quench thirsting to accomplish, Fat Angel is worth the visit.

O7elJngJV1SBkjw84gdiUQ.review_text: Extensive beer list (quite impressed). Kickass bread pudding.   I wish I had come here with a bigger appetite. My friends got the sliders which looked awesome, and they both seemed to devour it pretty quickly. They came with jalapeños, so that already is a win for me. I had just the bread pudding with a glass of red wine. Simple and delish.   The environment itself is a charming little old school wine bar. Really not anything fancy, but the food speaks for itself. Will probably rate it 5 stars after sampling more menu items.

WjNFKmwi24QGAIaaWnd7Bw.review_text: Found this place when looking for a place to grab a bite before heading to see the Kooks at the Fillmore. Yelp came through for me with this place. Awesome beer selection on Draft and epic bottle selection. Also the flatbread pizzas were delicious as we're the charcuterie plates! I'll be back! It's a purty small place, so you should probably get a resy if you plan to go on the weekend. Our show was weds nite, so still busy, but no worries getting in just for 2 peeps.

U_v28IuvVxDX-_9wXohZ5A.review_text: Love the food. Noise level is insane. I can't believe don't whistle and ask the crowd to stop yelling and start talking. The noise level kills this place. It;s a shame. I had to read lips to hear the people who were sitting very close to me. We ended up leaving to a different place

6q6f2GHua9Sd6zOajJkIuQ.review_text: Fantastic wine list!    Seating is odd but the wine and cheese platter is delicious!

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: Overrated and overcrowded. No plans to go back. My gf and I just wanted a drink to figure out where to eat - maybe here, maybe elsewhere - due to getting shut out nearby. Drink menu is pretty robust, and our drinks were good, though not fast.  We checked out the menu, given to us by the bartender, but then...we couldn't order for 10-15 minutes. He'd literally talk to other people and not look at us. Should we have yelled, or made a scene? Nope, we just paid for the drinks and left.   Pro move: arrive early if you want a table, especially if a show's playing later that night at the Fillmore. No reservations available and table management is suboptimal.

DjiWvNLBbrOI5qKOyYGtCA.review_text: I would give this place a solid four stars if it wasn't for the rude male host working the front. If the outside seats are "first come, first serve", do not tell me you lost a few customers due to me taking one chair from the other table because you are one who told me to check the outside seating and to take whatever's available -_- He made me feel horrible and I could have been approached in a more friendly manner.   I came here with a party of three on a busy Friday night and I can't wait to visit this place again minus the rude host. The chicken pot pie really blew me away and leftovers we're just as amazing. They have a endless list of beers, wines and bar food. This is a fun place to grab some drinks with friends and just hang out. I do not recommend large parties here.

Vw2j3AV6kJ5uXHsR0sVgmg.review_text: This place has declined precipitously. I have been going here shortly after it had opened and loved the selection of beer (amazing menu + tap rotation) and food (bougie bar food).   HOWEVER, of late I have had 3 terrible experiences in a row. Why:  1) The service is atrocious. There are routinely too few waiters and bartenders. They always seem generally annoyed to serve you.  2) The beer selection is diminished - as a bar this is bad. If you have 3 double IPAs and no belgian beers on tap, you're doing it wrong.  3) They do not appreciate repeat business. I have met the same bartender probably five times, often going with my friend who lives across the street. Not once have we gotten a free drink or even just some better service. That's amateur hour compared to most other places I try to frequent.

99dG1NLUxH7t1_OU3sFWqA.review_text: The name fits this place well. I left with a full tummy and felt like I was in heaven. My friends and I enjoyed every bite and drink. We started with a meat and cheese platter. The Spanish cheese, genoa and spicy chorizo were exceptional. We next enjoyed and devoured the mushroom w/ white truffle oil and pecorino flatbread. We even contemplated ordering one for each! We then ate the delicious mac and cheese, heaven! Lastly we ordered the chocolate mousse. It was the perfect way to end an amazing meal!

ACUVZ4SiN0gni7dzVDm9EQ.review_text: At this point I've eaten everything on the menu at least twice. And I have plans to eat it all at least twice more in the near future. Perhaps the biggest way I can point out how much I love this place is just by the sheer number of check-ins you see above this review. In fact, Sir Nicholas and I had our picture taken and adorned on the "regulars' Christmas tree" over the holidays.  I think this might be love...

mb2ZCVoglkfitoBGR1lk2w.review_text: Fat Angel is a fantastic spot!  My girl and I went here on a Thursday opened up the joint at happy hour.  We were enthusiastically and warmly greeted by the staff and explained the menu.  I had a local beer that I had never tasted and we dove into a plate of cheese and some bread and maple bacon butter.  Delicious.    We then shared a giant and superb caesar salad.  Seriously, this thing is a monster and we devoured the whole thing.  Then onto the flatbread - wow!  We had one topped with prosciutto, walnuts, roasted grapes and gorgonzola and were totally blown away.  The crust was perfectly thin and crispy, a unique take on the flatbread which really allows the toppings to do their thing.    A great spot, great peeps and fantastic food!  Can't wait to go back.

sjXDLpvcrMldagWJJDlBTQ.review_text: 5-7 happy hour with $1 off draft beer & wine; $2 off flatbread.   Service was super friendly and attentive. We were greeted with a big smile and a carafe of water came immediately after we sat down. Always appreciated when embarking on a wine adventure.   I sampled the draft Pinot noir and cab. Both wines were airy; I'm assuming this was from the fact that it came from a tap. There were lots of little air bubbles in the cab that made it seem relatively light for the style. Flavor-wise both were good although a bit on the expensive side for what they are.   Also tried the flatbread with bacon, anchovies, goat cheese, and onions. It was huge, although since the bread is so thin, we managed to polish it off between two people. It was okay, but nothing extraordinary. The flavors were there individually but never really seemed to come together as much as I would have liked.

CDtbuyJBYyDT21lJMod6OA.review_text: This place is so pleasant.  :)  I can't think of another word to describe it.  Mind you I get my eatin' done before I go out drinkin' so I haven't tried their food yet... but I love to have drinks here with someone I love.  :)  Their champagne with house bitters is delicious!  And I love to try out their exotic beers, pricey as they may be... it's interesting, and not a lot of bars have "interesting" beer  menus...  It's right down the street and around the corner from my other favorite place, Festa, so that's a star right there too.  Maybe I'm seeing this place through rose-colored glasses because I've only ever been here on dates... but I was dying to try it and when I finally did, I insisted date night includes a stop here... because we always end up at aforementioned Festa anyway.  Just a little side note; those bar stools have this weird lump in the croch area... so just watch out the first few times you sit in them.  Hahaha..!

fpcRlstsvuZTp7sjy-t3-g.review_text: This place is really rad. I'm sitting here relaxing on a sunny and lazy Saturday afternoon. I was a little miffed at first that they only have snacks before 5pm. Some really awesome beer on tap helped smooth that over. And the pretzel was tasty.   Now, I'm eating some of the best mac and cheese in my life and feeling like all is right with the world.

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: The kale salad is amazing, and you don't need to add chicken (it's a little dry).  It was massive and enough for two people.  I wouldn't mind going here every day and sharing that kale salad with someone.  The chicken pot pie was good, "esp because of the tarragon" (quipped my very picky chicken-pot-pie-eating friend).  My wine was like a Pinot Grigio and excellent, they have "draft wines".  Great little neighborhood restaurant.

Psfb6E5bJroE94DGHgpRmQ.review_text: This place is consistently very good.  I've only been on "off hours" (weeknight or weekend afternoon), but I'd characterize Fat Angel as a quaint little gastropub with solid food and a nice selection of beers and wine.  This is a good place to go if you want to be able to actually be able to actually talk to your companion.  I've had the cheese plate and flatbreads.  Would recommend both.    The service has been good and attentive though I've been at the bar both times.  Looks to me like they typically only have a couple of folks working the front of the house, but it's a small place so I think it works.    It's worth a shot...especially if you live in the neighborhood.  Never have left anything but satisfied.

CMilaQmxP7z1gFILZBCItQ.review_text: Wine selection was okay ... I'm giving 3.5 stars for a great ambience and especially the presentation and taste of our 5 little mini appetizers. We had the chèvre, boar meat shavings, maple bacon butter, spicy chili butter, and some sweet jelly that was all laid out nicely on a cutting board with a bunch of precut bread slices - perfect to enjoy our mini appetizers with.

T6iHpSSqu631Qu-87mQqSg.review_text: I went back again and everything I had felt Mediocre so I guess it's either hit or miss because the first time I ate here it was wonderful.    For this review I came during Happy Hours with 2 people.  We had aa arugula salad that was wonderful.  However, the mac and cheese wasn't as spicy and tastey this time and the last flat bread on the list with these sausage was not good at all.    It just taste like some cheap $5 sausage frozen pizza.  :(  I'm never ordering that one again gross and sad.

RB53Qw49yEbtkWGJ9cJXdA.review_text: So I've been here twice (three attempts). It was delicious. I was in a party of four, got a table after a 15-20 minute wait at 7 on a cloudy Saturday night. We ordered one meat, one cheese, and one butter (I kind of wish they had a set of one meat\cheese\butter plate, since we wanted to try one in each category). However, our server made some excellent recommendations for what to order. We also ordered the grape, walnut and gorgonzola flatbread, the sliders, the chicken pot pie, and drinks. I'd have to say, I was most impressed with the flatbread (I usually like lots of meat on my pizza, I mean, flatbread). It was excellent. The pot pie and the sliders were pretty darn good, too. It may sound weird, but I really liked the buns on the sliders.   As for drinks, I got a nice MIkkeller stout, which was, as my server informed me, fruitier than stouts tend to be. Delicious, nonetheless.  I don't know if I came in on a good night, or if some of the reviewers came in on a bad night, but I thought the service was good. My party was pretty clueless as to order, and the server walked us through a lot\most of the menu. When they got busier, he couldn't stand around and wait for us to make up our minds, but that's understandable.

9uGlVaTQOWQRY-A-X47xCg.review_text: So really FA gets a 3.5, but I rounded it up because the servers were very nice, and the inside decor is cozy cool (if you don't mind that there's a giant animal head, attention PETA/vegetarian folk - next to the lovely chandelier).   Selection of beverages was wide and quirky, with various kinds of wine, beer and mead.Pours are small -- $12-15 for a 1/3 filled wine glass of mead... Note that spirits aren't served here.   Menu is very ecclectic bar food. Food is pricey for what you get for the most part. Only salads are large, tasty and reasonably priced. Trout salad excellent. But spent $13 for 3 small sliders with maybe 1/16 pound of meat on each, with the thin patties charred to toughness -- also came out bone cold.  $5 pretzel was overbaked and bland. They don't serve chips, fries or beans or rice, etc.   Outside is best on a warm day as the tiny heaters outside aren't strong enough to actually warm anything up, and there is no awning/side panel to hold in what heat there is. Will be back, but just for drinks and maybe some greens.

KFZgK2PaAfSz-3lw_Fhx3A.review_text: Enjoyed the grape walnut flatbread . The maple bacon butter was great! Good service and a fun low lit atmosphere.

2UuNTFCDZPa3DImEA111fw.review_text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the food at Fat Angel.  This is a great place!  It's small and intimate, but it wasn't at all noisy, at least not when we went there.    It has a casual yet upscale vibe to it.  I don't get out to this part of the City much anymore, but If I were in the area and looking for a place to eat, this would be it.  Much more than 1300 Fillmore, or Yoshi's, etc.

F8LCN-IeTSy0gG9YrfMmpg.review_text: The food was delicious, fresh, flavorful, and unique. We got a couple of cured meats (hot copa & dry chorizo) & a cheese (Pantaleo Italian goat), the roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto with gorgonzola flat-bread (!!), Mac n' Cheese (gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano reggiano -- a little spicy!), & sliders (beef, caramelized onions, bacon, cheddar, aioli). And, of course, a bottle of red wine--draft style. Quality surpassed my expectations, trendy (& loud) atmosphere, plus loads of drink options.  My only peeve: Got here at 6:45 p.m., left at 9:45 p.m., and not necessarily by choice. We didn't exactly have one server (more like 4) and honestly, we felt a little forgotten. Despite the lack of consistency and communication in terms of service, I will be back. Not the best choice if your intention is to have an organized dinner, but it's great for drinks & snacks.

6jvPZiwFL3xDw_46ztgoRA.review_text: I usually don't write reviews, however our experience at this restaurant was quite horrible to the point where I felt there was a need to share.  This was our second visit to Fat Angel. We came here on around 10:30 and were seated after a couple of mins since we were also getting dinner. The place looked quite unorganized, the bartender was also the server and there were only another female server for a crowded place.   We sat down and ordered our drinks. The drinks came momentarily, after we told them we were ready to order. He got our order in, there were a couple of other tables behind us who ordered later. We waited for almost 20mins for our cold cut plate. I don't know how long it takes to slice meat. But as I looked up, the tables who ordered way later already received their cold cut plates and salads! When my bf tried to speak to the waiters, they ignored him. I managed to catch the attention of the female waitress and explained to her that everyone else who ordered after us had received their food, even the hot plates yet we only had drinks.   After 5-10 mins, our food began to come. The male server who was also the bartender made no attempt to explain or apologize for the significant delay, and acted as if nothing had happened. When we ordered dessert, they made no attempt to clear our table full of plates, instead piled the dessert plate on our stacked table. We had to essentially gather our own plates to have them being taken away.   As for the food, the cold cut platter was standard. The chicken pot pie was quite good, but the salad was overly dressed and soggy since it probably had been sitting on the counter for a long time. The creme brulee was average. After this experience, the poor management and avg. food, it is safe to say we will not be recommending this restaurant to anyone or coming anymore.

umaFa8I7hJGQ6eF5FfY-jw.review_text: Great beers, cool staff. They change out the tap beers frequently which is awesome but sad if you get attached to one.

jwbcs_eQ2QznrOyMuqz1LQ.review_text: Fat Angel? Love.  This little wine/beer/cheese bar is right up this gal's alley. Hearts... big time hearts.  A fantastic ambiance that didn't seem to be trying *too* hard. (Chill, dim, relaxed and cute without the whole "we're going for a thing" thing.) The bathroom? Spacious and clean and some kitsch and I really liked it. (Don't laugh... bathrooms are important, people!)  The wine offerings? Fantastic. I immensely enjoyed the Grenache/Mourvedre blend I had... and on tap, to boot! (Cooler than the other side of the pillow? Methinks so.) Brut Rose? Yes please. AND a pretty solid beer selection. You're doing it right, Fat Angel.  Maple bacon butter and bread? Yes please.   If I lived in SF, I'd be at this spot more than I'd like to admit.

GsjqMRSylJUO27_hM11JcA.review_text: Walking in with my 3 girlfriends we were immediately given exceptional service.  2 people served us and were really friendly.  I regret not getting their names.  But they were so nice and attentive and tried to be as helpful as possible!  Looking at the menu, I was amused that 90% of the items were alcoholic beverages.  I came for the food...which can be found on the last page, hehe.  So here's what my girlfriends and I shared:  FLATBREAD - $13 ($2 off during Happy Hour) Tomatoes, basil, spicy sausage, & arugula w/ ricotta Although simple, this was amazing.  I love the subtle spice of the sausage, the thin crispyness of the crust (which was not at all greasy), and the arugula that paried so well along with the ricotta.  All the ingredients was just the right amount and this plate was a great one for sharing.  I loved it!  MAC 'N CHEESE - $11 Gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano I came here for this dish right here.  I"m happy that it was so spicey like many people thought.  If anything I tasted no spice which was fine.  I loved how the top layer was crispy...and yes this dish was quite greacy...but hey its why I love mac n cheese!  Be careful though, it comes out SUPER hot!  This ooey-gooey cheesy dish was a fave!  F.A.'S CHICKEN POT PIE - $12 Roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon  I was quite impressed with this one mainly because it didn't look like a pie.  It looked like there was a thick flakey buttery thing of pastry on top and beneath the filling.  Otherwise the filling was out in the open so you see exactly what you're getting.  Just your standard chicken pot pie filling but what made it unique was the "crust".  Yum!  3 SLIDERS - $10 Beef, caramelized onions, bacon, Irish cheddar, aioli Oh so tasty!  Simple but I appreciate it not being dry.  I love the little pickled peppers it came with...it compliments it SO well.  I felt the aioli tasted like ranch dressing..but its not a complaint.  I enjoyed it.    Its unfortunate I didn't try any drinks since I feel its their main thing...but I'm happy to have tried their food because it was amazing.  Parking was fairly easy for me (I came around 5:45pm and stayed until 6pm since its free after that).  The restaurant itself is quite small, intimate, but not jam packed.  It does become a full house and I felt we got lucky finding an empty table immediately.  Great food, great company, and exceptional service...whats there to complain?

-gOJQuk5GU6bl3PFcpMdgA.review_text: This is a new favorite spot for some guilty pleasures.  Really good mix of old and new world wines by the glass, about 25 total.  Also have arguably the best beers on tap (pranqster, La merle, etc..- all small batch stuff), and tons of good belgian beers in btl.  I dig the infused butters they make, totally original (the bacon-maple was excellent).  And just a good all around mix of cheeses and salumi.  If you're down to just snack on stuff for dinner and geek out on a few different wines and brews, this place is the jam.

BLj-sgh4vuYt-vsGWpXyag.review_text: The maple bacon and chili garlic butters are killer, but their beer selection is what I enjoyed most about Fat Angel.  It's a small intimate place that has a lively feel to it.  We had a great time and the staff really knew their beers.

bWcYuQ3faUj9krc2T_u4Vw.review_text: Too expensive for average pilsner and lackluster service. There are way better, more fun and cheaper options.   Now if you're crazy enough to want to wait out at Fat Angels while in 90+ mins queue outside State Bird Provisions (that's just around the corner), then this place is your only choice.   Either way it's a lose/lose game. Ridiculous. No thanks!

GlN-B5ercZoaJRqeUN5L3w.review_text: this is my second time going here and the food was sooooo good the mini burgers was yumy. The customer serves is the BOMB.... the wine list is cheap. This place is a place that you can bring a date if you are in a budget.   HIGHLY recommended to everyone.   AS GOOD AS IT GETS! above average.

EKuJsdYlMARSaGjj0wpVEQ.review_text: Wine on draft and a chill atmosphere for happy hour?  I'm all over it!!! After walking by this bar on my way to State Bird Provisions last year, it was bustling and I've been wanting to try it ever since. I came here yesterday after work with my friend Will. The staff is friendly and bar has a cozy bistro feeling. The happy hour specials are $2 off wine and beer, $1 off the flatbreads. We had a half bottle of the draft Zinfandel (juicy and smooth), a half bottle of the draft Sauvignon Blanc (crisp and refreshing) and the wild mushroom and truffle oil flatbread (delish!). The place filled up quickly and was crackin'! They even had a large antler taxidermy on the back wall next to their chalkboard, which had a catchy saying from Hemingway and list of 8 beers on draft. I was really impressed with Fat Angel and have a new happy hour spot! :)

Cd5QZkY9kqMeM7XOHHxtFA.review_text: I love the delicious food and variety choice of wine. Especially, their comments for the wine serve with cheese. If you do not know how to oder your meal, just ask them.

EtaG4IWkEUalOdNSQnMEdA.review_text: We moved into the Fillmore Center 3 years ago and witnessed the transformation of this empty space into Fat Angel.  I've brought my mother here post movie (Sundance Kabuki), my boyfriend for a romantic evening, and friends for after work drinks. It worked out perfectly for us each time. This is because the 2 owners (also the only servers) are knowledgeable and dedicated. I feel at home here, truly.  Yes, it is very, very dimly lit.  This suits the cozy atmosphere if you ask me. It reminds me of the many small wine bars I visited in Madrid and the South of France.   The tables are a bit uneven, true.  Doesn't bother me enough to deduct a star though.  I really appreciate the thought they put into their menu. The section names and wine descriptions are clever.   Love that they bring you a full carafe of water right away. The water glasses are pretty small so this is helpful as the small bar tends to get pretty warm when full.   ~Favorites~ FOOD -Wild Mushroom Flatbread (love the sea salt), and love the wooden palate it's served on. Even asked the owner where it is from and purchased some for my home! -Trout Salad -Cheese Plate -Any of the flavored butters

zMRjBba8DrwoYFWcwSkAbg.review_text: Pretty cool place...Came here when I was visiting SF and had a good time.  The service was prompt and they had some nice wines too go with a chill atmosphere.

ZJz2yW96WPExQrlbAI_CpQ.review_text: My fiancé and I are in San Francisco for part of our honeymoon. Once we were settled in our b&b we went on the hunt for a place to grab a quick bite at 9pm on a Tuesday. We found Fat Angel quite accidentally and what a find it is. We both enjoyed our meals. He had sliders and I had wild mushroom flatbread with truffle oil. There drink menu is more extensive than there food menu. That being said I had a phenomenal cider called Finnriver Fire barrel Cider. $17 for 22oz was well worth it. I would definitely recommend this place.

ZCyqVnPSHkMZ92PTncoIXA.review_text: So sad.  I normally love interesting wine bars like this, but really bad service can ruin anyplace.  Consider Fat Angel ruined.  Add: The owner contacted me and seems very nice and genuine.  Everyone has an off-night.  I'll bump them up a star and give them another shot sometime soon.

77UKGsbG1ZCnakG9iJ0htA.review_text: I loved the small setting and warm decor, except for how long it took to get seated or to get anyone's attention to order a drink at the bar. I ended  up only being able to get a drink when our party of 4 was finally seated after long wait because I just couldn't get a waiter's attention before that.  That being said, everything else was wonderful. My Duet IPA was delicious and served really cold, as it should be. The baby kale salad and flatbreads were fresh, innovative flavors, wonderful. Service was friendly if not super attentive. Would be 5 stars if not for the long wait with no drink service.

9uhOuCTlULaxLZj_j8KWHw.review_text: I finally came here! Been wanting to for almost two fricken years and always forget.  Was not even a plan to come here tonight, but DOSA was not open when we needed and then it hot me! FAT ANGEL! We walked to two dirty blocks literally dodging wacky homeless people and some other very interesting characters. Definitely do NOT walk around this area after dark alone or with a group of girls and no guys or big lesies to protect cuz it gets real SKETCHY! This area was one of many SF former neighborhoods I lived in as an adolescent and early adult, so I know very well that this is not an okay place to be vulnerable in. Aside form this we walk in with no resies and are immediately seated. Very small place for which I was shocked by. Smelled amazing and the place was not packed yet. My fiend and I were greeted by a super nice women who was helpful off the bat in describing everything for us. We decided to each get this PIMM's cocktail which was odd but unique. If you get this then STIR IT! It does not look like it needs to be stirred, but it does! The bottom is where the cava liquor is.  Once we discovered that, it was super yummy! We ordered the endive salad and the mac an cheese. NOTE about the mac: there is much more to it than shown on the menu. It is not a basic mac and cheese. It is spacey and filled with seasoning not typical of mac and cheese. I think it was a chipotle type seasoning so if that's a problem let them know in advance in case they can make it without.  The salads are HUGE! Enough for 3-4 people. Far too much for us. There is a reason they are around $11 each.....because they are the meal! At some point out waitress asked if we wouldn't mind moving over one table because this large group without a resie walked in. We had zero issues moving and as such, the owner gave us a large and super amazing creme brulee on the house! SOOOO nice and so sweet! We would definitely return. Service is stellar and food is super yummy. Got out of these for $42. Not bad at all!

lvTDfYZPIFXFDvT6ndhplQ.review_text: Really stoked about this fairly new joint.  Their flat bread is delicious - think of them as very very thin pizza! Mac & Cheese - always good. Chicken Pot Pie - soul warming.  So many types of interesting beer on tap? Sold!

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: Woah there. Five stars is getting a little carried away. Not quite THAT amazing.  But they do have bacon butter, which is worth almost five stars alone.  In general, the food selection is limited, but they do everything well, and it's all delicious and high quality.  I also love that they have wine on draft - hope this trend catches on. Love the hilarious wine descriptions. It apppears like this is in a former church, which is also really cool.  Overall, this area desperately needs a place like this, and I hope it iwll improve the quality of life.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: 06.04.11  Cyrick = friendly, animated, and overall awesome.  Thanks for serving me the sauv blanc on tap even though I had my "fake" ID ;)  We had the chicken pot pie, mac and cheese, and the mushroom flatbread.  Each were wonderful in their own way, but the chicken pot pie is in a category of greatness by itself.  Throughout the meal I just kept exclaiming "this is the best chicken pot pie I've ever had".  No joke.  And wine on tap...what a concept.  I'm SO coming back.  Total damage for three: $63

Kz7J8ylf3aMLvIVetBtjMw.review_text: Excellent food and drinks, extremely attentive/friendly service & classy decor. Lots of neighborhood regulars. I'm trying really hard to become one.   Update: Mission accomplished...  1.) They know me by name 2.) I got some free food 3.) They tested a new dish on me  Woohoo!

uTDxT-lAVI31gBg9Fgz8hQ.review_text: Cozy spot with a great draft beer list and wine on tap. They also sell "digestive" drinks, which are pretty neat. It's small, so be warned: If you are looking to eat, you may wait. If you are looking to drink, you may be cramped.  I haven't had the food, but this is certainly a good place to sip a beverage or two on your way out or your way back home.

scU3ND9j6WYe8ziOa770vA.review_text: I was really excited to check out this place after reading the reviews. And for the first half an hour, I was not disappointed. We ordered some mushroom and truffle flat bread and it was delicious. The Pinot Noir on tap was not bad but I didn't expect much from tap wine anyway. Then things started to go downhill after I ordered a glass of Bordeaux. I swear that bottle was opened more than two days ago. There was no fragrance left. The wine was really bland. My bf also ordered a glass of another red wine which turned out the same as my Bordeaux. So 3 stars for food and atmosphere. But seriously, taste your wine before you serve it and throw away the old bottle please.

h2u6zWZSAnwVg28I2AmPZw.review_text: Great beer selection and the maple bacon butter was awesome!

2XbQIi87ySz7KSOI4RgCuA.review_text: This is a sweet little wine bar just off Fillmore street and perfectly situated for having a drink before or after a show at The Fillmore or a movie at the Kabuki!  (Or a movie at The Clay, which is where I was headed.)  I arrived at 6PM on a Friday by myself and got the last table.  They had a nice Happy Hour for "draft" wine & beer, but I decided against the house wine and went for the Sangiovese 2006 Savignola Paolina, Chianti Classico IT ($10).  I *did* decide to order a little appetizer off the Happy Hour menu.  I ordered the duck salami that came with a grainy mustard and bread in a bag (see my picture).  The presentation was beautiful and the service was friendly.  Another thing I really liked was how they presented their wine list.  I'm not a wine expert, but I know what I like and what I feel like drinking.  The wine I had was listed under "Bright and Juicy" and that's exactly what I wanted and wasn't disappointed.
