This is a nice addition to the area!

aKN3Fq2uaRJTwZRPlI5GcQ.review_text: Wine on tap! Holy crap, how have I never seen wine on tap before?  That was such a cool wine and beer bar. Very classy - wood walls, marble tables, I almost felt undressed walking in wearing jeans and a t-shirt. I didn't need to go formal, but maybe a little more chic than I wanted.  The alcohol selection cannot be beat. Great beers, great wines (about six or so on tap, which made them wonderfully cheap. The others from bottles were reasonably priced.)  I didn't get a chance to chance to snag a menu but lots of people were eating things like cheese plates and salads here. Stuff that goes well with wine, I assume.  Plus, I love the name so damn much. They even do have a little fat angle statue flying above the doorway. It's a win for sure.  It's a very very intimate spot with great lighting, so maybe not so good of the large group we rolled in with (most of us were scatted at different tables and a few stood). If you're looking for a place to drink with a bunch of friends, I'd suggest somewhere else. However, if you're on a first-date - I can't think of a better spot! I saw a few what looked like first dates and it really is the perfect spot for it.

Xj2tkHg0x21ysToP5Tu1fg.review_text: A super pleasant surprise! Deceptively cute and cozy inside even though it's in a weird apartment (?) building.   Mac & Cheese = DELISH. Smoked trout salad on first try was very good but had a little too much dressing. Second visit we asked for light dressing and it was perfect - it's big too!  But the best part is that they have a great beer AND wine list! Including decent happy hour specials (with BIG pours on the wine) on both. I've been trying to figure out why the city seems to want to segregate beer and wine drinkers. Not at Fat Angel. Finally!  Plus, it's near the Kabuki theater and The Fillmore - two places near which I always struggle to find a place I like to grab a drink before the show. Yay!  Bonus: the staff is great. Really friendly, knowledgable and accommodating.

EAUrXj9VgqYvGuPYEVYOJw.review_text: All I can say is that I want this place to be my 'Cheers'.   This is the perfect place to catch up with a friend over some wine. The service here is also wonderful. I really can't say enough great things.   As for food, my friend and I had the goat brie with a kumquat marmalade and the Roaring 20s (a blue cheese) with honeycomb. Both were so different - it was fun to try such a range. Then there was the truffled mushroom flatbread. I would eat this every night if I could.   *We also came here last week for my friend's birthday. There were about 12 of us. Every person in the bunch was a fan!

34EMzotInwL9pkTGiImIMg.review_text: Great place to go for a late night dinner and beers. I say this because I am certain it gets really busy at peak hours. We arrived at 8:30pm and were quickly seated.  Great food and great beers!!!

jzF8FHaK8Vf6o7ytyi3Fgw.review_text: We showed up at Fat Angel for dinner last night. Were told there is a 45mins wait, which as I am beginning to realize is normal for SF. We stood outside sipping wine and were finally able to sit at a table outside to wait. But soon realized that the staff was seating other parties of 4 inside, even though they came after us. When we complained our server told us that he had called out our name a couple of times but no one answered, so they seated someone else. Wtf? He was ok bringing us wine outside but not coming to get us for our table when it was our turn. They would have gotten a 1 star if it were not for the owner who saved the night. He came and apologized for the server. Comp'd our dessert and even took a decent chunk off our tab. Kudos to the owner for great customer service. The wait staff needs to learn from him.

Z88N6qly3Dp5C06XbZ9IMQ.review_text: Praise the Lord, hallelujah!  I haven't gone to church in a long time, but I sing praises when it is warranted. Fat Angel makes me sing from the heart.  This sweet, angelic spot exudes upscale lodge with a casual chic feel: marble bar, pew style booth seating and a handsome wall holding some crafted brews and carefully chosen vino. Don't mind the imposing Moosehead hanging above, Rocky and Bullwinkle totally approve.  Fat Angel seamlessly blends fantastic wine bar food with excellent tipples. The menu is 90% alcohol (as it should be!) beers are arranged according to your taste: light, crisp, heavy, dark. Same for the wines and for those who aren't feeling both, they offer several aperitifs as well.   It felt a little stuffy inside because of the rain, otherwise, I can imagine sitting here for hours on a warm SF night with the bay windows wide open. A crisp and zesty Picpoul was affordably priced at $8/glass.  My gf loves Riesling and this one from Kabinett is a richer style with sweetness in the end.  Of course, you can't go wrong with a Hefeweizen (Ayinger) or a dark stout like Double Chocolate Stout from England or a breakfast stout from Mikeller Bar (the Danes KNOW beer!)  All this imbibing made us hungry: we devoured an excellent meat board with speck, salami and duck terrine. On the board were also FLAVORED BUTTERS like maple bacon and Philz coffee. You wouldn't be able to resist spreading these on toast! The flatbread pizzas are pleasingly light, even with rich toppings such as gorgonzola, prosciutto and grapes on it. The chicken pot pie had a really flaky crust, but I didn't taste anything special about the tarragon cream sauce.   Hark the herald angels sing and glory to ... the genius who brought Fat Angel to San Francisco. Let's say Amen to that!

M4OZcoLHydGc-M5TTE5Qpg.review_text: GREAT new addition to the Fillmore/Yoshi's area.  The flatbreads are delicious, the drinks creative, and the service more enthusiastic than any I've experienced in months.  Why?  Because the owners - a couple of young guys who used to live nearby - are serious and sincere about creating a spot where "you can just hang out," as one of them said to me.    The vibe is casual and comfortable.  There is table and bar seating and a nice dim, candlelit ambiance.  The menu offers choices whether you want just a snack, dessert, or a full dinner.    Thumbs UP!

WtE46KFtytGA_8JqLEPXAA.review_text: Salads are huge and delicious.  The Charcuterie plate is rediculously small portions for the price.  I mean it looked like 1/2 oz of pate and about the same for the otehr items.  The Muchroom and truffle oil flatbread was dry and did not taste of truffle oil.  I think they might have put the oil in the mushroom past before it was cooked.  Truffle oil should be put on after it is out of the oven.  Great selection of bottled beers.

P0kW4jdYxi70sWpPeyj2Zw.review_text: To be honest I was pretty sure these reviews were padded because the owners are so sweet. One of them looks like Wesley from "The Princess Bride" (isn't that worth an extra star by itself?). The place is also oozing with heart. You can tell this place is someones dream come reality.     My boyfriend and I have been keeping our eye on the place for a couple of months, since we live close to it and frequently walk by. Last night (Thursday) we decided to give it a go.   I am proud to say I am a total food and wine snob and was very impressed. We got the Cesar Salad, Mac and Cheese, chicken pot pie and drinks. I tried the draft white, BF had the Casey Jones draft beer. The drinks were marvelous the food UH-mazing.   So much so, in fact, that at 5:30 (AM!!) this morning my boyfriend and I were once again discussing the merits of Fat Angel! In particular, the Pot Pie; me, being an borderline alchie, was thinking about the draft wine, while nodding that the pot pie was most excellent.   Fat Angel congratulations you deserve your 5 stars!

ZvtIMylao3fzsiT2G8AJ3A.review_text: While entertaining some friends from out of town, we were having trouble deciding where to go for drinks. Eventually some one came up with the brilliant idea of going to the first bar that we saw. Since I live quite literally across the street from Fat Angel, this ended up being our spot.  It was really cute and cozy inside and the wine list was extensive without being completely overwhelming. We shared a bottle of red wine that is made in somebody's garage or something and it was well received by all! The best part, however, would be the service. It's a small place, which I suppose helps with the attentiveness of the staff, but it seemed our server was always one step ahead of us. All in all, a great evening and will gladly return again soon.

y_i888PfZd5Tm-5a4tAWCA.review_text: I am enamored with this place.  I came here last Friday, and at 9:30 there was still a 30 minute wait for two. She didn't want to wait, I did, and for once in my life, I won. AND it was totally worth it.  If I lived up in San Francisco, I would be a regular here probably to the point where they would stop serving me. Everything about this place works well together - the vibe, the size, the ambiance, the food... and last, but certainly not least, the beer!  Jessica is on-point. It seems like she covers the bar, the tables, and everywhere on Earth that isn't water. She is all over the place and still on top of things! Not to mention I'm pretty sure the beer selection here is better than anywhere I've ever been. EVER. EVER. EVER. Also Jessica's fault, by the way. Hard to find beers, aged beers, sour beers, reserves - you name it, Fat Angel has it. I had a Mikkeller that I didn't even know existed!  And the food? Amazing. Everyone raves about the Chicken Pot Pie - and of course, they were out of it. But I had the prosciutto flat bread, a three-cheese mac and cheese, and the sliders (which pretty much blew my mind). I would order all of them again. The flat bread had grapes on it, and somehow it still worked with all the other flavors, the mac and cheese had the perfect crust, and the sliders - I literally sat back and closed my eyes they were so good. I wasn't sure I'd make it back alive.  The only thing I wish they had were some fried foods - french fries, sweet potato fries, maybe some onion rings, or eggplant - but everything else was so good, that it wouldn't really make a difference anyway. I'll be back no matter what. I would give this place 10 stars if I could - I just wish I didn't live 450 miles away!

yjiH1HhF9Vait4eRxmL-hg.review_text: This place may be small, but what they offer is robust. Extensive beer offerings and employees with a decent knowledge of them. There isn't anything on the small food menu that isn't delicious. Perfect for a quick drink or a couple hours of lounging with a small group.

sqFLZOjVwQjn0z3UhJ1SGQ.review_text: This place is amazing. They had great food, beer and service!

V90ap8rhq1xbiRsLPOPsNQ.review_text: I really wanted to love this place, and I do! How can you not: salads, sliders, mac'n cheese, amazing wine selection and the best beer on tap and bottled in the city. FA, you knock my socks off every time.

Th4_nWOkFF_lmwFTZ_txAQ.review_text: A delightful, unpretentious wine bar with a very friendly staff, excellent lighting, gorgeous bar (made from an old church organ) and an all around lovely menu.  Can't wait to go back!

Afq57_KYVBBJlSj1X5-4xQ.review_text: Sweet little wine bar in the Fillmore..  Arriving feels like showing up at rustic cabin in the Alps where there's a fireplace roaring, friends have cooked a warm, hearty dinner and just as you sit, vintage wine & olives arrive. Its a soothin' sorta scene, and momentarily, cheeks go rosy.  Besides a lovely list of grape n bubbly, nary an ill-words can be uttered with a menu section devoted to assorted butters?! At next visit, i'll also look to taste their smoked trout.

A51KqJ7ZtwIZ8Q1bymiMaA.review_text: Lisa W. and I came here to nosh and drink before heading to catch a show at the Fillmore. Luckily for her, she lives about a block or two away.  It's super cozy and warm here. I liked the chill vibe and instantly thought this is a spot you can bring anyone for any occasion.   For $35, we split:  3 sliders - melt-in-your-mouth good and they came with a small cup of jalapenos   Mac n' cheese - some of the best I've had. We asked for a refill on the jalapenos to add some heat to the mac. Yes, that's how we roll.   2 Deschutes pale ales on tap  They have quite the extensive beer list as well so thumbs up to that. I can't wait to come back!

u_Fu09JD5uHkhv_w3FUW_g.review_text: Greeattttttt selection of beers, somewhat awkward seating but redeemed by intimate lighting and super friendly service.

tBwN4WJ8ffkCWUJ9wDGlWg.review_text: I love this homey and cozy place! FA is close to my place so it's convenient for me to hang out with my friends there. I've tasted almost all their menu and i still want to go there every week. Thinking of their foods makes my mouth watering already.   All foods are awesome. But please be sure to try their mushroom flat bread, organic Angus beef sliders and chicken roman heart salad!!!!! You will be surprised by their salad's portion (the biggest salad portion I've never seen before like this price) and the beautiful truffle smell from the mushroom flat bread.   Love their friendly service and relax atmosphere. I don't want to write the review for FA because it's getting more and more difficult to get a table there. Love it!!!

tuhP3TSHNgXHkNPuXodXmQ.review_text: Yummy Getman beer. Tasty cheese nuts and small plates.  Cosy atmosphere and friendly helpful staff.  What's not to like?   Close to kabuki so good place to hit before or between movies.  Go early.   Does get crowded .

-89IDABrt2vnhvoCiUlVCw.review_text: I've been here a few times, but this past weekend was review worthy. Thanks to the Ramen fest, the entire area outside of my appt was flooded by starving people who didn't want to wait in a 4 hour line for ramen. Oh man. We wandered until we realized we had 30m until Fat Angel opened, so we sat and waited, so SF.  Cut to 5m before 4, and the waitress on staff comes out to set up the outdoor seating area, and lets us know she is the only one working at the time. Poor girl, there are about 40 of us waiting at this point, and the kitchen doesn't open until 5.   We enter and sit in the corner, while the restaurant fills. The waitress and her barback are running around, taking everyone's orders - it was so fluid and efficient. She did a wonderful job and the staff (of two, haha) was attentive and quick.   We had our drink and appetizer about 15m after being seated, and by the time we were done with our appetizer (pretzel and garlic chili butter YUM!) she came around and took our dinner order.   I got the pot pie, which was amazing, and my husband got the grape flatbread - delicious. I ordered a lavender/black currant cider, which I cannot stop raving about. It was sweet and light, I kept thinking it was a sangria. We followed up that beverage with the sparkling mead - it was an interesting flavor, and effervescent, by the time I went to swallow, it had already turned into bubbles. Highly potent to boot.  All in all, it was a potentially disastrous day that was handled with professionalism and speed. If japantown is taken over by foodies, I would definitely do this again. Only negative is that they seem to have rounded up everything that was on the bill, which made our meal ~$20 more than I had anticipated. Kind of a downer, but things happen I guess?

o60yRcNLuy-oIjHfNlAEdA.review_text: I really liked this place... chill vibe...  kinda feels like a fancy neighborhood bar/cafe with a ton of beers... it's fun trying the different beers they have... bartenders were friendly and offered suggestions, descriptions, etc... they have a small food selection and we had already had dinner so all we got was the pretzel which was pretty good, but I'd like to come here to just eat and drink.... it's pretty small space, but I'd like to come here again.

BxXEXnFX8xeG7Y56-XXHZg.review_text: This place is way cool.  It's very intimate with no more than 10 tables inside, they have draft wine (say wha?!), a pretty extensive beer list, and great food.  The service was a little slow but it was probably part of the experience.  - The mushroom and white truffle flatbread was just delightful, I could come here by myself and chow down on that.   - The mac and cheese was great but a little heavy, even for mac and cheese.  - The cheese plate was fun and came with all sorts of cool jams but my party disliked more cheeses than not, no regrets though.

STiQRjmWUCQKErz98NrvIA.review_text: service was awesome; however, the food is OVERhyped!  I make better chicken pot pie & adult mac&cheese.

YkjUpkYSo7boAor32fVHDg.review_text: Fabulous!  What a little gem.  Wine on tap, tasty cheese plates and a great staff.  I think I have now tried everything on the menu.  All fantastic dishes!

vJ8-065FEjSsga9_YXXV4g.review_text: I have decided to do a small update to my review. Coming here again after a long time I was a bit worried that it wouldn't be the same. I didn't receive the same waiter as last time but had a girl named Stephanie who was equally amazing. The place was rather busy but she kept it a priority to check on us and keep a very happy and engaging attitude. Also something I like to take note of is that she poured a perfect beer for all three of my choice, I was impressed. They also got a bit more fancy with their cheese and meat plate. Coming here again set me at ease knowing i didn't need the same waiter to experience what I believe to be one of the best gastropubs around.  The choices are hands down the best and the service continues to amaze. Thank you once again for a great night. (side note this place is like a hub for match.com dates...what's up with that.) also still no update to a Gluten free beer but I can't blame them that much with the options being so depressing.

_fsgcV70cebAHlvwpZUZdg.review_text: Perfect stop before heading to the Fillmore. Excellent beer and tasty food.  Had a Hop Manna IPA and the smoked trout salad. It's the best damn salad I've ever had.

Aeo_Z1FwOjRs6UHdJ3NRHg.review_text: Pricey, small portions, good selection.  The thing that kicks it into four star territory is that everything I tried was top notch quality.  You won't get a lot of bang for your buck, but you will enjoy your meal.

RHmGm-lXuYKGsoBhatqnaw.review_text: Nice place. Looks rustic and a cool chandelier at the bar. I had a Belgian wheat beer, big 750ml bottle! Get the olives, it has a spicy aftertaste. The cheese was good too  All in all, a nice, calm place. Will frequent this one for sure!

mWovMFEZgWE40UVchWHlWA.review_text: Great barkeep attitude and beer selection

xlem6ZQCH2QWhwWbwEJE0A.review_text: I rarely give 4 stars but Fat Angel is my local hangout.  I have introduced so many friends and family members to this place.  It has become my place to go whenever I want to relax and enjoy a glass of wine.  The owner, Cyrick, has definitely made the place a second home for many people.  When you're there, as often or as rare, you feel a sense of connection to the place.  It's extremely chill with good wine and food.  Since it's still hasn't been discovered by many people, the crowd is typically couples or just good friends catching up.  The music in the background is usually an eclectic mixture of music put together by Cyrick that definitely makes the experience that much more pleasurable.  I would recommend trying their mushroom flat bread to go with your wine or the for dessert, try the apple bread pudding.  Those two items are absolutely my favorite there.

T1rP9rqslOh_72KI0IW7rQ.review_text: Really like this place:  - Huge beer and wine selection.  - House marinated olives (4) -- SO GOOD. They're Calvestrano olives (those giant, juicy, plump, forest green-colored ones -- my absolute fav) and they taste heavenly.  - Meat + cheese (6 for 28) -- We combined a bunch to make a charcuterie plate. Everything was really good, the duck salami and genoa especially stood out.  - 3 sliders (12) -- These were okay. Nothing special.  - Chicken pot pie (13) -- More like a deconstructed pot pie. The portions were huge, and this was delicious. Probably because it had like a pound of butter and cream in it (not listed in the ingredients), and as a lactard, I did not appreciate the after-effects.  This place is cozy, tasteful, and intimate, but gets crowded really fast. There is outdoor seating with heat lamps, but it still gets a little chilly. They don't seat your party until everyone is there.  Tip: They don't take reservations, but you can download the NoWait app and put your name down when they open (4 PM).

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: Things started out a little rough on a chilly Friday night when we had to hang out outside for a while, waiting for a table. At first it seemed like a lost cause, as the waitstaff only came by to bus other tables and comment how refreshing it was outside compared to the stuffiness inside. It didn't feel so nice as we were waiting! Another employee came out, took our name, and we were seated without a terribly lengthy wait. However, given how small the place is, I would be reluctant to come back when it's busy. The beer selection is pretty great, and the snacks (which the menu focuses on) are better than the main courses. The fried capers were fantastic and the good-sized dish of them really went a long way, and the serving of the smoked trout salad was quite large and good for sharing. However, I found the chicken pot pie to be too tarragon-y and would not get that again.

kZZt88M9Hrr_57mXlmYq4w.review_text: This little hidden gem is located smack dab in the middle of the Fillmore Jazz district at O'Farrell and Fillmore, fatangelsf.com. Its swanky, stylish and such a find. A couple of friends opened up the place and it retains the unpretentious, intimate look irrespective of the surrounding neighborhood. My only gripe with the Fillmore district is that it's either 4-star expensive or 1-star and cheap and dirty. This place is a perfect balance for the neighborhood as it appeals to a wide range of people, young or old, professional or artsy type. It's perfect for me because I fall in between both those categories (in San Francisco definitions). The wine bar is well decorated with reclaimed, recycled and repurposed materials from around San Francisco. So boho chic. The decorating highlights are the stamped tin roof and the "99 bottles of wine wall", aren't they so creative! The prices were average for the city, food was a bit cheaper than expected with the cheese plate being only $5 per cheese whereas you can pay up to $10 for the same sliver of cheese at other bars. The fried capers were delicious and creative. They tasted like the little fried bits of popcorn you find on the bottom of the bowl chocked full of salt and buttery deliciousness. I don't know how they made them, but keep it up. There is a wide selection of house made butters with all sorts of fun flavors like maple bacon and flatbreads to fill the tummy's of those who have a hard time just grazing. The theme for happy hour is "whine after work" which we all need from time to time, $1 off draft wines and beers and $2 off flat breads. What is draft wine you ask? Its the barrel of wine directly from the vineyard hooked up to a tap system similar to how bars serve beer. It's a fabulous idea and quite entertaining to check out. I'd never had draft wine outside of a vineyard before but I'll definitely come back to try out every kind. That's just the kind of dedicated blogger I am. Fat Angel is my new favorite local spot! Plus the name is entertaining. It reminds me of the Lyle Lovett song, "Fat Babies Have No Pride" which still puts a smile on my face. Poor fat babies.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: WINE ON TAP?!?!? I'm NO wine connoisseur, but the mental image I get is being poured a glass from a cardboard box of Franzia that has a harsh vinegary finish. *cringes* Boy, did Fat Angel prove me wrong...my 2009 Pinot Noir Canihan Sonoma, CA ($9.50/glass) is the BEST RED WINE I'VE EVER HAD!!! It was soft, seamlessly smooth and juicy with vibrant berry and aromatic floral tones. It trumps my favorite (now former) 2007 Montelena Estate Cabernet Sauvignon at Press Club ($27.50/glass). For someone that needs 6-8 shots of Goose to get a good buzz, two glasses were enough to give me the giggles. Talk about a bang for your buck! Don't forget to pair your fabulous glass of draft wine or beer with one of their delectable flatbreads. My friend and I split the Roasted Grapes, Walnuts, Prosciutto w/ Gorgonzola ($9) which was mouth-watering. With a slightly blistered crust, the flatbread was warm and crunchy with the perfect balance of salty, savory, smoky, nutty and pungency with a sweet tang. yelp.com/biz_photos/W0ml… Initially, I was skeptical about their draft wines but don't knock it till you try it. SERIOUSLY...

y3iV1om4K1aw7cD40hx0jQ.review_text: ivy.yelp.com and I used to frequent this place weekly. Dark casual gastropub vibe. Great salads the size of a human head. Pot pie = extraordinary. A real charcuterie plate. And a really eclectic and inventive beer menu that stood out in a town where Racer 5 has turned into the local equivalent of Miller Lite as far as distribution. And best of all, few crowds and attentive service. Then came this evening (a Tuesday, no less), as I walked into the restaurant. To myself: "Whoa, is that guy wearing dark-rimmed glasses? What are we, on Valencia?" "Hold on, is this a line on a Tuesday night for a table?" And then, "Oh no, I'm sensing a lot of plaid and male skinny jeans in this room." Then I realized that I walked by a few bikes on the way in. Oh. No. That's right. This place has been uncovered by hipsters. For that, I would love to give this place zero stars, but I just can't. Despite the fact that service was unusually slow (trying hard not to blame the huge influx of hipsters), everything else was great as usual. Just remember when a hipster tells you that they "found" an amazing new place on the fringe of Western Addition: random yuppie asian people were there first.

CvFgz9oYDBX_8_UBAIryeQ.review_text: BEER HEAVEN. Decent food judging by my experience, the only downside was the stale bread and not super great meat in the sliders. Otherwise delicious!

djxnI8Ux8ZYQJhiOQkrRhA.review_text: Definitely better! The gals behind the bar are very nice (different ones than before). I no longer cringe when someone mentions this wine bar.

g7RX6tKy1PebaaoKCXOhzQ.review_text: fantastic beers and awesome friendly service. went there with 5 of us on a rainy night, and they were super cool and welcoming.  we had the basil marinara flatbread, meat and cheese plate, bacon butter, and fried capers. they were yummy, but thought the portions for the meat and cheese plate was a bit skimpy, but still good.   i would definitely go back again soon to try more beers in the bottles!!  love this place.

lCvOT5oFHTWTsFbS9nV-lA.review_text: Fat Angle turned our ordinary Thursday into an awesome Thursday. Service was great, beer selection - amazing, food - delicious. We couldn't have asked for more.  They don't take reservations but we only had to wait 10 minutes to sit at the bar. The beer list was a comical mixture of modern day brewing but the bartender was great with recommendations and tastings of ones I was interested in.  My wife and I have eaten here twice now and haven been let down. A kale salad and chicken pot pie made for a perfect dinner on a cold rainy day or any day. Thanks Fat Angel. Until we meet again.

Rqg9Rf5ybblqBZ0p5iPn7g.review_text: I only got a chance to hang out at Fat Angel for about half an hour before last call (after stumbling in from Sheba Piano Lounge), but that half hour convinced me I need to come back.  This is a place I would love to be a regular at - friendly bartender, awesome decor (we added our picture to the tree!), large libation selection, and the food menu looked delicious.

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: THE GOOD -Ambiance is fantastic. I love the decor and it was really warm and cozy. -The mac & cheese was awesome. By far the best thing we had.   THE BAD -I don't know my cheeses but my date was not impressed with their cheese selection. -This place is incredibly small and they don't take reservations so be prepared to wait a while. -Street parking is a bitch.   THE UGLY - I had to ask for my Pimms Cup three times. They forgot completely the first two times I asked. - I'm 95% sure I left my favorite scarf here and my date called them a million times during their open hours and it took them days to finally answer. No scarf to be found.  - Worst bread pudding ever. It was doughy and tasted strongly of flour. It was disgusting.

rVA85dMsTw7B6v2opDuMuQ.review_text: I'm either too cheap or too poor to give this place a full five stars. Came here on a Saturday around 6:30 with four other friends. The restaurant is pretty small, so it took a while for them to be able to seat our odd numbered group. We had initially come here for outdoor seating, but the outdoor tables are best for groups of two or three so we just went inside, which was fairly loud because of the acoustics of the room. Sort of works for the vibe of the restaurant, just don't plan to have any intimate conversations here as you'll have to talk fairly loudly for your friends/date to hear.  We ordered the mac & cheese (yum), chicken pot pie (my choice favorite of the night), endive salad (delightfully huge portions), prosciutto flatbread (meh, kind of small and not filling but it'lll be hard to resist ordering one so my review probably won't mean anything to someone who's read this far), and a single cheese (this was the first item to come out and it's safe to say everyone in my group was disappointed at the size of the cheese and the bread). Personally, I was thinking that for $5 I could buy a huge block of muenster cheese and be pretty happy with that.  Overall, it was a nice place to try but I wasn't made into a regular. I feel like the food menu is overpriced by $2-3 for each item. But if nothing else, we did come to the conclusion that we should throw our own wine and cheese party at home, so I guess this place is good for getting the social creative juices flowing

KheemzNvPqrxDtOqdrOQ5g.review_text: WOW- what a gem! Cask wines and beers, in addition to several beers on tap! Cozy, intimate ambiance, super casual and hip. Was a perfect place to grab a beer before dinner at State Bird!  Interesting neighborhood...but I guess lower Fillmore is up incoming so that makes sense.

KtCONIE5_XOHybzkB0iysw.review_text: I have to say I love this spot.  I checked it out for the first time a couple weeks ago with a friend. They have an excellent selection of different beers and wines. Kudos on the nice selection of sours. I am definitely on a sour beer kick. The bartender was very helpful as we selected four different beers to split. Love the sweet and sour beer, but stay away from the wild berries under sours. It tastes like cough syrup. Bleh.  Food: Can't complain here either. Food was solid and tasty. The caesar salad is huge! Comes in a giant wooden bowl. Enough for three or four people. We also had the mac n cheese, sliders, and the pretzel.   Lastly, my favorite part. The ambience. It's a quaint neighborhood spot. Not pretentious. Great place to have a beer and a snack with a date or an old friend.

GvSn_tqkAD4wQHK1IRA-cw.review_text: If only they weren't so busy. We used to come here about once a week for a kale salad, chicken pot pie, and an IPA I had never heard of.

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Fat Angel is one of those quintessential go to spots.  The spot you go to on a date.  The spot you go to - to catch up with a friend.  The spot you go to with some friends.  The spot you go alone to - to unwind.  It's darling in every way. From their warm, yet mellow lighting. To their homemade infused butters with flavors like maple bacon and garlic chili. To their wild mushroom and truffle oil flat bread. To their heavenly delicate Cremant d'Alsace Brut. To their great music. To their kind and helpful staff. To their charming booth seating. To their late hours.  Fat Angel is that spot. A reliable respite from it all. A charming haven for long gazes. Long talks. Even long card games.  Late at night - when you're with someone - or with a group of people - and don't want the night to fade away - hurry on over to Fat Angel, grab a seat and let the comforting ambiance and impressive drink and small bites list - carry you softly into the evening.  Trust.

_Rn6-H5xG_-uxXr08avUCA.review_text: Great selection of worldly beers and yummy apps, however, I was disappointed that they didn't have Blue Moon. The area in which this bar/restaurant is located is not so great, but it does have cool ambiance.

52vFflAjGGKfSo-sNrF62g.review_text: Fat Angel Food & Libation  The name itself is already enough to make you want to go to this restaurant. I particularly delighted in their spicy mac n cheese.  I don't know what else to say, just that Fat Angel is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in SF!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: Happy one year anniversary, Fat Angel!

ouiLINW1TC8GBZ6FNlbNIg.review_text: Fat Angel is a cool lil spot in the Filly Milly! For those who aint be knowin, that be the Filmoe!   Now this spot is cool for a different style breakfast, I guess it is either english or irish style? I wasn't too sure, it is my guess! I dug it though, a bit pricey, especially for the 'Moe'! The portion of food I ordered was actually not bad! Especially for those who are watching they waist line! I would go there for happy hour to check out the spot for their wines, beers and such! Once again its pricey, they should check that, they may be around for a bit of time or not because of that very thang! Most are are doing bottomless mimosas for $15 bucks. Get it real ya'll, its the Filmoe, not specific whites, and keep it real cool! I may duck in there on a whim again we'll see what it do?!

j7FQoNpfnMUTT7cIsxFJsQ.review_text: This was a little taste of Brooklyn in San Francisco, which is just what we were looking for! Awesome beer list, great bar snacks, and a fun atmosphere. Tight quarters, but again it felt like New York so we were totally comfortable. Will definitely go back! Flatbread and chicken pot pie were both awesome, as was the service.

ccQln40oSXRN5EVmvOqbaQ.review_text: unexpected awesomeness.  we dropped in between visiting a friend and a birthday party - wanting a drink and snack and never having heard of fat angel before.  the staff was beyond awesome, the food was delicious, and with horseradish being one of my most serious pregnancy cravings, the greens with their garlicky-horseradish goodness did more than hit the spot and went perfectly with the mushroom flatbread.  when we return, it won't just be a pitstop!

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: LOVE this place. small. dark. simple. a ton of beer selections. an easy menu that you can't go wrong with. cheeses, charcuterie, flatbreads, mac n cheese, and chicken pot pie. all things that pair well with beer, of course.   the bartender wants you to drink something you enjoy and will talk you through their libations as well as offer you something different if what you've got isn't pleasing.  be prepared to wait some. at 815 on a wednesday we waited about 20 minutes. not too bad but i'll bet it gets worse at varying times in the night and on different days.

dqU8tw2irAinphSgss1ZsA.review_text: Food is outstanding. Wine is wonderful. I would suggest asking for a recommendation for wine the first couple of times you go. The bartender will steer you into some nice wines! I'm sure the food can vary in success...what restaurant doesn't have it's weak moments? I've been here with a small party (4) and with a large party (10). Yes, they accommodated a large party and when you see the place you'll know why it was a major undertaking! It was a bit noisy, however. I've sat at the bar and at the tables and each time the noise-factor pretty much precluded big-time, intense discussions. I'll bet if I sat outside, it would be different.

EGD7IQGQHlHk6-HV9P6biQ.review_text: I am so glad I brought my family to this spot. Everything you can find at Fat Angel that defines  a good date are here: delicious food, wine options, and the ambiance. MUST TRY the CHICKEN POT PIE... DELICIOUS! A def must go!

lX89A57ZsdTGx2BXaVLlYQ.review_text: I used to have a recurring dream that I owned a restaurant in Moscow that was interior decorated like a hunting lodge. Every night I was shaken down by mafia-governement workers, threatening to revoke my health permit unless I give them a cut of my profits. It was a beautiful place, very dark with a brown and mahogany color scheme. This was before the whole lodge thing was en vogue. I'd like to think that my dreamscape is ahead of the times.  Fat Angel kind of looks like the place in my dreams, but it's lighter, better decorated, and just cooler, without being too cool. There are animals overhead, a pipe organ, a beautiful bar, and, in contrast to my dingy and dreary nightmare, it's light filled and sunny-even if the streets are shrouded in fog.   I could see myself here on the regular. Wine on tap-in particular a robust Pinot. There are beers for people who speak of Trappist monks and hidden abbeys-special brews from round the world of which I know nothing, but whose stories are told by the lips of those who know. The food is warm, and stands alone from the libations. When a patron ordered a bread pudding, the whole place smelled wonderful. I like places that are small enough that you are attune to what others are enjoying. Fat Angel passes that test. Everyone was piqued by this warm and fragrant dessert, which evoked as many memories as that damn Proustian madeline. Warm and spiced apples can always tap into your past.  There will be no shake downs at Fat Angel. The people here are truly lovely.

BwPCLmCCfc1wc4Ethi6ctg.review_text: The pizza slices looked old like they had been sitting there for a few hours but It tasted better than it looked. Not a bad place to grab a quick bite but its nothing to rave about.

DIsr8FUzz-7kuxBcO7-E7Q.review_text: This place ass delicious, had a good atmosphere and a friendly staff!  They have about 200 types of beer and fantastic champagne!  Also, the food is fresh and the chef amazingly prepares masterful creations in a manner that was super yummy!  Thankfully we were able to walk in as they don't take reservations!  We got in with just a 25 minute wait at 6pm but the wait was much longer while we were slowing served!  SO DELISH!!!

gL-LsP3XUgIXUXs7R3WVUA.review_text: We were excited to eat and drink here, but never had the opportunity to do either. We got there around 7:30 on Thursday night and it was pretty busy but no one waiting to be seated. We asked how long the wait was and she told us 40-45 minutes (there isn't a lot of seating), so we asked her to put us on the list. She took our phone number and said she'd call/text when a table became available. There wasn't anywhere to stand and wait, so we took a walk until we got a call, but we never heard back from her. Not sure if we would have eventually been seated had we waited around or if it's a good thing that we went elsewhere while we could, but this was a big let down since we were all looking forward to checking this place out.  Lesson learned: it's a pretty small restaurant so expect long waits or make reservations (if they take them).

TqJtCq-ZX4khLEEROQ7NHw.review_text: Well-seasoned pot pie and delicious sliders. You are missing out.

ym91NK9QMPDU2g00zEuLIg.review_text: High quality cheese platters.  Excellent mac and cheese.  Delightful ambiance.  Friendly staff.  I just wish it opened before 5 on Fridays since I'm done with work at 4:30.

3F1WbXOdOdiDTSE1nhwWSw.review_text: De-licious.   First off, the flatbread is the best. Especially the one with grapes. Sweet and savory is always a smart combo. The mac-n-cheese is also very good, but super heavy... definitely not just a snack, but great as a meal.  Secondly, wine on tap is the best invention since the snuggie. The shiraz is exceptionally good. And we tried a few.   The decor is swanky and homey all at once. It's a tiny place, and probably not great for a large group, but the perfect spot to kick back with a few friends.   Fat Angel is a little bit on the pricey end, but I think I'm just spoiled by all the places to get a cheap drink in SF. It's not the place to go for a cheap happy hour beer, but it's worth it if you're looking to linger and savor your food, drink, and company.  It's in a totally weird and unexpected neighborhood, but trust me, it will be worth the trek and the 45 minutes you spend trying to figure out how to get home in a wine induced stupor.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: Fat Angel is a great little nugget of a wine bar located just around the corner from the Fillmore. The wine list is well selected (though you really can't go wrong with the wine on tap) and the food menu small but well edited. Not only do they have your meats and cheeses but they also have a great pot pie, mac & cheese and a selection of butters. Yes, butters. Nothing wrong with some maple bacon butter to go with your pinot noir!  Service is friendly but can be a bit slow, especially on a show night. That being said, it's definitely worth the wait. Fat Angel is officially my new go-to venue for a drink and bite to eat before a show at the Fillmore.

5THOPwq9R4ld3_RbZvMZjg.review_text: Now *this* is a gastropub... high-quality libations AND food. It's unassumingly cool yet cozy: there's something about their old-school chalkboard menus and fabulous chandeliers that speaks to me -- even that big ol' deer head mounted on the wall seems charming in this space. And the awesome service (Juliet is my fave there) is just the cherry on top.  The microbrews are awesome; the flatbreads are tasty; and the salads are HUGE. Outdoor seating is lovely during the warmer days, but the tiny little inside (especially the bar) is really a great place to sit and eat a bite, too. They've got a fabulous selection of wine (you gotta love a place that has wine on tap) if you're in a vino kinda mood, which very well might strike given the romantic atmosphere.  Overall, a great little spot to sit, sip, and simply enjoy. I'll be back!

mhIWDTZgZN17tQvRBpSiBQ.review_text: Good selection of Wine and Beer.

A-q5Rz4z7k6Kafos0Vx96w.review_text: I know once I finish writing this review I am going to regret it. Reasoning is that this place is so amazing and once this place blows up like it should, I will never get a seat when I come here. But it is my obligation (as my friends reminded me last night) to tell you of this wonderful place.  This place is just what The Fillmore needs, and I am so pissed that I moved away from this neighborhood because 1. It was walking distance to my house, and 2. It's a wine/beer bar that is reasonably priced, has amazing food, and friendly service. Whoever thought of making a bacon butter or a chocolate cinnamon butter needs to patent that shit because those two butters were two of the most amazing parties I have ever had in my mouth. Adding it with their country bread was genius! Looking for a little more substance? Their sliders and  their Mac n Cheese were both delicious. While the Mac n Cheese was par, their sliders were some of the best sliders I have ever had in my life!  Their wine and beer selection is amazing. While I stuck with the wine side this time, I was extremely impressed with the variety, as well as them being able to cover a lot of regions throughout the world. The owner, who was serving us, was extremely knowledgeable and for my last glass, I made him pick something for me. He ended up picking a beautiful Portuguese wine that was big and bold and fabulous!   The atmosphere is awesome. Small, quaint, perfect for that girls evening where you want to sit at a table and catch up, or for the predate drink where you are sitting at the bar. The owners also have an amazing taste in music, all his own collection. We made him promise that he would never change the music. The whole bar is made from a church organ he was able to snag from napa, and beautifully restored.  I am so glad my friend stumbled upon this and wanted to share it with myself and our girlfriends. We all had nothing but excellent comments about this place and decided this is probably going to be our go to spot when we want to get together for a drink and hang out. I cannot wait to come back here to hang out, have a glass of wine, and relax.   Like I said, I'm already regretting sharing this place with my fellow yelpers.

urg4WkUTxeE_6n4SvJ8Zxg.review_text: Great place for a first date... Nice and cozy, romantic, intimate atmosphere.   Greens (Trout)- HUGE bowl of salad. Fried capers were unique, surprisingly addicting.  Chicken Pot Pie- Must order. Much bigger portion than I expected. Very rich.  Spicy Mac n Cheese- Wow... Surprised with a sharp, pungent flavor upon first bite. Loved it.

UQFE3BT1rsIYrcDvu_XVow.review_text: A decent wine bar for non-wine guys. but a great place to meet up with friends or go out with your special someone.  still, I think Amelie edges it out. Granted, you must get to Amelie earlier/during their amazing happy hour if you have a group of 4-6 while Fat Angel has a little more leeway.

dMeFqCLKzjVmE60YNGi2Pw.review_text: Unusual draft beers and solid selection of draft wine.Friendly, attentive barmen. Low light AND low music, so you can actually carry on a conversation.  Easy going crowd. I don't want to see the place get packed, but the guys running the place deserve the five stars.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: I really like Fat Angel. There's something about it that is so New York... what I love and miss. Packed restaurants, dim candle lit settings, and everyone having a good time. The way Fat Angel was decorated was very thoughtfully planned out. You've got a moose head hanging from a wall, a beautiful chandelier, and a giganto church pew as a seating bench.   Of course, being Friday night, we were greeted with a nice hefty wait. Even the bar area had a wait and usually the bar is first come first serve. My party sat by the bar, but the way the table behind us was placed, there wasn't enough room for someone to be back to back, especially guys. So we made it work while we could before the last person showed up. I ordered a flatbread while waiting and it was fanfreakingtastic. The mushrooms and truffle oil just melted in my hungry mouth. It was going to be an hour wait before we sat down.  As time went by, the owner felt bad for our situation. First we needed a 4th chair by the bar area to wait, but then he told us that someone was getting up and that we'd be seated next. Except the a-holes at the table would not leave for the life of anyone (why would you even do that knowing there's such a long wait? I hate people with no etiquette! If you're done eating, get UP and move your party elsewhere). Anyway, they stayed at the table so long, the owner told us to just stand nearby and pressure them to get up, while the other two in our party sat down next to them. They got the hint and ended up leaving, thankfully.  So... before I proceed to food reviews, just do yourself a favor and go there around 10pm. That's when the madness dies down.  I remember the mac'n'cheese being so good here. And lastly, the sliders were tasty as well. I liked the intimacy of the space and would definitely come back here. Just hope I don't have to wait as long next time!

EiwxlbR8fb68lMgEXhcWKA.review_text: This is a super cute and cosy restaurant that I had a chance to come w/ my bff and her bf (ha that's a mouthful ...) recently when we got together for dinner.   By cute and cozy I mean this place is TINY. We were sitting 3 at a table and I was feeling like a giant of sorts. Because the place is small, it usually smells like olive oil and fried things as the kitchen just drifts into the air of the place ... but the bar is cute and their selection of wine and beer is quite extensive.  The thing that surprised me the most, actually, was the fact that they had a large beer list. Who knew, I thought this was a wine bar!  The wait staff are very friendly, and very knowledgable, but seem somewhat rushed since they were sort of looking like they wanted us to get out of there every time we finished a bottle ... but aside from that everything was good. I did enjoy the flat bread, the mac and cheese (yum!), and the deconstructed chicken pot pie. Recommended for a date, especially since it's so dark you can't really see ;) haha ...

Jv9XnGcd9P8DeZQ4m7QWgg.review_text: Only had beers and truthfully did not remember leaving so that always gets five stars!!!! The Molotov cocktail IPA at 13% did me in in such a perfect way!

e5WYxNp7iJGb3HhHb78tYg.review_text: Great little place for good wine and apps. Way better than traditional wine bar food, and some outdoor seating. Go early as it fills up quick though!

LPh3yxJZ0_YDkTbjXz2jlQ.review_text: I love this bar!!! We always go here on our way to the Kabuki. They have a fantastic beer selection for the fella and a lovely, diverse (aka not just Californian) wine selection for me, and the food is really good (although it could use a couple of veg-friendly non-salad options). The garlic aioli on the sliders is so good I literally lick the plate clean (although I usually use my finger-- I'm not THAT gross... usually). Knocked a star off for being closed between brunch and happy hour on the weekends-- stay open! We'll come in I promise!!!

pAOfQZX3jD1f0kS569tzZw.review_text: Great chicken potpie, great mac n cheese, and great apple bread pudding. Such an extensive beer list! Very impressive.

vq6ZyYZ3MnFLGUd_0-hTyg.review_text: been here once and loved it! almost went again the other night, but we got on a different path. great wines, fun atmosphere, delicious food and just an overall fun vibe! will definitely be back.

mE-hdFF4RgCxspZU72GAsw.review_text: Love this local hangout; I remember when the place was empty and we were all thinking, "Gosh hope they pull it off." I guess they did because I couldn't even get a seat the last time I was here with less than a 75-minute wait. That's great for them, but I wish they'd remember the good old days and get me the same seat I used to sit in, on the old church bench actually, against the wall. Miss their great flatbreads, wine, apps, and epic beer. Congrats guys!

CWU7Bkz4TSz-mpVSLDzrbQ.review_text: Awesome neighborhood spot! Excellent wine selections. I had a glass of the Carmel Valley Chardonnay and it was crisp and delicious. The food is great too. I highly recommend the trout salad and the mushroom flatbread...yum!

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Glad we found this place! We came by before a movie at the Kabuki, and we started with some wine and a little charcuterie and cheese plate. SO good, and large portions. Then we got a kale salad, and were presented with a mountain of it. We really could have ended our meal there, but I couldn't get my mind off some comfort food like their mac n cheese or chicken pot pie. Unfortunately.. the pot pie just wasn't good. It first came out lukewarm, then when they said they'd remake it, they def just microwaved it bc the "crust" then came out soggy. Sadface. That said, the server/bartenders are wonderful and make amazing recommendations.

FkbIRfKexjXyG-X5mso95w.review_text: I loved this place so much that I am going to review it and give it five stars for food, service and ambience. The trout salad was awesome as were the sliders. Prices were reasonable and wine was good. A great place to stop in before going to a show at the Fillmore as it is right nearby.This review is not the opinion of anyone else but me personally.

niCHcn-IBucMELJLaDtKQw.review_text: Butters are great!! Sliders are delicious! Ambiance is excellent!

9ue2qQ2yEOdYB1OM-VgF1Q.review_text: Only complaint - no room to wait for a table! Felt a little bit like we were partaking in a human slide-puzzle.  Ordered: Malbec - fantastic, they also have wines on tap, which is pretty neat Sage Capter Butter - really great way to start off a meal, love the homemade bread too. Can't wait to come back and try other flavors! Cesar Salad w Fried Capers - really large, very tasty. We needed it with all our savory food! Pot Pie - also very large, delicious - reminds me more of chicken & dumplings  If you come with another person, share everything - portions are too large to order on your own. I will be coming back! Can't wait to try the homemade pretzel!

47rMigvnjT7QTQBHcuMe2A.review_text: Came in on a Saturday night - they don't take reservations, so we just showed up around 8:00PM. About a 20 minute wait (during which time, drinks were involved). It's a small place, and I think we got lucky on the timing - our wait time really wasn't bad at all.  The drinks are priced anywhere from the regular/affordable and up to a 'sky is the limit' deal - pick what you want. The selections were nice, something for everyone - check out their menu for more to choose from, not just the board.  Very casual atmosphere, hip... all that good stuff - it is a small place, so we were almost elbow to elbow with the table next to us, not that it was a problem.  As food goes, we had the polenta fries (loved it), the maple bacon butter, some of the meat (I can't remember the name), a kale salad, and the mac and cheese - with a drink on the tab, we only came out to $50! If I was going to exclude anything, it would have been the meat - not that it was bad in any way, but the rest of the menu is what I'd suggest trying! It was simply the least memorable part of the meal. The salad in particular stood out for both of us - and an order of that is easily good for three people (we couldn't quite finish it with two of us). The mac & cheese was more on the order of 2 people, I think.  As someone mentioned, if it isn't too breezy that evening, consider bringing a jacket and sitting outside if you want to sit and eat quickly; that evening, I think only one group elected to sit outside, the rest of us waited for a spot inside!

7L3IP1lNWKudT_vdEThsjw.review_text: Our regular Happy Hour spot!!  Very friendly and attentive wait staff.  The last time I was there I tried the garlic chili butter, it was great!  a great place to relax and get a drink.

vVpl4zjimGC0z46mAiIYgQ.review_text: Excellent food prices (beer not so much) and friendly service  Stumbled across this place before going to Fillmore (Squeze show) and can't believe I'd never seen it before. V. friendly tattoo-of-the-world server; we got a $10 salad that could have served three.  Incredible range of Belgian and Swiss (mostly) beers and I've tipped off the MeetUp beer crew.

GiBM39Ljmkk7u3kWarUpFA.review_text: The wine they offer is great , it a fun bar the bartender is nice and some people I meat was out of towners  and they were having a great time at this bar. They were just happy to relax at fat angel. They said  the will be back next week I told them I met them here. Once again the bar is like cheers and the people our friendly

X_zDwUumr8W8BPAccyzfpw.review_text: I look for traditional home-cooked food in SF and it's honestly hard to find. This place nailed it with the chicken pot pie- just like Grama's. Also the salads are huge and tasty! Well worth the money.

om_QW7sQAO48Jna3L2fnqA.review_text: Vast beer selection. Utterly satisfying comfort food. Best mac and cheese.

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: I was meeting a friend for some drinks and food and we planned to hit a few spots in her neighborhood.  We ended up at Fat Angel first for a glass of wine and a flat bread mushroom pizza.  Service was eh...something about the server girl slapping down our two menus on our table to start of our first impressions of the place.  I'm sure she didn't mean anything negative because she did slap them down with a smile.    Our wine came off their tap, and the pizza came out quick and efficiently.  I can't complain about their food; it was delicious and a good start to our food/drink happy hour crawl.

mFhwrlkThDMyg_LqPVAT2w.review_text: Romantic, delicious, rich, make-faces-like-you're-in-heaven kind of restaurant.  I ordered the gruyere mac n' cheese and the sliders. It was like comfort food went to college because it's classic American dishes but with an elegant flare. I was supposed to be at a concert at the Fillmore but I ended up not coming in until the opening acts were over because the food was that good! I didn't want to rush the experience.  The one downside is the wait. I think it would have been more bearable if I ordered a drink like the person next to me, but it was too cold to wait outside so I awkwardly placed myself right beside a set of light switches, which I accidentally turned off at one point. My apologies to all the patrons for that second of non-visual dining experience.  Try it yourself! Even picky eaters will love :D

cHFc7QATeFr6OvX_Pk9D8Q.review_text: Pros: delish food (try the smoked trout salad). Reasonable prices, wine on tap and great beer selection. Cozy, interesting decor and neighborhood vibe. Great location off the fillmore.  Cons: mediocre service, can get crowded on weekends, slightly cramped especially if you're in one of the side bench tables.

Q7hjgRQg0vJlsBdGoc7Cag.review_text: food & beer was amazing! service not so much. but it won't keep me from coming back.

WPBrjBbk76ZtZQ8QpG09cQ.review_text: Crowded bar/restaurant close to Fillmore/Japantown  With the dim red heat lamps outside the entrance, the place always looked like a party spot whenever I stop by. When I finally had a chance to visit, it turns out the decor inside is quite interesting as well, with a wood/nature/animal theme. There is a large selection of beer, wine, and cocktails--the tall poppy I got was definitely nice, with a distinct flavor that I haven't tasted before.  The food items are also equally satisfying, though not cheap--the cheese blocks and the salami items are savory, and aromatic. Also, everyone pretty much orders the mac&cheese, which is cooked just right with a crusty layer of cheese near the center of the plate. mmmmm  The price is definitely on the mid-to-high range, so be aware before stepping in.  Overall, a pretty good place to visit once in a while with friends

9dOGFFn35If2MXguwGTzKw.review_text: Super helpful staff! They helped us pick a beer that we loved! Had the pretzel with a side of cheese dip (OMG), and the very delicious kale salad!

bWvELivVIa81tFEqiLxS4A.review_text: WHY... of WHY wasn't this place open when I used to live at the Fillmore Center?    I usually don't give 5 starts after just one visit, but I loved everything about this place.  The interior and ambience is relaxing and I immediately felt comfortable as soon as I walked in.   I loved that although there was a steady flow of people going in and out it never got very loud.  The staff (Jason) was very friendly and fast with all our orders.  If I had an opportunity to open a wine bar, I'd basically just replicate this place.

4Ev2ab9JLlbaZbwI0jPuRQ.review_text: Malbec on draft... Sign me up! Solid place but be prepared for a wait at times. A must-do spot, for the Fillmore.

na2I2OlX2wP0oQp96ZOouw.review_text: go thursday nights when all the cool kids in town show off their crazy hipster style. obey's shepard fairy is known to take the decks and spin old school, hip hop and and mix anywhere in between. sit back and people watch until your heart's delight. or

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: There's a trend going on, did you notice it?  What's with all these gastropubs sprouting all across the city, and WHERE were they before?  How come it took so long for some people to realize we love our booze and foodz?  In comes, Fat Angel, tucked away in what seems to be a thriving neighborhood compared to yesteryears.  And with a wide selection of beer, it may be the Western Addition's very own version of dare I say it, Monk's Kettle.  However, Monk's kettle will always have a place in my heart, but Fat Angel will be the neighborhood's finest.    With a nice intimate spot and dim lighting with a good size bar, Fat Angel offers more than what it looks.  The beer selection on tap may be smaller, but they carry some amazing beers on bottle.  I was able to try some of the IPA from San Diego, but will definitely come for more other ones.    And sitting outside with the heat lamps has its perks as there was a jazz  dance happening right across the street.  Quite a spectacle.  And the food, the food was great compliments to the beer.  Between my buddies and I, we enjoyed every single bit of it  -Flat Bread with Wild Mushroom and Truffle - amazing.  Almost like a simplified pizza, but the truffle and mushrooms make this. -Salamate with Truffle - yes I like truffle, but on everything, I'm all game for.  We had the meat plate and this was definitely the best amongst the other ones which were good too. -Pot Pie - good crisp and flaky crust with an amazing flavorful filling with tender chicken. -Sliders - probably the only thing I could have skipped on, but it was good.

f9xHtDot9Yjqalc1x_8-0g.review_text: Super small, but cute wine bar.   Great menu, superb presentation on all dishes and even down to the wine bottles they serve your drinks in.  Excellent service and an overall cool vibe.

A89MjFltabOCP4ThDSiAlA.review_text: This is a great little place that does a few dishes really well!  Best: Mac n cheese Chicken pot pie  Atmosphere: intimate, dim lighting and trendy  I will come here again!

q7mbPAK0g_9jbZL2dHANIA.review_text: Wandered in here on an impromptu date night. Atmosphere is great-- organ pipes, mounted deer head and a chandelier-- I'll take it. We didn't have a reservation and it was a Friday night. The hostess took our phone number and said she'd text in 30 minutes or so, when our table was ready. The "new beers" chalkboard almost scared us off-- $30 for a beer? But they have a lot of more affordable options among their extensive drinks menu.   The place is small, very small, so if you're waiting for your table on a busy night be prepared to be in everyone's way the entire time. Or, stand outside like we did. Luckily, our table was ready in 20 minutes.  We squeezed into the corner table with our order already ready. A prosciutto flatbread to start, pork sliders and the chicken pot pie to share. We were expecting "fancy place" portions but were pleasantly surprised to find fantastically midwest portions. We stupidly filled up on the flatbread, leaving only enough room for 2 sliders for him and 1 slider for myself. We took the chicken pot pie to go and enjoyed it the next day for lunch. Absolutely delicious. Best I've ever had. Wine, beer, appetizer and two entrees? Less than $50 and enough for lunch the next day.   We'll definitely be back!

3xsmXxDysn5yqflq3AzWKQ.review_text: Fat Angel rocks. It's a total gem tucked just off of the main Fillmore Street drag. I came here with some friends and enjoyed everything: a great draft brew, delicious wine delivered via a keg-system, and some quite creative small plates. The trout salad and the beef sliders were full of flavor and a perfect size to share family style. The staff was extremely accommodating, especially considering that its a pretty small place.  Fat Angel is totally worth the visit!

NK5nADZUYGor1Bknp1CrLw.review_text: spent so much money  here!!! but well worth it :)  wine list is extensive and DELICIOUS!  food is even more amazing...  Trout salad was so flavorful and refreshing at the same time, definitely a must.  Macraroni and cheese was a bit rich for my taste but damn good still... Rabbit pate was served with gourmet mustard and super delicious.  The truffle oil with mushroom flat bread was really to die for. It reminded me of the nopa flatbread :)  Service was excellent. The bartender hates iphone so i loved him a lot :) So i'm definitely coming back to try the chicken pot pie!!!

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: What's not to love about this gastropub?! (well except the hipsters)  Meat platter, cheese platter, sliders, mac and cheese and chocolate mousse?!  We crammed ourselves into the bar while we waited for a tiny little table to free up.  The bartender was awesome, our server was great and the food came out steadily and was yummy.

WaVpGC24zs6mYZQKjcMjHw.review_text: Fat Angel did not fail to disappoint at all.  My friend kept raving about the food, the wine and the ambiance, and we hit the spot up after a light meal at Epic Roasthouse.   The place is kinda small, but I like that--warm and cozy. The lighting is dim and has a candelit feel to it. They have windows that open up for air circulation or cooling down the place on a hot day.  Outside seating is available but impossible during the cold windy night I visited.   The flatbreads, Cy's nuts, and maple bacon butter were solid.  I'm not a wine connoiseur, but one of the servers was extremely helpful with my other friends who wanted particular wines.   Service is solid and delivered w/a smile.  As mentioned, servers were knowledgeable about the wino and offered great suggestions. Also, they always appeared at the right time and definitely checked in to see how our party was doing.  Bonus points in my book.

IFqmxztS2vZjtCeURfzZ-g.review_text: Genius idea I wish I'd had. Open a white boy comfort food joint in the middle of the asian ghetto, thus giving all the white boy asian fetishists somewhere non korean bbq to eat, and all the white boy loving asian girls somewhere to go below their apartments where they have a spectacularly high chance of seeing white boys.   Been a couple of times and the food is solid if unspectacular. Had the pot pie which tasted suspiciously like it had come from somewhere else, the mac and cheese which was highly acceptable and something else I cant remember. Not brilliant, but certainly not rubbish. If I lived in the area I would probably be quite a regular, but then I am right in their target demographic.

A_GnFwoyjWTL2s_8UfCrsA.review_text: +1 Charcuterie and warm bread -1 Honey, cinnamon butter?  Weird, bland...I don't like it. -1 Service taking forever, waitress ignoring us until the place cleared out, which probably led to an unnecessary half hour wait for the table and some other food issues (see below).  +1 Delicious beer -1 Cider out of a bottle costing $12. +1 Salad, especially the trout salad -1 Limited menu, but no pot pie available.  Also, sliders were tasty (steamed even) but a little bit pathetic looking and thin like half-sized McDonald's cheeseburgers -1 Waitress blaming the 'Mexican staff' on Mac and Cheese that was too spicy for one of the diners (a supertaster who thought she was just ordering Mac and Cheese), but doing nothing to remedy the situation of inedible mac and cheese (i.e. taking it off the bill, offering an alternative)  Overall rating, 2.5 because I will probably come back but only for drinks and not primarily for food.  This place does not deserve a gastropub description if it only has limited bites and the limited bites are pretty darned expensive.  A more consistent and robust menu would probably improve my rating.

xTZT5y91yj9EmPm32j9TnQ.review_text: Really fantastic. Great wine (price range is fair!), and delicious food! We shared a bottle of Reisling ($34) and an amazing plate of mortadella, hot coppa, and brie! mmmmm ($5 each or a plate of 5 appetizers for $21)--the service was very attentive and the ambience is wonderful (love the chandeliers)--a great addition to the neighborhood.

xyqnCAQsARyayfkl0dSNKg.review_text: Came here on a random Friday evening, and it was quite crowded. We managed to squeeze in a seat for four before the crowd got really crazy. We ordered:   Maple Bacon butter and bread Mac 'n Cheese Charcuterie platter 3 Sliders + 1  Everything tasted good, and they have a wide selection of beer and wine. Just beware the crowd!   In fact, the place was so crowded that the server mixed up our bill with someone else's. The server ended up comping a few dishes. SCORE!

2_cYY6CX82oblZZDC1MOpQ.review_text: This is the spot if you love good food and good beer. The bartenders are very knowledgable, I've loved every suggestion they've given me. The food is inventive, from fried capers (OM NOM NOM) to an excellent pizza I had with mushrooms and cheese.   I love to stop there on my way to Sundance Kabuki, but I have to admit that I usually end up wishing I hadn't made other plans because I'm having a great conversation with someone at the bar. Also beware of huge crowds when there's a show at the Fillmore. Pick an off day, and you're all set.

l3GiFyNYsma3wMembQzeVA.review_text: The sliders are paper thin, drenched in garlic mayo and the buns are greasy and soggy.  What a disgusting joke!  The mac & cheese was greasy and way too crunchy.  More poseur food for the clueless.  I remember when SF was a foodie town.  Now we cater to morons from BFE with way more money than taste.  The flatbread was okay, but you really can't mess up something so simple, and it wasn't nearly as good as you'd find at Nopa.  The service was pathetic.  Our waitress actually went out of her way to be rude, as if she's too good for her job.  Bitch, puh-leeeeeeze!  Only redeeming factor was the extensive beer list, but the prices are ridiculous.

vUI0jXAxFDzoLX04jN9RPA.review_text: Besides the long wait and pack of people, definitely a great place to chill and have glorified bar food.  They have tons of beer and drink choices. The drafts are good and I love that they told you a little about it to see if you'd like it. The workers are definitely on it and friendly, which makes the waiting a little better.   The chicken pot pie is delicioussssssss! The crispy cheese layer on top and the creamy chicken on bottom. So juicy and flavorful.  The truffle flat bread with sausage is definitely yummy but seriously no truffle taste. You guys run out or something??  Would def come back to try more of the menu.   I left a little more fat. Thanks.

d7evN7k7ifBNCVz4tEGPYA.review_text: I'm really torn. The choice of wine and other drinks were top notch, however the food was awful.   I had one of the flatbreads, my wife had the mac'n'cheese and both were completely over peppered to being inedible. Even a couple of bites managed to ruin the wine.   So yea for the place and drinks nay for the food

3L769LV7-unVER9h1LdfYQ.review_text: My daughter and I came for some wine and cheese but we ended up with true love.  The champagne to start, the wine to follow and some cheese with honey butter and bread then we moved on to order a salad for her and the pot pie for me.  The owner said it was his grandmothers recipe........it was the best pot pie ever...melt in your mouth light fluffy crust and the sauce had tarragon in it that was magnificent!

w6SaPljfM2KfW9guNXCkGA.review_text: I have really wanted to love this place, but after a few visits I have only fallen in like.   We went last night for dinner and drinks before a show at the Fillmore. We each had a glass of draft wine (cab for him, zin for me) and they were delish. Being draft doesn't seem to make it any cheaper than other glasses, except that it is a dollar off at happy hour.   We also shared the red grape and prosciutto pizza, a cheese plate, and the sliders. The sliders were the fave but none of it was "i can't wait to go back and have it again" good. Our total bill was about $40 which i thought was very reasonable.   I love the low-lit ambiance (I by no means needed a candle to read the menu... ). When we got there at around 6:30 there were only one or two other people seated at the bar. I was disappointed because the last time we stopped by, we were also the only ones.  It kind of kills the mood when it is silent and empty. It started filling up though by the time we got our food. The chandelier is awesome and I love the big old wooden bar and the corks lining the top.   If I lived closer, I would love this place to grab a glass of wine and relax. I just don't know that it is worth the trek from North Beach.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: As the Fillmore area keeps going in flux, it's nice to see nice new establishments run by people who really love what they're doing. Came in here for a quick dinner before catching a show down the street. Had the Chicken pot pie, Sliders, and some charcuterie washed down with glasses of Chenin Blanc (Vouvray) and Grenache. The owners are always walking around and checking in with you and for such a small space it's pretty lively. In fact it was downright loud on a Thurs night with drinkers conversing all over the bar and dining area. Dig all the old artifacts they dug out of a Napa church to decorate the space. Obviously one must regard the cherub, aka Fat Angel that adorns the area above the entrance.

emF8KqAfI2VL6Sfaek9gFg.review_text: Mac & cheese here is sinful Skipping it is a mistake That's why the angel is fat ... wine headache.  Wine and scrumptious food to go with it are my weakness. Hence I liked this place so much I came two nights in a row!  The food here is yummy enough to stand alone. Now that I've tried their amazing mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie (kind of salty), I'd love to sample their antipasti and organic butter.  As with any other small wine bar, the extensive wine list is unique and has been put together bottle by bottle by the co-owners. I got to chat with one of them about their business venture and the story behind it (the inspiration for the name "Fat Angel" actually came from China of all places). If Cyrick isn't too busy, you should flag him down, he's awesome!  The décor is like chapel meets speakeasy. Or maybe it just feels that way since you're sitting in a church pew staring at an organ... downing a bottle of tempranillo. The intimate space is mood-lit by candles and chandeliers--super date-appropriate. Just watch out for slow service on a busy night. If time is not a factor for you, however, then feel free to spend all evening in this cozy little spot, which I'm really glad is thriving in its home in the heart of the Fillmore.

CQ8OSQFPCCoo0ujxEyEVRA.review_text: The proximity of this gastropub to my house definitely ups the ratings a bit, but they could hold their own even if it was farther away.  I end up stopping by this place more often than not when going out for drinks around my area. They have excellent bites (even dinner if you want a meal there) and a great beer and wine list. I had a sour beer last time that was really delicious: Echte Kriekenbier Brouwerij Verhaeghel  6.8%   Flemish Red Ale (Cherry),  BEL (330ml)  I looked up the name so all of you can try it and enjoy the deliciousness.

XQTEWzgfsCxIrR1pMDtRQQ.review_text: Like most others in this review thread, I was delighted and surprised when I found Fat Angel tucked away in it's quirky little corner in the Fillmore.  The wine and beer menus were some of the best I've seen in the city. With its   healthy bias toward local producers, this joint quickly jumped into a high position in my "take out of town friends here to show off the SF goods" list.    We had a sampling of food from the meats and cheese and very tasty salad.  As soon as we walked in, we knew we were going for a salad; those being served to the other guests looked too good to pass on.  The flatbreads didn't exude the same pull.  Great place for a few drinks and a casual meal.  I definitely plan on hitting it up before a show next time I have tickets to the Fillmore.

XXrDqD00yB30TY71Xh3oeA.review_text: Lived across the street from here for a year, always brought my friends from out of town in, and I wanted to introduce them to my favorite place to grab a beer in SF.  Cy was usually my bartender, always able to recommend a good beer with a big hop character, and the apple bread pudding is to DIE FOR.

rS4GekjCeCps6ubQjLqSXw.review_text: Fun, kind of eccentric place with a church pew! Great wine, good prices, love the indoor/outdoor feel. I went there with a girlfriend, but now want to do a pre-date hang out with the boyf there too.

urqtKpxG3VM6C2vxhb1ilA.review_text: What a neighborhood gem. Like a good Yelper, I observed from Yelp friends' check-ins that Fat Angel was/is the place to go. I've walked by it many times especially on Saturdays when the Fillmore Farmers' Market takes place. Now I know what all the rage is about. It's low key, the food is good, and the patrons are locals. Not that this place needs another glowing review (as there are many already), but here are my two cents.  I walked in promptly at 7 on Sunday night to join some friends for dinner. They've been here before and agreed to my recommendation. Clearly, they were also happy former patrons. One of my friends noted their wine selection is among the best, and I saw that as well. They have an extensive wine menu... but I wasn't there for wine. I was there for other libations. So, I ordered the Pimm's Cup: lemonade, Pimms #1, and cava. This came with plenty of ice (which I personally enjoy). Very refreshing, and had just enough bite and alcoholic "zing!" for a Sunday evening.   We decided to share a charcuterie platter which was, no doubt, a fantastic idea. The prime selection of meats and cheeses came with spiced and candied nuts, various jams, and mustard. Loved it. Oh, and duh! It came with copious amounts of bread. How could I forget THAT?!   We also shared the endive, apple, candied walnuts, and gorgonzola salad with roasted chicken shreds (+$3). This was a delicious and heaping amount of greens and fruit, and very much needed with all the meats and cheeses we were consuming! And well, did I mention we needed salad to also balance the very decadent mac & cheese? That mac & cheese: I want to just lift that hot plate and put it right onto my face. It consisted of three cheeses: gruyere, cheddar, and parmigiano-reggiano. The bread crumbs on top and the spice of cayenne pepper really made this mac & cheese distinctive from others. Granted, I've had bread crumbs on mac & cheese before, but this was toasted to perfection and the spice cut through the creamy richness of the dish.   The service: solid. The servers were friendly and quite personable. While my friends and I were very much engaged in deep conversations (at one point we were talking about economics... I mean, who does that on a Sunday night?... [We do.]), I noticed how efficient and attentive the service was. I'm glad I was able to experience a meal at Fat Angel. I intend to come back for dinner or perhaps a casual drink on their petite patio out front. Give this spot a try. It's heavenly! (Womp. Womp.)

suuIf6JWTZFjSu55k7zTBA.review_text: I've been on a 5-star roll. Thank you Yelpers for guiding me!  I was very impressed with this place. Our server was incredibly patient, knowledgeable and basically went above and beyond. We mentioned this was our first time at Fat Angel, and he thoughtfully walked us though the menus (Drink Menu - they have 38 bottles of wine available and some Belgian beers and non-alcoholic; Food Menu - includes various meats, cheeses, butters, a few comfort entrees - i.e. mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie, and flatbreads - we had the asparagus + toasted pine nuts - excellent!). Our guy asked us questions on what type of wine we like and made great recommendations on pairing the wine + food.   This place is cozy, so seating can be tight. Nice candlelit ambiance at night. They have bar seating + table seating. It's a great place to stop in and relax over quality beverage + food + service. Heaven indeed.
