yq43YIw91TYvqSZpmNmk_w.review_text: I was so excited to try a new place but sadly I will not be going back.  The service was deplorable.  After my friend and I ordered food and one drink each, we never saw our server again.  Actually we did see him taking other tables' orders, he just never bothered to check in on us.  Didn't check to see how we liked the drinks he had recommended, didn't check in once we got our food, didn't notice our empty glasses, didn't notice our swiveled heads looking for someone to help us.  It was like our table had ceased to exist.  We managed to flag down a woman that i believe was the bartender and she happily got us another round of drinks.  As we were waiting for those to arrive, we wondered aloud why we bothered to stay for a second drink  The food was almost as unimpressive as the service... We ordered the cheese plate and the sliders.  When it was delivered to our table (by someone other than our server) there was no explanation of the three cheeses on the plate.  They were yummy tho! The sliders were fine, but the meat was teeny tiny... lift the bun for a good laugh!

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: The bf and I have tried to get into Fat Angel since we moved across the street, but it's always slammed. You can only imagine how excited we were when we were able to grab seats at the bar the other day. What joy! Great service, semi small menu, but full  of great dishes and reasonable prices.  Bonus - large beer/wine list with a few fun cocktails  Food/Drink highlights...meaning, GET THESE!  *Pimm's Cup...light, refreshing, delicious! *Lemon/sage/caper butter, * Cheese plate (favorites were Vella Dry Jack  NorCal hard cow,  Wisconsin semi-soft cow and El Trigal  Spanish semi-firm sheep) *Organic Firebrand bread (comes with cheese and butter) *Sliders (beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli) - no words can express how tasty these are.   Note - this place is pretty small...so either head there early or expect to wait.   Overall...do yourself a favor and give them a try. Soon!

ycZrvi56QkfCU4zCVidrmQ.review_text: Cozy pub with amazing selection of beers. Don't let the pub theme scare you away; the food is great! There is limited indoor seating, some bar stools, and a few sidewalk tables. Service was pleasant and efficient.  We had the pesto flatbread. Cracker-thin crust is crisp and chewy - exceptional. Toppings were all excellent.  Chicken pot pie was good comfort food though I prefer the Liberty Cafe version  Enjoyed an Iduna Cru with the meal and look forward to sampling more of the beers.

Gwe2GVqiIge7QHdAI8d74g.review_text: Good selection of beer and wine although a tad pricey on the bottle selection.  I was able to try Lost Abbey's tequila barrel aged "Agave Maria" and it was great with their cayenne Mac & Cheese.  The lemon caper butter and bread was a good compliment for the beers and their wild mushroom truffle flatbread definitely makes me want to drive back here from the South Bay.  I will be back!

UZloE8c_eUdRoBU47tv2iQ.review_text: Great gastropub/small plates and drinks eatery off Fillmore. The venue is not large so come early if you can. Great charcuterie and cheese platters, small plates, nuts, olives and nibbles. Many choices of good quality beverages - wine, beer, cocktails and coffee. Most of the food is high end comfort food. Definitely a new choice for us for small nibbles and a quiet drink with visitors. Limited choices in large plates/entree so maybe not the best for a date night scenario, better with a group of friends sharing. Service was pleasant and attentive.

xGDcXcscWQl_X0R3f1LIzw.review_text: Fat Angel is a great spot in the western addition neighborhood. Fat Angel is a cozy wine bar with that cool, dimly lit vibe. The servers are nice, and the wine/draft selection is pretty extensive. Their food menu is limited but that's pretty typical of a wine bar. Although food only takes up 2 pages in the entire menu, what they do serve is fantastic. We had the spicy mac-n-cheese and the smoked salmon salad. Salads are a good size and meant for sharing so that's a lovely starter, they do have several flatbreads that quite a few people ordered but we didn't get to it. If I had to choose one I'd pick the spicy sausage flatbread as that was our servers favorite. The mac-n-cheese was good and it's one of the dishes they're known for.   Overall, the drink selection was great, food was tasty, the restaurant had a great vibe to it that you could show up for a date or be casual with a couple friends, our service was excellent, and the entire experience was reasonably priced. I'm a big fan and I'll definitely be back.

zE1yVFofeHQnxpGFonM6BA.review_text: Cozy neighborhood feeling, delicious food (we had flat breads & bread pudding), amazing choices of drinks ( if you're into sour beer this is heaven) (or wine), friendly bartender/waiter, good decoration, lighting, music (different music in the restroom, it was playing nirvana when i pee :) maybe a little too cozy with tables too close to each other... Hard to move between tables.  Overall it's definitely a great spot to grab a drink after work & a casual dinner! Highly recommended!

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: I LOVED this place!  Everything about it, location is walking distance for me, the decor is inviting and well done, the extensive wine/beer selection and numerous wines on tap (ah-mazing!!), the food (totally my type of smaller bites and fresh salads/flatbreads), the service (the guy that kept coming over was literally the epitome of amazing service-friendly, attentive, funny, etc).  We came in earlier on a Saturday night (around 5) and by the time we left at 7 there was a pretty solid wait for tables.  I will 100% be coming back to grab some wine/bites with my girlfriends/boyfriend/solo.  such a great find!

uOInZgQyVmshiKS33ZtNXg.review_text: Went here with my friend Courtney tonight and had the best time! There was a smal wait (15-20 mins) around 7:00pm but we were invited to get a glass of wine and it was easily transferred to our main tab once we got a table. The waitress had funky pink hair and was very cool, the wine was delicious and the food - omg! We got a cheese and meat plate, the apple/Gorgonzola/walnut salad (huge!) and the Mac and cheese (had to). All were great. The salad portion was gigantic (good for 4 people...) and we definitely filled ourselves to the rafters. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend :) the chef clearly has a taste for spicy foods as biting into the salad and the Mac and cheese definitely had a bit of spice - I loved it!!

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: I've stopped in a few times to grab a few beers and a bite to eat before heading to concerts at the Fillmore.  They feature both beers and wines on tap, and have an incredibly extensive bottled beer list.  The prices can be rather high, but the selection is worth it, as they have many imported and unusual beers to sample.  The bartenders have been great about letting one try a sip of the on-tap beer or wine first, before ordering a full glass, and are happy to make recommendations from either tap or bottled lists.  I've only tried appetizers / share dishes, which were quite good as well.  I've yet to try the flatbread pizzas but they always smell and look delicious when I see them ordered at other tables.  It does seem like it takes a very long time to get warm dishes, such as the pizzas, though.    My only complaints about this establishment are that they are constantly overwhelmed both in terms of service and space.  Service for food items is very slow, and there never seen to be tables free -- even rarely 2 adjacent seats at the bar.  They wind up with people milling around the bar without a place to sit or stand.  Not good at all for groups, and a bit of a risk on weekend nights, as you may have to wait a very long time to be seated.

THsYWl6ZB66biYo0M5K8Tg.review_text: Good beer, decent food, and good hang out.  Not great for kids because it does get a little cramped and loud.  Had the meat and cheese plat, mushroom pizza, and smoked fish salad.  It was huge - 4 of us had 2 servings each to finish it.

odM7WqRsORcMsFymWEMiAw.review_text: Was here for the very first time this weekend (had been meaning to check it out for a while, though), during the Fillmore St Jazz Festival.  Popped in with a friend, to escape the crazy crowds & have a nice glass of wine.  While there, we decided to nosh on a bit of food.  I was going to go for the Wild Mushroom Flatbread, but I saw the Mac & Cheese on someone else's plate, and it looked pretty darned good, so I decided to give it a go.  And I'm glad I did: The Mac & Cheese here turned out to be one of the high points of my weekend (and it was a rather FULL weekend)!  I have not been able to stop thinking about it - trying to figure out how soon I can get back there for some more!  I'd have to say that this Mac & Cheese is giving Luna Park a run for its money, and that, my friends, is a very big statement, indeed.  They just got everything right: Nice combination of cheeses, not TOO cheesy, nice choice of pasta, lovely breadcrumbs on top, and there's something spicy in there...  Gives it a bit of character.  I love it.  I want more, in fact.  Gotta have it...

F4Ec6wRe3Eewiz84PkhwkA.review_text: 5 stars but too busy, so don't you go there.  everyone avoid this place.  it's mine.  in all seriousness, they only had 1 person working (2 called in sick) (ticket said his name was jason) and he was super cheery and nice.  better service than i'm used to getting at all the new "trendy" SF restaurants.  he gets 5 *s all to himself.

dvmz7wDSGnNm-ZkTna1yzw.review_text: Excellent service and the food was amazing.  We had trout salad, mushroom flat bread and the sliders.  It was a wonderful way to start the evening.  The beer selection is wonderful and the place has a great vibe.  We sat at the bar and loved watching the bartender mix drinks.

ddm5O2ynhHowDmli_Lq0Hg.review_text: I went here last week with my wife on a spur-of-the-moment date. It was a beautiful night with mild weather. We had to wait only a few moments before we were seated outside. Service was excellent and friendly. Food was tasty and drinks were good too. definitely recommend for a casual date or pre/post Kabuki snack stop.

g7PiTQFfqP9uR1-8takcew.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and have been waiting for this place to open up for months. It was worth the wait. We went there last night for a late dinner, and were quite pleased. They are still getting their bearings and need to work out a few minor kinks, but the food was wonderful (pulled pork over polenta, mac 'n cheese), and the owners were friendly and helpful. I can see this cozy little place being my go-to for a relaxing glass of wine and small plate at least once a week after work.

PWF1RtqOHiwyvkGfbD9s8Q.review_text: best place to kick back with some nonpretentious wines and their friends...

eyBt6fCzIjFJ65-Kxk6MJw.review_text: COMFORT.  Friendly, unpretentious service..... Great atmosphere..... Diverse wine and beer selection.... Cheeses.... Butters! And to top it off....an old pipe organ and church pews. Excellent.

Ta3V5b98z48RaV3fmmlqrQ.review_text: Hands down my favorite bar in San Francisco. It helps to be friends with regulars, not going to lie, but even if we didn't have the inside scoop, I'd still like it here.   They've  got it all, unique beers, wine, and delicious food. Speaking of food, I feel that at this point that I've tried most of the menu and it's all delicious, but the real stand-out is the smoked trout salad. Jesus tap dancing Christ, that smoked trout is the most delicious fish ever. I want to buy a case of that smoked trout and eat it everyday. My fiend described that salad as "an orgasm you don't have to work for". It's that good and it's SALAD.  Moving on....  Beer selection is top notch and changes regularly as does the wine but I think they have certain bottles that are always on hand. The decor is pretty cool too, they have a lot of pews from an old church, which adds a naughty element as you indulge in booze and rich food.   My only criticism is that it gets really crowded and it can be hard to get a table as it's not a very large place. They do have some outdoor tables (with heat lamps) but it's nicer inside. They seem a little disorganized when it comes to seating as well, so if you don't want to wait around, I'd suggest coming early. Whatever though, I'd probably wait an hour for that trout salad.   5 stars for the food, the drinks, and the fun I've had here  3 stars for the organization/seating

cTIO1CeKMzTwezaL0gugAg.review_text: Ah...Fat Angel. My "Cheers". Where do I start about this wonderfully inviting, romantic, charming bistro/pub in the Fillmore District?   Let's start off with the proprietors. Jason and Cyrick are super heroes who somehow remain jolly and attentive (with a super-human knowledge of good food and wine) late into the evening (and dealing with tipsy Asian chicks like me). Cyrick is one of the happiest people around -- and is really knowledgeable about good food/drink pairings on the menu.  Plus - he  really knows cured meats.   The food -- the smoked trout salad with fennel and fried capers will turn any raging carnivore into a whipped vegetarian. It is THAT good. The sliders with the garlic aioli and spicy pickles are perfect bits of heaven. The chicken pot pie and mac 'n' cheese are consistently good. The tartufo salami is really tasty.  The wine -- Jason is like Pandora, but for wine. You tell him which wines you like, and he introduces you to new wines that he thinks you might like. He is usually right.   The ambiance -- Fat Angel is soft, romantic and brooding. Girls - the lighting will make you look your most beautiful.  The music is never too intrusive, and it is easy to have a conversation here.   It's a small place -- so don't go too often. You might take one of my tables.

VQX1C7pA7_nJPLGZ_7vGBg.review_text: The pizza here is amaze!!!  I would recommend the classic peperoni or the vegie.  Service is fast and staff is friendly.  When you just need a quick bite to eat or need a pizza while watching a sporting event I would defiantly recommend Fat Angel.

dr_mce0J8Q-BLLOA23KuAQ.review_text: Had been wanting to try this spot for awhile now. Located in a nice little nook near Fillmore Street, Fat Angel boasts a great beer menu and some delish gastropub eats.  The wait is long, and they don't take resys, so come early and don't be that hungry. Also, with SF weather, bring either a jacket and sit outside (much shorter wait time, and they have heat lamps), or wait longer for the inside tables. It's a tiny space so waits can me 1.5-2 hours long depending on party size.  We started off with fried capers. These were interesting -- deep fried, so the insides were hollow, and the outsides were crunchy. It was delicious, but super salty (capers, duh).  Next, we noshed on the chocolate cinnamon butter. This was served with a great rye bread, and was so delicious. Like cinnamoney-nutella. Spread like butter, and was soft.  Then we had 2 flatbreads: (1) Roasted red grape, walnut, & prosciutto w/ Gorgonzola, which was lovely. The roasted grapes are a favorite thing of mine that not many places do. It adds a hint of sweet to something that feels savory. It's great. (2) Wild mushroom and white truffle oil w/pecorino. This was also delicious, and better than the roasted red grape flatbread. Both flatbreads were super thin -- think nacho chip with pizza-like toppings. Very tasty and not too heavy.  Then we had the Mac n'cheese - gruyere, cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, cayenne. Was a nice, homey mac and cheese. The Fa's chicken pot pie - roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon - was also super homey. The toasted filo dough on top was a great touch, which you break into pieces and eat with the insides of the pot pie.  Finally we had a great cheese board, which our server picked. Service overall was nice, with servers being very beer and food knowledgeable, and eager to help.  Had a delightful meal with great friends, and would definitely come back.

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: I like angels.  Typically, I prefer them to be of the archangel variety (Michael and his sword of justice - come on, awesome) over fat little cherubs, but then again, I had never been served food and beer by fat little cherubs.  Until Saturday night.  Located right behind the Fillmore, this is a dark, cozy, upscale wine-bar-type-joint that is low on pretentiousness and high on deliciousness.  They play music, but it's quiet enough that you can actually hear your companions - which I appreciate (damn kids these days with their damn loud music and long hair).  Keane L. and I had pints of Angel's Share beer (aged in bourbon barrels, $6), and flatbread with prosciutto, gorgonzola, red grapes, and walnuts ($8).  I would like to marry this meal.  The beer is nothing short of awesome, and the flatbread was its perfect complement.    The staff was very personable and didn't seem to have any problem with us spending 2+ hours there.  The crowd is mostly your typical 20/30-something Saturday-nighters, but there was also a 3-year-old and his grandmother hanging out at 9pm.  The three-year-old became significantly more chatty when he learned that Keane was not, in fact, my boyfriend.  Ah, they grow up so fast.  You keep pouring the beer and wine, Fat Angel, and I will be back to drink it.

CgXcPydtPwf_AGGrf8ARRQ.review_text: Always very busy. The food and drinks menu is very good. Although I do think this place is slightly overhyped.  Food Quality - Excellent. Food Taste - Good. Food Originality - Excellent. Price - Good. Customer Service - Good. Ambiance - Good.

Hu9OLccPlA7wWMiyoUmxJw.review_text: Love this place! Great beers (I'm not a beer drinker, but some of these have almost converted me) and wonderful wines. The menu isn't terribly vegetarian friendly, but they are happy to accommodate. The staff is very good at recommending drinks. There can be quite the wait for a table. But if you just want a drink there is usually a table outside you can camp out at, with great heaters.

l-TCviQJvbbwt9wL5NQUjw.review_text: Friendly service, fabulous music, incredible drinks list, terrific food, wonderful ambiance. We were there Wed March 28 at about 6 pm with our two kids (ages 7 and 5) -- obviously this is not a spot designed with small people in mind, but our server was super friendly and patient with the girls.  We had only a couple of days in SF (on spring break from Chicago) so wanted to make sure we got in some real "we're on vacation" experiences, hence bringing our children to a gastropub -- but you know, it worked.  They enjoyed the atmosphere, the kitchen whipped up some noodles with parmesan just for them, we enjoyed the flatbread and HUGE caesar salad, and the drinks list was huge, beautifully organized, and irresistible.  A great and memorable evening.  Thank you, Jenny.

5IYp74inOC40V6-9fUTUWA.review_text: Beyond delicious chicken pot pie, huge amazing salad perfectly dressed, incredible wine selection and unique atmosphere. All relatively affordable! The service was ok, a little slow...but my friend and I were in no rush so it didn't matter. Somehow we snagged a table as soon as we walked in the door on a Friday night around 7pm. Good stuff, I will be back.

eIa4QJXp5ZNmuFORnuPvDA.review_text: * Cheese served w/ organic Firebrand bread and seasonal accents ($5 each or 5 for $21: Wagon Wheel  NorCal semi-firm cow, Roaring 40's Blue, Tasmanian semi-soft cow, Dante  Wisconsin semi-firm sheep, Toma  NorCal semi-firm cow, Mt. Tam  NorCal soft cow, Goat Gouda  NorCal semi-firm goat) - Delicious! The blue is very strong and wonderful. The seasonal jams are amazing, and I loved the sweet almond. A little pricey though.  * Mac n' Cheese (gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano  $11) - Loved this! The pasta is soft, the cheese strong

zGTMvp5ZCMFbzjEioMunvw.review_text: Best smoked trout salad ever. Truffle oil flatbread is another favorite. Excellent wine & beer choices. Good prices.  Good service. Really small place with limited but easy bar seating and friendly vibe. Dessert was unimpressive, but I will be back for the salad!

_Kt01zAkzGDjSphy7W3qOA.review_text: So cute. So good.   With amazing food,  sweet ambiance and a  killer bar, this place has it all.   We tried a cheese plate, flatbread with wild mushroom, white truffle oil, and pecorino,   and a salad with endive, apple, candied walnuts, gorgonzola and cider vinaigrette.   The salads are the size your face, so we could have just eaten that, but who wants to eat just salad when there are so many other tasty options?  I wish I had gotten around to trying a drink. That'll be for next time.

Dj77pkw_EZJvR-F4RIf_BQ.review_text: Delicious and elegant hole in the wall in the Fillmore area...great place to order a few small plates and kick back with some glasses of wine.  That's exactly what we did.  We splurged on the mac n cheese and chicken pot pie and it was well worth it.  Both dishes were made uniquely with delicious flavors.  Can't go to a wine bar without a meat and cheese plate!  I can't recall exactly which cheeses we chose but I know I had a delicious blue in there.  Yum.    Pick up a couple of glasses of wine and you're good to go.  Cute little place with great food...4 stars.

Ze7RrgCE4JWRhShcfOXOQQ.review_text: I live in the East Bay and although it takes me an hour to get from home to Fat Angel, I find myself here more often than any other bar in the city.   Their bottle selection is more extensive than any fan of craft brew could hope for, and their draft list is always inspired and brimming with something to suit all tastes and moods.   Combing knowledgable beer servers, and a moody and intimate atmosphere, Fat Angel is the sort of place where one pint can quickly turn into four and a casual conversation can grow into a real friendship. It is a place like no other in San Francisco and should not be missed by anyone.

x6Lgq28ey-hewNIgC4NZDQ.review_text: Amazing food, drink selection, ambiance, fairly priced, great date spot, loved it.

uWh_D8Q5JRFSmmGdtSd89w.review_text: I absolutely love this place! The selection of beers is phenomenal, and the meat and cheese plates are amazing. They have one of the best bread puddings I've ever had as well. It's a terrific place for hanging out with friends, or just for a small, intimate get together.  The only thing is that it's getting more and more busy these days. You're better off going earlier in the evening, rather than after 9 or 10. It gets so crowded inside that you can't even move around. I'm happy that they're doing so well, but it does make it difficult to go there for a quiet drink late at night. Oh well, I still love it here! It's definitely our stand-by drinking establishment!!!

amz57NX_BDfMhrJnkQhTYw.review_text: Share all the food!  Gastropub.  What does that actually mean?  Who came up with that term? I'll have to do some research because... they are awesome.  Cheap pub fare with a gourmet spin.  Extra special brews and wines.  Fat Angel is such a gem in this Alamo-Western Addition neighborhood.  It's a pretty small space, not good for large parties.  There's a bar area and a heated outdoor patio.  homemade BUTTERS. small plates to share-- cheeses, meats, olives and nuts. these are clearly of the highest quality-- ask for extra bread if you get the butters!  They also have 3 or 4 salads (which could easily serve 3, not exaggerating) and a few mains.  My BF ordered the chicken pot pie which was SO COMFORTING AND DELICIOUS. even to a vegetarian.  I had the apple walnut gorgonzola endive salad. Fresh.   Wines on tap. Good wines on tap.  A beer list 5 pages long.  For the beer enthusiast.  Came here to do some celebrating late monday night and they were full.  This place gets packed on the weekends.  Friendly staff, pitchers of water on the table.

-s4QStMnUyQJYDzyXJkWDg.review_text: Such a cute place! Its not as big as I thought it wouldve been, however it was great! From the bottle of wine we ordered to the food. Everything was amazing. The waiter staff was very attentive when they needed to be and very helpful. Will definitly be returning!

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: A nice place to grab a glass. Cozy and unexpected. No zins, though. My group wished they would serve food later.

qbCcBXUT5RarbmMYJTfC4g.review_text: This is a really nice little bistro. The staff are really nice, and the ambiance is great.  This is a small plate restaurant, so if your starving I don't recommend you dine here. It's also a little pricey, but there prices are justified based on there location and quality of food.

Tq4-FAPzOIok1F_hnsqg7g.review_text: Yum. Cheese plate, Mac n' Cheese, Sliders (with melted delicious cheese)...Fat Angel is decadent  and delicious!

07iCpd4M1N8SCgqw2pvz8g.review_text: friendly staff, excellent duck liver pate & truffle tremor cheese to start us off for the wonderful evening.

iIq1zHUZPAPeF00cLWCt4Q.review_text: Came here with my hub on a Friday night around 5pm. Easily beat the rush! We opted to sit at the bar and have a couple beers rather than sit on the sidewalk patio.  We split the spicy Mac and cheese ( which didn't disappoint). Great beer list! Definitely got crowded around 6:30 though so get there early!

aQjCrVdv3lLLdCwwAG5HCQ.review_text: We had an ok bite to eat here before a concert at the Fillmore. Beer recommendation was a bomb--asked for a hoppy beer and got a floral girly beer. Nonetheless the olives were awesome and the sliders were to die for. The kale salad was just ok because of the goopy dressing. Would go back to try out the pot pie. all together, it was decent. Great selection of beers and wines--many selections not seen or found anywhere else. Give it a try.

yvXAJfQaJYYZ_H-OzAFMWw.review_text: Went with girlfriends before seeing a show at the Fillmore. Loved the location, super easy to grab some bites and walk over to the show!  Loved the decor/ambiance. When we arrived, the tables were full, but the bartender told us to grab a seat outside and the next table would be ours. A waiter took our drink orders, and had them waiting at the table for us as soon as it was ready.  I had the sparkling chardonnay blend (REALLY good) and chardonnay on tap (okay)  We split a few things family style - prosciutto flatbread (super delish), maple bacon butter (so-so), sliders (good!), and the waiter encouraged us to split one of the salads - we chose the pear/endive - and it was my favorite item of the night! (REALLY, REALLY tasty).   be sure to double check your bill, after a couple of glasses of wine each, we nearly missed that we had 2x$19/glass of wine on our bill that were not ours. they quickly fixed our bill, but we nearly missed those pricey add-ons.   the service had ups and downs, bartender was great, female waitress was great, expeditor/busser was great, but the male waiter seemed aloof and annoyed.   still, i'd definitely go back, and have a feeling this place will be one of our go-to's for pre-concert drinks!  also, for some reason, looking at the restaurant on the map in the yelp app showed it around the corner from the Fillmore, however when I clicked in the app to have it give me directions via the iphone maps app, it took me a few blocks away. we knew where we were going so rerouted ourselves. but something was a bit wacky with that.

1WpYGy2ByT25RlXMhe29XQ.review_text: Love it! Our waitress was super helpful and gave us some great recommendations. We tried two beers, bread with garlic chili / honey butter, and the mac n cheese. Everything tasted amazing and the portions were more than enough. Fortunately we got here ~15-20 minutes before the crowd started coming in; there's outdoor seating but I loved sitting inside enjoying the woodsy and candlelit ambiance. I promised myself I wouldn't try the same restaurant twice while I live in the city but I might just need to come back!

kZJWAY828P8QZTqVYzhTCg.review_text: I bet it's every guy's dream to open up a restaurant so he could feed his nuts to dozens of beautiful, drunk women nightly. I'm not ashamed to say...I had Cy's Salty Sweet Chinese Nuts ($4) & loved them. You know I've been sitting on that intro for a few days! *wink*   Other edibles: -- fried capers, $3: not what I expected. Crispy, salty but needed a lil' sumfin, sumfin to be eaten with.  -- charcuterie platter, $23 for 5: not sure what meats he chose but I tried a salami w/ black pepper & that was mild & tasty.  -- maple bacon butter & bread, $4.5: I should have gone for the garlic chili... -- FA's chicken pot pie, $12: one of my least favorite pot pies, sadly. Sherry, tarragon, carrots & roasted chicken had the consistency of goopey mush. There was a spice that totally turned me off (cumin? coriander? curry?) The pastry top had many flakey layers.  -- mac & cheese, $11: loved the corkscrew pasta & the generous crunchy topping. Cheese wasn't as sharp as I would've liked & too runny.   More misses than hits, so three stars for our dinner is more than generous. Service was impeccable; Jason & Cy are amazing hosts & their establishment is beautiful & archetypal San Francisco. I just don't think their food style matches what I'm looking for. Give their extensive alkie list a gander; you're guaranteed to find a very sipable libation.

FX7Th2udvr8HZbKdsaq8LA.review_text: We were looking for a place to eat before we caught a show at the Boom Boom Room.  After yelping it out, we settled on Fat Angel.  Got here around 9:30ish and panicked because we were super hungry and didn't see anyone with food!  However, we were assured we could order food and promptly ordered some flatbread and sliders.  Everything was excellent, including the wine on tap we just had to try.  Ambiance was great - just like the little corner restaurants that are nice but a casual hangout all the same that I love so dearly.  I could easily see myself hanging with my friends or hubby at a table and grabbing drinks.  Makes me wish I had a place like this in my own 'hood!

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: What a great little spot.  it's cute, classy, and is the perfect place to start or end an evening with a beer made for sipping.  For such a small space, it does gets surprisingly loud inside, so if possible, snag a seat outside and ask to have the heater turned on.

vQ4IV9xP_t-lfj0eGE46hA.review_text: A wine bar is a wine bar is a wine bar. You're there to drink wine. And in my book as long as the wine is good, it's hard to go wrong. As a result, it can definitely hard to stand out among the many around. And yet Fat Angel flies high above them all. It's a bit off the beaten path of busy Fillmore but very worth the trek past Popeyes and the Brooklyn's clothing store. The have a very interesting and varied winelist plus really good stuff on tap. Who knew a zin could be so good when poured like a beer? Fat Angel's food shines as well. The meat plate is a little bit of sliced pork heaven and the bread to go with is perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The flatbreads are also delicious and worth the fire time. So grab a seat at the bar, chat up the owner, and enjoy a nice glass of vino after that long day of work.

oUNm5rDUDxu0LMximnNHWQ.review_text: Dear Yelpers, I know it's been a while since you heard from me but don't ask where I have been and why I did not write. I guess I just don't want to talk about it. It's not you - it's me.   Maybe I would tell you more if you were to to take me to Fat Angel and ply me with one of the 10 percent micro beers or a couple of glasses of the surprisingly full and well-rounded wines ON TAP!   After all it would seem as I write here that Fat Angel is the cupid that has brought us back together. She may be the new baby in my life.   And if the liquor were to get the better of me and I found myself giving away too much, I could order from the fantastic cheese selection or warm olives or tangy asparagus flat-bread both to douse the liquor and my tales.   But mostly, I would be telling you what a great "find" the Angel is - though from the excited chatter of the lively clientele, it would seem that others have found her before me. But I won't let that stop me from visiting her again - I am sure we will have a long healthy relationship as my go-to place for meeting friends on the way to the Fillmore and Yoshi's...

-CBHrlm3n1KCsCb69AMePA.review_text: Friendly staff. Bartender explained the beers on tap..good beer but a bit expensive for me. Strangers were recommending the chicken pot pie, but I'm a vegetarian, so I'm forwarding the recommendation on to you.

RbZ_yOCZjYE675izT3Oymg.review_text: Really chill spot.  I came here with a few others for beer/wine and light appetizers.  We had a great time and will definitely be frequenting this place since it's our neighborhood bar!

NKKW2bUyFUGy15-Fvc0KJw.review_text: Met friends for before dinner drinks on Saturday night :-)   Pros -Lovely place, nice decor, indoor, outdoor seating, great ambiance !            -The bartenders were friendly!            -Lots of beer and wine selection.   I was sick and not drinking, but guess what? They had tea options......I was very happy with the Oolong (Goat's milk) tea recommended by the bartender. There wasn't goat's milk in it. It was Oolong...Not sure why it was called Goat's Milk! It was great!   Cons - It was a little hard to find.             - It can get really loud!

ermgOO9meehk-dfG0Fsfhw.review_text: Good spot for beers and food. Seems like a date spot. Gets hot inside here and definitely brings a crowd.

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: I love to wine and dine with Fat Angel!    Their flatbread pizza with gorgonzola, walnut, prosciutto and topped with roasted grapes, is deliciously amazing!  Pair it with their grand selections of fine wine, such as their Manto Negro/Callet from Spain, which had hints of cocoa, toffee and cherry blend, then the meal would be splendidly perfect to the palate!    Their freshly baked Chicken Pot Pie that is served piping hot from the oven, is surely homely and that crisp and flaky crust, is comfort to the soul!  They serve up beer as well, just in case you prefer not to dine over wine!   I simply can't ask for better company to pair a meal and wine over with, than with Fat Angel!

kfKbLw9KIHs9PBn5kw6QZw.review_text: Their drinks are awesome. The only reason why I didn't give Fat Angel 5 stars is because I didn't have the opportunity to try their food (I came here AFTER dinner elsewhere), though looking at pictures, I know I'll have to come back to try their mac & cheese.   Tip: Come here if you're a beer connoisseur. Their menu of brewskis is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Whether you like them light, dark, hoppy, etc., you name it, there's a brew for you. Not to mention, our server (I believe his name was Derek) was SUPER helpful in describing all the special notes of each beer on the menu; it certainly makes their long list of beers less intimidating. :)

75SB3V988qr2CGhtxnpzDw.review_text: I'm writing this review simply because I was blown away by the service. Derrick managed to find the PERFECT wine for me, even when I had a very specific request. Plus he was funny, so extra bonus for him.   Plus, the beers were awesome, the mac and cheese was amazing and we just had an all around good time.

c3HNQWqOXiEW6vblRNCrVg.review_text: Went here for the first time last night.  Great spot for a date or a catch up with a friend - even a small group if it's not a busy night.  Pleasant music, great decor and the lighting is perfect.  (I personally think this is key for a wine bar - I think there are too many places that are too brightly lit).  I'm delighted to have found a new neighborhood spot.  Nice selection of wines and enjoyed everything I sampled.  I'll be back.

lqDaxpZQBXZDEkJ890GYOw.review_text: Wine (and beer) on tap and delicious Mac and cheese, what more could you ask for! Small place, but super cute and everything was delicious. Great place for happy hour and would definitely come back again!

PLBTRXUu7JYsc4V_ZD17Bw.review_text: Worst service I've seen in years. Forgot our entire food order for 4 people. Waitstaff even had attitudes about the situation!

90JfxNVNkn3BYQTXf5C-xw.review_text: The best chicken pot pie ever - grandma's recipe won me over !  Terrific service, thanks - you are doing a great job with this place, keep up the hard work - looks like it is winning people over 1

mG6LFDalOnuO-MVy3qYeQQ.review_text: I would like to give Fat Angel 5 starts but cannot. Matter of fact, 1 is pushing it. Being a bit of a hard ass, you bet.   Scenario. Sunday night dinner date, in fact last night 3/16.  I've had only wine at Fat Angel with a GF and loved the space. Cute, charming romantic. I was out with my BF and wanted to take him out to dinner.  I wanted to try the food at FA but the stuff prevented that from happening.   OMG, confusion and chaos. There where only 2 people handling the bar and tables. Serious mess, matter the fact, the male server said as much, he used the word confused.  We took 2 seats at the window and the same server questioned why we took those seat. We were standing for nearly 10mins, waiting for someone to smile and greet us but that never happened. As we began to walk out, we then caught the attention of the woman at the bar who asked, how many we said 2, she said take the window. Realizing that getting served was going to take some time, I got up and looked at the wine list on the wall hoping to get a bottle and chill a bit. That didn't happen. I stood reading the menu and was completely ignored. I tried to get the bar tenders attention, it never happened. I sat down, waited a bit more....we then decided to leave.   Both the bar tender and only the server were struggling, communicate was lacking.   Restaurants have off nights, people have bad days. There was no excuse for lack of service. We did not have an expectation of any sort; we didn't complain, or appeared to be entitled. We just wanted to sit down, have dinner and enjoy the evening. I'm glad it wasn't a birthday or anniversary night, that would've truly sucked.

vBhm6iVHPwc7I90p1ufx_A.review_text: Overheard a patron say "this place is WAY better than claim jumper!"

KIUeZpqA5DpQZIhcBwQVvQ.review_text: Stumbled across this gem on Friday after dinner at Dosa on the Fillmore.   The name threw me off when looking for a spot on Yelp but once we looked into the bar, we need we would love it. The intimate space has a small bar, dim lighting and seating along the far wall and lined across the front windows. There was outdoor seating as well but being San Francisco, it was too cold to sit out there. We scored a random cozy table in the middle of the restaurant. It ended up being a little traffic-y as waiters and customers would have to walk past us to get in and out.  The menu is simple and conducive to sharing. Selections of cured meats, cheeses and breads are the primary items. I was cursing that we had a lackluster meal at Dosa just 30 minutes prior as I wanted to try some of the great cheese choices they had.  My brit husband was in heaven with their beer selection. When the barman brought over the book of beers, his eyes lit up. He ended up getting a craft draft beer which was offered as a 16 or a 22 oz. The wine menu looked good but I wasn't in a vino or beer mood. Upon the waiter's recommendation, I ordered the pimms cup and it was so refreshingly good. There are cute quotes on the menu and I like that they included 'hetchy hetch' priced as free on the drinks side.   The crowd was a mix between girlfriends, first dates and married couples. I like communal/family style meals so the idea of ordering a couple of plates and sharing over some bottles of wine is ideal.  Perfect spot for date night, intimate snack/drink with small group of friends.

iK5oMORPCmoWUmannptD-Q.review_text: I figured I should write a more comprehensive review for fat angel considering it's one if my favorite spots. This place is what a gastro pub should be. Great beer and wine selection and delicious consistent food. It is quite small and very popular.  The combination of small and popular is actually the major drawback of the place.  They do not take reservations so wait times can be upwards of 1-2 hours at times if you want a table for dinner.  You can put your name on a list and they will text you when a table becomes available, but this system may not be ideal for some. Also considering that some people order food and then sit at tables for hours drinking after dinner makes it difficult for the staff to accurately predict wait times.  Also since they have outdoor seating, weather becomes a variable in that on nice days their seating capacity almost doubles.    The staff is always very friendly and do their best to accommodate given the limitations listed above.  They are understandably in a tricky situation and there is no great way to make everyone happy!    When you walk in there is a chalkboard that lists the beer and wine on tap. This is an ever changing selection which is great. Occasionally they run out of beers and the selection of tap beer can be limited. They make up for this with a huge selection of bottled beers listed by type in their menu.   Just about everything on the food menu is awesome. My favorites are the maple bacon butter, kale salad with chicken, all of the flat breads, and the sliders. These all seem to pair perfectly with the beer.

0pb7fWD194iTqPMFAG5Oxg.review_text: Finally a place with an awesome beer selection on Fillmore!  Don't get me wrong, Pizza Inferno has good beers, but Fat Angel has amazing ones. Last night I had an Abt 12 and I almost went to heaven.  Their wine selection is also strong and fun, and the overall ambiance of the place is really stellar. The people who work there seem to be nice and the big windows give you a chance to stare out and enjoy...staring at people!

wDlZEy7glGaCsqjCHMbIIA.review_text: I am really bummed to write this review.  I've been to Fat Angel twice.  First time was to scope out the place, try the wine, and a few of the appetizers and see what I would need to do if I was bringing a semi-large, free flowing group through on a Friday.  The first experience was divine!  Great wine and champagne plus a delicious cheese with honeycomb (my favorite)!  i was sold and hooked.  After devouring my experience, I touched base with the house manager/wait staff/jack of all trades about possibly making a reservation.  He stated this wasnt possible.  They dont take reservations.  But if I got there early I could take over a couple tables and he'd make it work.  The invites were sent, I was talking up the place and people were excited.  I arrived before 5:30 on a Friday to snag my two tables.  When I arrived I spoke with the same guy who informed they had two reservations totaling 35 guests.  I am expecting an additional 20.  We tried to make it work at Fat Angel.  Then it became increasingly more difficult, so I took my party elsewhere.  Saddened and dismayed this decreased my 2nd experience at Fat Angel.    Be up front with your customers about what you can and what you cant do.  Either you DO take RESERVATIONS or YOU DONT!  Drinks, food, quaint and adorable space...not good for groups.

txWFXIMtDUaheiePKnAQyg.review_text: The reviews for Fat Angel really deceived me because I thought the service here was relatively terrible.  We ordered some drinks and the cheese and meat plates.  When the cheese plate arrived, it was sort of just plopped down in front of us, with no identification of which cheese was which.  When we were done with our first glass of wine, it proved to be almost impossible to get anyone's attention for a second (or third) glass, which was pretty unacceptable given that we were sitting at the bar in front of all of the employees.

zwZe_MphN40J7VBg7oB3eA.review_text: Perfect spot to hit before you head to a movie at the Kabuki theatre.  I'd give it five stars if they could mitigate the noise.  When it's crowded...it's hard to hear someone across the table.  They have a great green solution to wine bottles....they keep a cask and bring carafes to your table.    Until this bar...I never explored the neighborhood behind the Fillmore.  It's a great anchor for the neighborhood.

hLfReqDA4_M42f1PSJ-Q0g.review_text: Love everything about this place. The wine, the service, the food (pot pie! and mac and cheese! and kale salad!). We moved to a new neighborhood, but still drive back here just for this place.

tZQf2zpFALGjrPIEsnmGtQ.review_text: Great spot for apres-Yoshi's libations. Tucked away just off of Fillmore. Great beer selections. Cute atmoshere. Will visit again.

o2qn6hMTUJfTI-W2GazX0w.review_text: Nice place, great for meeting a friend for some wine and perhaps a cheese plate.   Its somewhat small, but seating is available both at the bar as well as small tables.   The wine is priced decently, I think a glass goes as low as $8 for one of the Chianti's. I recommend getting the cheese plate, it is priced at $5 each or 5 for $21. Meaning for $21 you get a little plate with some crackers and five different cheeses. Not really a value, but its always nice when you can snack on some cheese over wine.  Not recommended if you are looking for a modern and spacious wine lounge with a group of friends. But great for a glass of wine ad some cheese on a mellow night. I would not recommend it for big groups, as seating is somewhat limited... i.e. finding two seats is one thing, finding six is an entirely different story.

2Fc3sdi4VneyJlBH3Ie3xw.review_text: I live in the neighborhood, and must have walked by this place a million times before noticing it!  Luckily friends that live further up towards the panhandle have made the trek and recommended my now new favorite local spot!  We had a party with about 9 people show up without reservations this past Friday.   The staff was great in seating people and then giving us the nook by the bar and window.  We passed around the flatbread pizzas and sliders and had many wonderful glasses of beer and wine - All reasonably priced (sooooo many wines by the glass!)  Highly recommended, and it's one of those rare spots that you really want to get back to as soon as possible!

_5S1COiCMlShezxuwp0fjA.review_text: The food was just ok. The black truffle butter had zero flavor, the bread was burnt, and the duck salami (which was a pâté?) was super gamey. The soft sheep and the bacon kale salad were nom-a-licious, though, so our mouths were overall happy.  But...the beer selection was phenomenal!!   My bf and I love sour beers and there is only a small handful to choose from, even at the most fancy places, in Dallas, where we're from. This place had at LEAST 30 to choose from! And that doesn't begin to scratch the surface of what they have to offer. Even the stuff on tap looked fascinating.  The waitstaff were super friendly hipster-types and know their stuff, too.  This place is a must for beer aficionados. Go!

SE6FqfYpxyVDCvsiKHy9Cw.review_text: Fat Angel is quite good. Great beer selection, great wine selection and a real knowledgeable and friendly staff. The place is a little small but it gives it more personality.Try the sliders!

rUogQgFEhid8om3oDomeKg.review_text: Yeah I can't believe I didn't already write a review about my neighborhood wine/beer bar (and yes Fat Angel is both if you ask me).  The service is always great, the simple comfort food menu really hits the spot and the beer selection rotates and has quite a nice selection every time.   I'm partial to the sliders and the cheese plates myself, but the trout salad is really good as well as the magical butters.  Ladyhawk loves this joint and pretty much the entire menu just like me.  See ya there.  No sweat,

QF9vzRcKOUn32wgnTcTG9Q.review_text: I love this place.  A nice quiet bar to come and have a few good beers or wine on a Saturday night, and we finally got to try some of the dishes.  We came for dinner Friday evening, and though it was more crowded than we were used to, we were seated immediately and service was friendly and quick.  Jason and Cy are enthusiastic, friendly and quick to clarify the interesting and humorous descriptions listed for the alcohol selection.  Draft beer selection changes from month to month I believe, but you'll always find something you'll thoroughly enjoy.  To the food.  Up until last night we've only ever ordered the meat plate.  A large plate of assorted charcuterie with bread and mustard for 22 dollars makes a great accompaniment to a few beers or wine, as well as a tasty appetizer.  My girlfriend had the pot pie, which I was blown away by its size, and I had the baked macaroni and cheese, made with various cheeses, and sized just perfectly even for a big boy like myself.  Rich but not sickeningly so, cheesy and filling, I'd happily order it again, but not make the same mistake of having pizza for lunch.  And the pot pie, well I helped her finish it.  Flaky crust, hearty filling, makes me wonder why the heck I ever buy the frozen variety.  Prices are reasonable for FIllmore.    It's nice to find that handful of bars and restaurants you know you can always go to and just enjoy the company of friends, talking and enjoying a few drinks.  Five stars all the way.

-qFuoSVFlKgQdZdbFcjDWw.review_text: The kale salad is massive and delicious! Definitely recommend it. Plus a huge selection of beer and wine.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: This place is cute with a good selection of wine on tap. I thoroughly enjoyed their mac n cheese (we ordered 2). Why only 3 stars? Slow slow slow service. It took us forever to get a table and forever to get the check settled.  I say go for a drink but leave it at that. (State Bird Provisions is right around the corner!)

xObzTAC6gsFH6XKhc9yRYQ.review_text: "Fat angel" Yeah, stop thinking about cupid, and start thinking low-fi date nights, That's what I think of it, this place is a great place to "wet your whistle" which incredible Around happy-hour right before the sunsets it's kinda romantic in a smokey, antique type of way with it's various wooden seats and cramped decor which reminds me of the 1960's revisted, and place like this looks like it deserves Whiskey, or some single-malt scotch in your glass. I enjoyed the prosciutto flat-bread and the Macaroni and cheese I split with my friend, she drinks more than I do, so the service called to her bidding, with thier Huge list of Drinks! I personally, Had the Pinot Noir 2011 Lupe-Cholet 'Comte de Lupe'  Bourgogne, France... I can taste the lovely rasberries it has some bite to it and It was amazing with the Mac and Cheese! Also there was this delicious "Pumpkin Like Porter" called the "Imperial Chocolate Pumpkin Porter   Anchorage, Alaska  (651ml)" In which tasted like "Pumpkin Pie". I was astounded by the selection. The service was pretty decent, but didn't really stand out, (I guess they don't expect punk kids like Myself to have money?) We made it in time for happy hour so our curiosity got the better of us... I'd go back here when I'm craved an awesome list of Libation, as far as service...I'll let you pass this time! Just Because I think you title is a reference to A Jefferson Airplane Song! youtube.com/watch?v=9A7j…

YtNaqqpq_HKek7H2anTBMA.review_text: I have found a new love here in SF. I loved it so much that I returned to dine here 2 nights in a row. You must be patient to come here. The wait can be long, approximately 1 hour each time I came, but definitely worth it. Grab a drink at the bar while you wait and make sure to bring people that will make good conversation or you can always stand at a table giving dirty looks to hurry up and get going. Anyway back to Fat Angel, great selection of beers and amazing bites. You would definitely have to come here a few times to try all the items on the menu. The menu itself is quite small but you definitely want to try it ALL. For appetizers they offer their flavored butters (yum), cheese and meats (yum yum). They offer salads, flat breads, mac n cheese, sliders ( a must try!!! you will die for the sauce), and chicken pot pie. They also offer items for dessert but the 2 times I dined I was way to stuffed to get to that part of the meal. I will definitely have to leave room next time. Great place for a dinner date or small party. Definitely a place I will have to come and visit when in town. Totally in love with you golden chubby lil winged angel. Till we meet again.

N3m7gHzGix1d5Xesnr0TZA.review_text: Yay! I am so happy to see that Fat Angel is getting so many good reviews. I LOVE this place. I live a few blocks away and it is exactly what you want your neighborhood restaurant to be, only better because there are chandeliers, a witty menu and great prices. My bf and I are the wine and appy type and every time we go out we end up paying 100 bucks for a few glasses of wine and some bites. Not at Fat Angel...we had amazing food and wine, service was great and the bill was like $50!  I couldn't believe it. The quality of food is so good I was expecting it to be higher. This is a great spot and we will definitely be back soon!

oHgFEYuxCs9KDmYZ55qHOA.review_text: Would never have even noticed this place (which is just off of Fillmore in Western Addition) had my friend not lived in the building.  But thank God she did because this wine/beer bar is great!  Met the owner, Cyrick, who's a really cool dude.  Friendly, laidback ... type of guy you'd hang out with normally.  Except he just happens to be a guy who also owns a kick-ass place.  The decor is dimly lit with chandeliers and decorations that were formally part of a church.  The wine selection seemed pretty good (not much of a vinophile).  The draft beer selection (which I noticed much later and didn't get to try) is unique and quite interesting.  There's a small menu for nibbles.  The trout salad is huge and can be split among 3 at least.  The sliders were also yummy.  Great hangout place ... definitely will be back!

y70ymmi2tgL9GN5sqe1wGg.review_text: Draft wine, giant salads, north coast brewery beers...can this angel get any fatter? The place is not slim on personality, either. Everything seems to be hand selected from consignment shops and flea markets. It's a labor of love for the owners and it shows.

3b5Zh_tCmI8tcZ9yyR1_tA.review_text: This place reminds me of my ex -- pluses and minuses but worth it overall.  Though the wine and beer selection are very good, the food is hit or miss.  The sliders are fantastic, and the endive salad was lovely.; but the chicken pot pie was awkwardly sweet with soggy crust.  Outdoor dining available for warm evenings, a nice place for a casual date.  Good service, friendly staff, nice crowd.  Not open for business until 4pm.

hCxu1f3hlyLmbIgDgijBfw.review_text: Amazing food, amazing wine.  The atmosphere is really nice and cozy - it's great place to get together and have a couple share plates and drinks with friends.

x6_8-SBS55EU4xNIjS2rrA.review_text: Definitely one of my boyfriend and I's favorite places to frequent.  The ambiance  is is one of relaxation, romance and quirky fun.  The lighting is kept dim, the furniture is vintage inspired, beautiful flowers decorate some of the corners while a great chandelier dangles from the slightly vaulted ceiling.  Laid back classy.  There is a great wine list with wonderful little descriptions to help you decide which one to pick and to have in the most beautiful glasses ever!  We always end up going with one of Jason's suggestions, as his recommendations are spot on for whatever your pallets mood is!  I love bubbles and wish there was a bigger variety, however, their food is pretty amazing!!  The flat bread is off the hook!!  One day we stumbled in here with some friends and had to make it a quick pit stop and requested the speediest food they could make... bread and home made butter!!  OH you have to try the chili garlic butter!!  It is out of this world!!!!!  It is spicy and savory!!   This is a place I could come to after work every day to unwind!

wCWWjX9Gcj4_Z7SU9DlADw.review_text: Been here a few times, seems its going downhill a bit to be honest. They need to step up their game and not settle for the fact they're booked up every night. The two salads we ordered were below average, sent one back, had wilted lettuce. The anchovy pizza was good and the beer, of course is always good. Food overall very average for SF.

w2kHG3Uw86GKoXBQitQm_Q.review_text: maybe it was all the beer and wine i drank before eating anything, but i loved the cozy boozy atmosphere of this place. it's tiny, but we scored a fun little marble topped table and bench to fit the four of us. shared an apple dessert that was absolutely huge. the "draft wine" (sauv blanc) was drinkably delicious, and service was friendly.

aeY_iHQQOWD39r59bxEcJA.review_text: Nice selection of beer and friendly owner.

FiHXzEXrQpePOtgz_h71pA.review_text: Great little spot hidden in the Filmore. Parking is fairly easy and meters stop after 6 which is becoming rate in this city. Nice selection of foreign wines and beers. The bread and infused butters are nice. The PotPie is something I'd order again and again!

FqYYd3p-phMkZ5GVjkUzxg.review_text: There are so many reasons why one might not go to Fat Angel: it's small and popular, which means finding seating might be impossible for groups of more than two; it's really more of a bar than restaurant, so if you expect to meet for dinner here, you might leave hungry after a few strips of prosciutto and a bite of Mac and cheese; parking in this neighborhood is horrible; and  you might accidentally buy a $41 bottle of obscure holiday beer.  But there are also many reasons why you should try this place out anyways, such as the great, cozy atmosphere and extensive wine and beer offerings. But most of all, go for the service. I've never seen such warm, helpful, unpretentious servers in such a trendy spot. They'll seat you without your whole party, practically rearrange the entire restaurant to accommodate a group, and never pressure lingering guests to leave, despite the constant demand.

WHW-3CySpPUs5v9i5fOzRQ.review_text: Love Fat Angel.  Everything is great.  People are super nice.  No, it's not French Laundry, but it's awesome.

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: Quiet possibly the greatest place to take a date in the city. Edit for hyperbole but you get the idea. This has to be one of my favorite places in the city and had to give them a proper yelp review finally. The combination of atmosphere, cost, quality of food and drinks make it a no brainier five star that anyone venturing in the Fillmore area should try.  The highlight of Fat Angel for me is the food. It is a relatively small menu but everything on it is worth taking a shot at. The areas they excel in are the salads and the flat-breads. I had never encountered this combination of flavors before I came here and was shocked they could get such quality food to come out of that small kitchen.   Seriously all four salads are delicious. My personal favorites being the kale salad and the endive salad. Also the portions on the salads are HUGE. They should be shared by two people and shouldn't even be attempted by one person. They aren't expensive and will fill you up. The Flat breads are even better. Every time I look at the menu I want to try something else but I always, always get the roasted red grape and walnut flat bread. It is just so savory and a perfect combination of sweet and salty. I rely on my date to order one of the others so I can at least try it but it is a halfhearted attempt at best.   Another positive is the service time. The turnaround on food is one of the best I have had in the city and the quality is always consistent. Shout out to whoever is back there whipping up the food.  By this time you are completely full and realize you haven't even gotten to the main dishes. I have had the sliders and the mac and cheese which are both great as well. The mac and cheese is very spicy so be forewarned if you aren't used to that.   This place also holds its own as a bar as well. There is a stuff drink menu with plenty of options for the beer aficionados. The wine is pretty varied as well but may not satisfy the wine heads of SF.   The customer service is great at Fat Angel as well. With easy pay at the bar and personally calling you when your table is ready are great perks.   Also full disclosure I am in love with the bartender/waitress.I don't know her name but she has short hair and tattoos and is the woman of my dreams.  I am sure she is married or taken but I am professing my love for her here.   The negatives that could knock off some stars for others are just how small Fat Angel is. It is a really tiny and intimate place and can get crowded on most nights by around 8 or 9pm. I am talking standing room only at the bar and freezing your butt off by choosing to sit at the outside tables because nothing is available inside. Be prepared for a wait time but its never too long. Also the small place leads to some really really close table set ups. You are in the other couples conversation no matter what so be prepared for people watching as you will be two inches from someone else.   Fat Angel may have an odd name but as one of my first introductions to social life in SF I couldn't have had a better experience. The service has not dipped in the three years I have been in SF and I would venture to say it won't when you make your way out there as well.   Fillmore has a gem that serves a perfect wine and candlelight home with food that leaves you coming back for more. Also if you know the waitress tell her she is awesome and has a fan club. This is the place I suggest whenever dinner is up to me so I am sure I will see you there.

1kpMAKRZuAz3OzxBav3XTg.review_text: When settling in for a relaxing swirl, there are times when I want to be free from decision making. For an establishment that bills itself as a wine bar, there's a surprising lack of flights that would allow for just that. However, the beverge list is broken up into digestible bits: quaff, suds, wines etc that make browsing fun. They work with the cordial and wine license pretty well, offering a few specialty effervescent imbibes and several classics like the Pimm's Cup for happy toasting.  After a few rounds, I could imagine slipping into the gentle ease of the place, noshing on delectable cheeses of which there are a-plenty, and becoming anvil-ed to the church pews on the arm of a fella. I'd certainly go steady with this charming watering hole were I a denizen of the neighborhood.

JC99U5y-KAchZIjBhf_DiQ.review_text: I absolutely love it here. This is such a cute gem in the neighborhood that it is. It's small, so be prepared to wait on a busy night.  The decor and ambiance is great for a romantic date (after dinner or even before for light snacks and drinks), and it's great for a few friends just to hang out.  Completely low key but uber chic and cute.  The drink list is super intense, and quite extensive. It takes some time to navigate it.  i saw other people eating salads and they were huge. We got the mushroom flat bread which was completely divine. The mushrooms were fresh and so fragrant. There was the right amount of cheese just to give the salty and nutty taste.  We also got the sliders which I am still dreaming and drooling over.  They were the best sliders I've ever had. They were juicy and fresh. Love it!

0WevaqedEPCwY7nybLPjIQ.review_text: The food here is really good. Highly recommend the sliders and bread pudding. The salads are huge, beware.

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: Snazzy. I got a Red Rocket beer; it was very red! And strong. And good! My companions both got wine, I think a Pinot recommended by the bartender. It's a cozy little place, on the upscale end, and perfect before a show at the Fillmore.  Apparently they have food as well, but I don't think I saw that menu. I will probably be back if I can remember the place; it's off toe the side on O'Farell.

HKC-j6ShF_wUfB0q1BH5cw.review_text: This place is awesome.   Extensive beer list (100+ super local beers) - check Friendly elk greeting from the wall - check (optional) Christmas tree with Polaroid pictures of the patrons - check  The super friendly gals working at the bar will seat you quickly in this intimite but yet lively place. You might be surprised that the beer/wine selection takes about 90% of the menu but this is a wine bar after all. However, also come here for the food as it's delicious!  The FLATBREAD PIZZA comes in various styles (Firebrand sourdough baguette and whole grain mustard with chorizo, duck salami, genoa, pheasant terrine, speck, or soppressata, $5-$28) and is worth every penny - most delicious topped sourdough I've had in a while, and super crispy.  The SOURDOUGH & BUTTER ($5) satisfies in a special kinda way - have you tried Philz Cofffee butter or Maple Bacon butter? I bet you haven't. Go order.  Finally, the CHICKEN POT PIE (roast chicken, carrots, sherry, tarragon, $13) was creamy and had a sweet hint to it. Marvelous.  Fat Angel - a pleasant surprise in the lower Fillmore area. Stay where you are, angel. I'll be back.

8hT-bpZG55SkAftXm49PnA.review_text: Great vibe, tasty small plates and fantastic wine selection.

GtAvwG3oTH4RxlpiDbO0tw.review_text: Cozy and consistent, Fat Angel is my go-to spot for wine and comfort food. Their carafes of wine and simple yet delicious food is best served with good friends over reflective conversations.   Although the restaurant itself is not "fat" by any means as there always seems to be a wait for a table in the cramped quarters, the hostess is super friendly and will offer to text you when a table is available. If you are seeking delicious flatbread, super decadent selections of charcuterie and cheeses, a good list of wines and beers that are priced very well, than it's definitely worth the wait!

Afi_m8NRQZBFPHckPVsL5A.review_text: so this is my first yelp review and i just HAD to write a review for this place. :)   so i went here thursday with a friend n her friend n this place is completely awesome!!!!!  loved the cheqered past and the pale ale cy suggested. :)  maple bacon butter was to quite delicious along with the mac n cheese. DEFINITELY get bacon with it. :) and the sliders... dude... we got two orders of it and i finished 4 of them all to myself. haha. had the proscuitto and that was yummy too. i will definitely drag my friend back here again after a long day at school. :)

fJhMv-mra7nWmkJwhdkEYg.review_text: Friendly and unpretentious, it's a great addition to the neighborhood!  Food is good and affordable and the selection of wine is terrific.  The flatbreads and olives are particularly yummy, and the sliders are just amazing.  I've been there 4 times since it opened, and always had fun.  Will definitely become a regular.

GKYUu0Qi6_Wnqv0CHAg0Cg.review_text: I love this place. I've been coming here for years and it never disappoints. The food is amazing, staff is always helpful with libation recommendations and the ambiance is perfection. Beware- this place is in high demand and it's not very big. I avoid peak nights, but that goes for most places in the city. They've got a good thing going and I always look forward to coming back.  P.S.- The asparagus flatbread is heaven. I always get excited when I see it pop back on the menu.

mX1yqLOpbRAS-f-tyHuDEQ.review_text: (Like) a real Belgian bar / bistro! Ok, a bit more clean :). Delicious food, the flatbread is amazing! And the beers are rich and flavoured. Nice crowed, perfect!

YKZIkrW5H4F3iWOBJPNneQ.review_text: They get 4.5 stars why the .5 you ask?    only two small reasons, one the place is too small (i wish i could bring my whole crew but we wouldnt fit and it might be too lively for this mellow chill zone), and the portion of cheese is (sometimes depending on how is cutting it in the back) too small I would like a larger piece of cheese more consistently with single serving orders i understand when you order the combo the slices will be smaller but if i order a single i would like a good size slice!  also the variety of cheese is not very extensive (same animal same type of feel to each cheese) they rotate everything with a passion (beer/wine) i would like to see a new cheese every night or every week featured "off menu" on the board of "all things good" (its in the back with the cool drunk quotes on it) me and my lady are cheese addicts and this is the closest place to get it and get it good!    Ok now that i have my cheese complaint out of the way lets concentrate on the rest of the 4.5 stars!  First the owners are awesome, generous with samples makes me wanna buy more!  You can tell they love what they do ( i used to be in the industry and this is something you can tell! it translates into the whole feel of the place) they are passionate about their hand selected ingredients beer and wine.  They both have GREAT taste, i dont agree with all their choices but i respect their commitment to their unique style and flavor choices, setting them apart from the other "run of the mill" locally owned restaurants in the area.  The wine list is second to none having varietals that span from the most basic to the rare tasty varietals the distinguished pallet craves!    Food is awesome, hands down always made fresh to order the pot pie is off the chain! the flat beards get all the love but dont forget the mac and cheese and sliders as well!   In closing no matter what you choose at the angel it is going to be "heavenly"

28fOZ4RBjRJB9JM025xzJQ.review_text: Ok wow. Decor from an old church. Wow. What an atmosphere. The server was so very helpul. The food and wine were amazing. Will go back next time i'm in SF.

g_qBlcaJMvl4QgZuSe6f_A.review_text: This is my favor spots to hang out with my frds, love the interior and the food! They get the best Mac-n-cheese! Also chicken pie! So bomb!!!!!!! They get a lot of beer! It's awesome! They also open a new place call stones throw! Check it out too！

-PyXVs_ZAKmey7gsRhz-hg.review_text: This place is located right across the street from a friends apartment, so he recommended us to go here! It was a Saturday night around 10ish when we got there. Inside was still relatively crowded but we were still able to get seating after a short wait.  We ordered the spicy Mac & cheese ($13) which was just as good as all the other Yelpers claimed! (Yay I'm joining the bandwagon) I do think it's a bit pricey, the plate is rather small but it is pretty dense so it will fill you up especially if you're not sharing. The sliders ($13) were also really good!! Definitely recommend that. We also got a cheese plate..it's served with bread and jelly.   For drinks, I can only speak for myself. I got the Sauvignon blanc (2013) and it tasted like crap. I couldn't finish it :( and I hate wasting alcohol.  The ambience of this place is casual! Kinda dark inside. The decorations are cool. The bathroom is nice and clean too!! There's even decorations inside. This is a plus for me, somebody who has a small bladder and spends much of their time running to the bathroom. :)  Overall great experience, just pricey. $80+ for 3 people.

JgeWmSQJIKjYwsGjY-oOXQ.review_text: Fat angels? More like fat hipsters. I was showing some friends from out of town sf and used yelp to find this bar. Parking was limited so I had my friends park the car so that I could go in and grab a table. INSTANT DISCRIMINATION. The snobs who worked there (except the Hispanic waiter who initially greeted me) were horrible. I asked for a table for 4 and got seated at a two seater. They acted like I was going to dine and dash the entire time. I looked over the menu as I waited for my friends, and in that time almost every obnoxious waiter (especially the pretentious dbag in the jorts who looks like the guy from the mountain goats) Came over to me and asked me what I wanted when it wasn't even busy and said they were going to get busy hinting for me to leave. I was pressured into buying a $20 bottle of mead that was a fair price if they included a free bj along with it. After ordering I asked if I could switch to a bigger table and they laughed and said "maybe when you're friends get here" rolling her eyes. Long story short my friends got there we closed the tab and I left her money plus tip which I didn't want to give. (I was a waitress and I have never in my life treated any of my customers so rudely). Then jorts (jean shorts) and waspy hipster girl run after my friends and I claiming that we hadn't paid! They've got good brew at horrible prices, but the pretentious hipsters that serve there are what make me never want to come back.

5bOsjahXaYZ6mnQAkE_fcQ.review_text: When the drink menu is 6 sheets+ and the food menu is just a single sheet, you know you're in the right kind of place on a Friday night. It was a 30 minute wait for a party of 3 on a Friday night around 7pm, not bad considering how small the place is. There's seating outside, but it was too cold and windy. Food was delicious, and the beer selection even better. Can't wait to go back and try out some more of their delicious beer!

5GpOt6sv-fGZkNKxJFhVow.review_text: Gem.   Cozy and masculine solid wine / beer-geek bar. Great nibbles. Great atmosphere. Great music. Never too crowded. Perfection.

8kNVE_M7qScs9p9A1kYadg.review_text: So this place is really crowded and the tables are teeeeeeny, so getting a table for more than two people is a pain.  The salami and spread with bread are delicious and just melts in your mouth.  The chicken pot pie is delicious and the way they do it is unique and different in a refreshing way.  The mac and cheese is really cheesy, but would be better if it were a lot less peppery.  Service felt a little slow, but all in all, this place is satisfactory.

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: I haven't been to this place in about six months, and clearly a lot has changed. This has become a super popular location, to the degree that it's literally overflowing, not in a good way.  They squeeze entirely too many people into a tiny space; the people who are waiting are standing over you; and the servers are bumping into you every few seconds to get to a different table.    Things are also a lot less friendly and very disorganized. All of the waiters seem overwhelmed and therefore rude/snippy. Twice I had someone pick up my almost empty - notice I said almost; I wasn't finished - and not even ask if I want another glass. Who picks up a wine glass at a wine bar but doesn't ask if you want another glass?   As a result, I likely won't be returning to this place until they get things under control.

9IF2ZMnkrZlvxCHcO0h1EQ.review_text: This is a great spot to check out early, as in right after they open because it's small and popular, which means a long wait. We arrived about a half hour after opening and grabbed a spot in front of the roll up window. The service was friendly, but SLOW and during the time we were there, the place filled up to the point that the one waiter and waitress appeared to be underwater.   The menu is small, but well edited and complements the ginormous beer offerings.   The romaine salad with fried capers was huge, perfect for two. The caesar dressing packed just enough garlicky punch and the fried capers provided a salty tang.   The assortment of bread and flavored butters was a nice change and not something seen on many menus. The maple bacon butter paired with Firebrand bread was sublime.   Great little spot for beer enthusiasts who like to not just imbibe, but also eat well.

o03ZwIhEEbKLxffxBmcuUw.review_text: I don't like wine bars, but I like Fat Angel. The wine on tap keeps it from being too pretentious, while the salvaged church decor and music straight off my iTunes keeps it from being too boring. I had a not-quite meal here of cheeses, butters and of course wines, all of which were reasonably priced and perfect to share with a date. When I came on a week night it was pretty empty, but I hear that it's usually packed. I can see why.

p08F3g2_lSSdzyjnVcvt4w.review_text: I won't remember this place except the fat angel statue is kinda cool looking. The waiter totally screwed up our order.  He redeemed himself by giving us our food for free.  Stil...the appetizer was not good.

Pruz1_cuALUa0SeQmoSsYQ.review_text: Nobody actually likes kale, right?  But they would if they went to Fat Angel and ordered the kale salad with bacon, toasted almonds and vinagrette.  It was a massive bowl of leaves, but because it wasn't drenched in dressing, it was easy to enjoy the lot of it.  Restaurants rarely do vegetables or salads this well or with such a great serving size.  The restaurant was extremely crowded and the service wasn't perfet, but the buzz was delightful and the lighting was perfectly dim.  My daughter ordered the chicken pot pie and it was also about the tastiest one we've ever tried.  Too bad the hotel didn't have a fridge for the leftovers!  Too rich to eat the whole thing, but would have been great to share.  This place is a gem.

ptLIFLUPwg3MYt-J62s3iA.review_text: Securing a date with a pretty girl is easy for most guy, but I am not most guys and once again I disappointed my elitist friends and showed up stag for a company event. I figured it was the first Friday of March and I would be cut a little slack.  Maybe a better use of my time on Yelp is searching for a quality for a plastic surgeon rather than wine bars? I digress...  Fat Angel however did not disappoint. A galaxy of wines offered by the glass from all corners of the universe. The servers are experts at guiding you to that perfect copa of rioja and telling you it's story. Yes, you heard me right. Each glass of wine tells a tale. There is a famous line from Sideways describing the delicacy of the pinot noir grape. I can't exactly recite it verbatim, just take my word for it that it applies to this review  The last thing I need last night was another glass of alcohol especially after already consuming two martinis and your coworkers are riding you once again for failing on scoring a date. But I must say, through all the fuzziness of last night, Fat Angel delivered and was made an excellent end to a nice evening out with friends and all their *sigh* significant others.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: I had some of the best beer I've had in a while here last night called SOS- it was their Fat Tuesday special. Even better was that they served it to us in 23 oz dark plastic cups, which came in handy later. They also have a good looking wine list, that I definitely want to come back and try! I heard their food is yummy too, but I didn't get a chance to try any of it. The ambience inside is super cute, with a friendly crowd and a helpful bartender.  This place is definitely a winner in my book!

wGXrNSJyqMx2x0BgLTBIVg.review_text: I am fortunate to have stumbled in and out of this wine bar.  The decor, vibe, service are all outstanding.  And I am thankful after several visits to have finally ordered food.   I have no idea how they prepare in the small space but I crave their offerings.  The trout salad, cheese plate, the pot pie are all stellar.  So glad I can walk to this place!

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: For a drinking establishment, this place serves up some killer food. Chicken pot pie is a must - taste very homemade and hearty. Sliders are a little light on the meat but great aioli. The flatbreads are nicely done as well. Prices are not cheap but you do get pretty decent quality bar food. They seem to have a good collection of wine and beer. Ambience is great - it is both casual yet moderately intimate.
