TJMgOTcm2ShyOpablSYbXA.review_text: Packing this lil angel in my suitcase and taking him back home with me to Ohio.  Draft wine? Alright! Dim lights and romantic ambiance? Sure. (It's great for dates and meetups with friends.) Bread -n- butter appetizer with maple bacon butter? Dudes. Superb, friendly service that called our party amazingly good looking? Nail in the coffin.   There was something truly magical and relaxing... and comfortable... about this wine bar and it literally seemed to have that "something" that everyone loves. For me, it was everything.

6RJBeJlbDGrZO91Qc2NG9A.review_text: On Yelpers recommendations we tried the wine bar last Friday.  Didn't know what to expect/how busy on a kick off evening for Labor Day weekend.  By 6pm the place was packed.    That being said, I guess I"m learning I'm a true wine afficionado.  Although Fat Angel had (1) great prices, (2) great nibbles, and (3) great service and ambience, I'm in it for the wine people.  I"ll be back for hanging out with friends and so forth, but I will remain on my quest for the best wine bar with good selections and prices.   ~ Ms. Ali

cTrlhfni7C3xFlyIL3x1bQ.review_text: One of my favorite spots in the city hands down. To start- the wine! Where else can you find wine ON TAP? That was a first for me. They change their wine and beer selections constantly and have local micro-brews on tap as well. The food is great, the burger sliders and the salads are tasty. The cheeses and meats are superb and very fresh. And you have to try the flavored butter and the flat bread. Everything on the menu is a win for me and the prices are fair. I recommend ordering the food you want then asking which wine would pair with it. The owner is really nice and will give you advice on what to try, and give you samples of the wine if you aren't sure what you want.   The ambiance of this place is very laid back, its fancy but casual and works well for groups or more intimate dates. Inside, the benches are church pues which have been donated, there is a full sized chuch organ, a huge chandalier, and a collection of cork tops above the bar. The outdoor seating is convenient, just wish they had some heaters out there! Besides that, I really can't find anything I'd change. 5 stars!

IUXmQbiQSG97Aez2rOKmcQ.review_text: OH MY DEAR.  Went here last night around 6:30 before a show at the Fillmore. Completely impressed and completely DEPRESSED at the fact that I never knew this palce existed!  We got some great beers--i got a sour something--i know this is awful but i don't remember what it was--my bf ordered it for me. Beers were good but nothing compared to the food--we split everything:  3 cheese for $14 -Truffle Tremor (My favorite--so good!) -Vella Dry Jack  NorCal hard cow--like a sharper Jack cheese, also very good -Some kind of Gouda--also delicious It came with a nice jam pairing and organic crustinis  GREAT DEAL AND SO DELICIOUS  Mac n' Cheese - gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano  $11 This was delicious and the breaded topping was great as well! The pasta was a perfect texture too  3 Sliders - beef, caramelized onions, bacon, irish cheddar, aioli  10 Holy Cow these were tender, juicy, and that aoili sauce has crack in it i swear. Was a little sad that it came with 3 sliders and i was with 2 others so I could only eat one....  All in all, a great experience but I would definitely recommend getting there before 630/7 because it got PACKED while we were sitting there.

TdrP2Sp7jpk1WmPq-6yWYw.review_text: Okay so several visits later, have to update my review. Still give it 4 stars so long as it's a nice night/day out and you're outside. Otherwise, the inside is pretty much just like any other crowded, loud bar.  Upon walking in, it took 7 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge us or make eye contact.  Host walked past us about 4 times with his ipad.    Took more standing right by the bar to get someone's attention who then said they needed to check with the host who again ignored us until we jumped in front of him as he walked by the 5th time.  Finally sit down, takes another couple of minutes for the waitress to get to us, though she was apologetic, which I can appreciate.  Our order came pretty quickly which was nice. But took us another 10 minutes to get our plates, napkins and knife.  As good as the cheese was, I still need a knife.  We had to ask multiple people to get our place settings.  Finally when we're all settled in, trying to enjoy our food and libations, table next to us was just filled with loud obnoxious guys who seemed to want to have all their friends join them at a small 4-person table.  Their waiter was as eager to participate in this "bumpin" night as they were.  Wondering if he was on something too since he bumped into and stepped on my foot a few times while trying to take their order.  No apologies.  We were very eager to leave.  If you find yourself here, do yourself a favor and stay outside.  2 stars for their indoor experience, and 4 for their outdoor experience.

9Ph3y_Wmypnuf-3zw5IAUQ.review_text: This place is fantastic. Came here randomly a few weeks ago. A friend and I had been searching for another wine bar, but when we couldn't find it, we stumbled upon this one instead. The selection of beers was very impressive, but what caught my eye - and captured my heart - was the fact they have WINE ON TAP. Let me repeat that again.. Fat Angel has WINE ON TAP. I thought draft wine only existed in my version of heaven.  Anyway, we had to wait quite a long time to be seated, which is perhaps the only downside. It was a Wednesday night. It was around 8. And it was packed. Just elbowing our way to the bar to put our names on the waiting list was tricky. We must have been lucky to arrive at exactly the same time as everyone else, because by the time we were seated (well over an hour later) it was no longer so crowded. But they have WINE ON TAP, so I was content. As for the food, we ordered the 3 cheese plate, the chorizo meat plate, the asparagus flatbread and the sliders. Being generally gluten free, I passed on the breads that arrived with our cheeses and meat, and the kitchen was (kindly) able to serve my sliders with lettuce instead of buns. Everything I ate was super tasty, and my friend enjoyed his flatbread too.  Just about everything here was fab; the decor was fun, the bar staff friendly, the servers attentive, the food yummy, the drinks flowing. I just would have liked to not have had such a long wait. Especially on a weekday (we didn't leave until almost 11:30). But you can't knock a place for being popular, especially when it's this good.

anSJThb6sQByQS9sPIC3bg.review_text: Word of the Meal: CRAMPED  So the Mister and I, being from Los Angeles, are becoming more conscious about our caloric intake, health and fitness. In addition to regular exercise and healthy eating, we recently cut out processed carbs and unnecessary sugars after 6pm. One day, I just couldn't take it anymore. So, we went to Fat Angel since it was two blocks away. It was packed on a cold, dreary night. Nobody appeared to be hosting or seating people, so I made my way to an empty table and sat down. Not knowing if this was acceptable behavior at Fat Angel, I kind of went with it and went to town with the carbs. LOL.  We had the Pimm's cup and the Champagne cocktail for drinks. Neither of which were to die for. We then ordered the mac-n-cheese, chicken pot pie and sliders. The sliders had a good cook on them and were tasty. The chicken pot pie was yummy, but there wasn't enough crust and therefore, too much filling. The filling, however, did have a good amount of shredded chicken which I was glad they didn't skimp on. The mac-n-cheese was okay. It was served in a hot skillet which made scooping and serving the dish a bit difficult (there was no pan holder or hot glove to help in handling it). The Mister didn't take to the mac-n-cheese and said he could have made it himself. Although a fair assessment as far as difficulty of the dish, the Mister rarely cooks...yeah, go figure! Kettle meet pot.   The service at Fat Angel was good, but the envirnoment was too cramped for our style. Other table's conversations were bleeding into ours, coercing silence. I did get what I was in search of - a few mouth fulls of starchy carbs, but I do not think I would go back again. A gastropub probably isn't my cup of tea, but I am sure others had a wonderful time at this neighborhood joint.

CxWcGXtQSRJn6_C241xC9A.review_text: Tuesday night, lookin' for a place to grab a bite to eat before our 7:30 show at Yoshi's. Enter: Fat Angel They advertise on their signboards that they serve "comfort food," and based on what we ate that night, we can attest to it. -The trout salad ($13, with fried capers and horseradish vinaigrette!) came in a ginormous bowl of greens--it had a smoky flavor, but not too overpowering. yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… -And the spicy mac and cheese ($12)? Score. It had a kick to it, and made a nice addition to the salad yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… -Beers ($1 off for happy hour at 7p is a great plus!): s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com… the Rugbrod from the Brewery ($8.50) yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… the Moscow rye Russian imperial stout by Midnight Sun ($8): yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… The ambiance seemed like standard gastropub fare. The lights were turned down low (great for dates), but the tables felt too close to one another. I could've probably reached over to the folks next to us and copped some of their bread. Next time I'd look forward to tasting the flatbread, butters, and another couple of the great number of beers in their selection.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: After drinking lots of red wine, eating charcuterie and rich cheese i could have just taken a nap right at the table. Loved the variety of butter to choose from to eat with the sourdough bread and mustard. The flatbreads are light and indulgent yet not as much as the mac n cheese with gruyere and cheddar. Absolutely share and wash it down with more wine. I've been back several times since for girls night and date night. Fat Angel is a great place for both. It's just hard to get a seat if you're not there early in the evening.  Best if your party is small.

6Chth4-xjMGgTtaAZkrYxQ.review_text: They have a fantastic selection of sour beers. Hoping to return for a proper meal someday...

dH9dz7xCldQyAkIhfAj_7g.review_text: I'm so glad my bf found this place on Yelp! We had some last minute changes during our SF getaway and wanted some delicious food in our bellies :) We got lucky with parking and quickly found our way to the quaint little pub. About a 10 minute wait and had a look at the menu even though we already knew what we were going to have. Unfortunately, we were seated on a two-top with 3 people, but moved after a few dishes came out when the table next to us left. Polenta fries with garlic aioli and spicy ketchup: So bomb! Fried to perfection. The garlic aioli was nice and creamy and the ketchup had just the right kick. yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… Salame nostrano and hot copa (??): Originally ordered just the salame but because the "order took so long" (I didn't think it was too long of a wait o_O) one of the owners gave us the other meat on the house! Don't remember if it was the hot copa or not, but it was delicioso~ The meats come with whole grain mustard and bread. yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… Red grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread: The right size for the three of us. Generous amount of all ingredients and a classic combo done right. yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-… Mac n cheese: Creamy and good portion, given the other things we also ordered. We were stuffed and I had to beast it out for the last few bites.http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-angel-­san-francisco?select=v6j6QhxBbF2D93-rv_IRyQ All the Yelp reviews are testament to the owners' passion and dedication to Fat Angel. They really enjoy doing what they do and are happy to help you make your food/beverage selection. My only regret is not getting anything to drink because they have a wide selection of beers and wines.

-HxJ4KzGDSnIkZUMAoWgTQ.review_text: My review of F.A. has been way overdue.  We've been coming in for months with our friends and always our little baby.  We've probably been in 12 times.  We consider F.A. our go to neighborhood haunt.  We always feel welcomed and we always leave satisfied.  The thing that separates F.A. from other bars is the little things.  The sweet little accompaniments to the cheese plate are so well paired, and the meat plate always puts a smile on my face.  The sliders are off the chain, and the mac and cheese is sinfully delicious.  WE LOVE FA

q78dkeyym0d3UCK7vWeYpQ.review_text: it was yummy and absolutely adorable and cozy inside. great for a cold evening. the mac n cheese was delish,  the mushroom flatbread was scrumptious and the flavored butter out of this world. I just wish my pimms cup was larger!

rOqeQewALXadVWCbhWty0Q.review_text: Hi.   The bf and I decided to stop by here before watching glamorized slaughterfest 2012 aka The Hunger Games at Kabuki Theater. It's fairly close, and you only have to walk about 5 minutes to get to Kabuki.   We walked in and the friendly cashier girl motioned to some tables, but we opted for the bar so we could see their different pours.   Now, the ambiance of this place is like the livingroom of a cozy cabin, deer head and all! I really liked it, and the patrons kept their voices at a minimal tone, even at an establishment that wasn't a speakeasy AND had alcohol! Amazing! The beer list is awesome. Actually the whole damn beer  and wine list is awesome. I mean if I had the tolerance of a Dartmouth frat boy (eeee) I would have tried a whole bunch of other shizz. However, Sundays are my hangover GTFOOMF days, so I opted for the Hef they had on tap, and the BF had some Retribution? Refraction? Redemption?...some apocalyptic sounding beer. Those were great!  For food, we had the mushroom truffle flatbread, which contributes to me docking down a star. For the life of me, I could NOT make out any truffle. If you slap the word truffle on it, I expect to ... at least smell it, if not taste it.  The warm pretzel was really amaze though (MORE MUSTARD THO), and perfect beer food.   Overall, it's a great place to grab a bite and sit and chit chat before/after a movie at the Kabuki. I will definitely be back.

LyOf4HPxuFi1a32KvR90fw.review_text: This is a hidden gym! You won't just run into this place you have to look for it. My boyfriend brought me here before we headed to a movie at Kabuki for my birthday. He is more of a beer guy than wine so this place was perfect for us!  I had prosecco while he had casey jones beer (which he loved). For dinner we shared a cheese and meat plate. Our favorite was their flat bread, which has asparagus, ricotta cheese, and pine nuts. It was perfect! We both keep talking about how amazing it was. I'll be back here soon, but next time with my girlfriends for our monthly wine night!

4mJFG2DzWvycSjRckiKKCQ.review_text: Four of us stopped by Sunday evening for a few adult libations and some snacks. We were promptly seated, drink ordered taken and before we knew it, drinks were served -:)   We ordered the cheese tray, sliders and some of the garlic  jalapeño butter. I felt is was a bit odd to get butter but it turned out to be really really good.    Everyone had a great time and we look forward to our next visit.

1dj2Vp9plba4O9hGtKaB8w.review_text: I love love love this wine bar!  The selections of wines are limited however the quality is great which was a nice surprise.  The space itself is quite small very cozy with great ambiance and low lighting.  The staff is friendly, informed and provided stellar service. I don't think anyone had an empty glass for more than a minute.  The staff is attentive and in no way obtrusive.  The cheese plate is hands down the best I have ever experienced and I highly recommend it. Each cheese was paired with a complementary nut/jam/honeycomb and was pure heaven especially with the endless bags of fresh sourdough bread.  They have great happy hour deals but even without the happy hour pricing I will definitely be back and very soon!

4dbVUWI-_U6ry6rr2jGcXg.review_text: A new Fav get sliders insanly good, flat bread and huge salads are great as well.

wjQv92px4xHjbBoATkOTUw.review_text: I really enjoyed the experience here. We ordered their Cinsault/Syrah/Cabernet blend and it was a table hit. I also enjoyed the Textbook Cabernet Sauvignon/Cabernet Franc.   For chow we had the butters, mushroom flatbread and sliders. All of it was amazing. My favorite of the butters was definitely the garlic chili though.

WB7yrm93ZaTk8RaGro8v6g.review_text: Been here several times. I would give it a 4.5 if i could.  Love it.  The owners are friendly and personable.  They have a great wine & beer list and are very helpful in making recommendation. The small bites also have never disappointed. The decor is just my style: Warm,  simple and no frills.  One of my favorite cozy spots to go for drink and a light bite. For a local spot- this place is perfect. The only downside is that the place is a bit too small to have a large group. But perfect for an intimate date.

aBZcugzouEXQqd9aKhNwoQ.review_text: This place is generally great in addition to being a great date spot.  My favorite items on the menu are the smoke trout salad and the meat/cheese plate.  The staff are really  friendly and willing to give suggestions if you don't know what you're in the mood for.  They had a delicious triple creme bleu cheese the last time I was there, but their cheese/meat options seem to change fairly frequently.  They have a good beer/wine list so it's a good place to grab drinks after work and then transition into dinner.  The decor is cozy and warm, but it is pretty small, so does get crowded.  I'd call ahead if you're going on a Friday/Saturday.

vez63FREjQp-zsBWOgHwQQ.review_text: The mac n' cheese, endive salad, pretzel with multi grain mustard, and maple bacon butter were all DELICIOUS. The atmosphere is so cozy, and the wine selection was great! I'll definitely be back.

GV7ssHNxpnnY3IGRvKsPDw.review_text: I cannot count the ways in which I love Fat Angel. As a NY transplant, I gave up on finding spots that have that special dark and loungy East Village vibe some time ago. Until one day I went to Fat Angel... They have the perfect combination of atmosphere, music, food, wine, and personable service. Every little detail is in the right place without pretense or stuffiness. Fat Angel is so good I almost want to keep it a secret. Shhhh...

dFl98C7QAz-UmIqaZkgUMA.review_text: Went there last night.  It was quite small, so not much room to squeeze in, but the staff were very friendly and the music was awesome!  It looks like they have quite an impressive list of drink options, but I actually got stuck on the champagne cocktail and liked it so much I didn't try anything else!

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: The most quaint little gastropub!!    Drinks: -- Wines on tap!!! -- Big selection of beers. Their selection of beers on tap change frequently.   -- I ordered a Japanese expresso stout on tap!  Who would have thought that Japan would produce stouts?  And that it would be good?  And that a bar here would have it on tap?! -- LOTS of other stouts available.  (Hey.... I'm really into stouts...)  Greatly enjoyed the food: [[ Chicken Pot Pie ]]- a bowl of delicious filling, generous on the shredded chicken; topped with a thick piece of buttery, flakey, crust. The ratio of filling and crust was perfect for me [[ Flatbread with mushroom & white truffle oil ]] - thin and crispy crust - fresh and light, not greasy [[ Mac n' Cheese ]] - 3 different types of cheese, nice little crusty bits throughout.    My only complaint would be that it gets way too crowded here, even early on a weekday.  Anybody want to join me for early mid-afternoon drinking?

BgWJiGUkeGUqrNvIFYqWPA.review_text: The spiced cider drink was good, the Shit that Killed Elvis was awful (as promised by the name I guess) and never got to eat...waited 1 hr 15 mins and bolted. Place needs more seats, or a cattle prod to get people to eat faster and turnover tables faster. Lame.

IX67eMtJcZRZKP5_6Fi3vQ.review_text: I really liked this place.  5 stars mostly because it really exceeded my expectations.  The wines on tap were a great deal (we even made it just in time for Happy Hour so $2 off a half bottle!), the food was excellent and the staff was laid back and helpful at the same time.  We had the mushroom flatbread (also $2 off for HH), maple bacon butter, 2 meat selections and ceasar salad with roasted chicken.  surprisingly the salad was my favorite.  Don't get me wrong, butter that tastes like breakfast was fantastic, but the roast chicken was cooked so perfectly and the homemade dressing and fried capers really took a typical salad to another level.  I want to come back to just geek out on the wine and beer selection some time!

sBReCygAeC4Jhyihl7uUXQ.review_text: Enjoyed our night out here. Found it on Yelp after attending Sake Day in Japantown nearby. Just a short walk. Was super busy and the hostess quoted us 45 mins. She was spot on. Hung out in the nearby park and they texted us over.   Sat at the bar, would have rather gotten a table but it was still fun. Flavored butter was a must have. We had the lemon sage and caper one, as they were out of the bacon maple, but it was amazing.   Watch out for the spice in the Mac and Cheese. It'll getcha.    Beer list was good. Service was prompt. Food seemed to be geared towards small plates and shareable food. Great for a night out but may want to give it some thought if you want just "dinner".

CyC64TfPa7J2v_Y-u6gqeA.review_text: Stopped in for an after dinner drink. Really nice draft and bottled beer list with local favorites and some other rarer craft beers as well. The place is very small so I was relegated to standing room at the bar. Met some folks who were also out of town (like I was) visiting their son. Food looked scrumptious but I did not have any. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Would love to return for dinner someday.

QET-Q52SjV4JwLvuDz1h0A.review_text: One of the best "old world" beer selections in SF. Knowledgeable staff, great food and exceptional decor. It is a must for the beer-lover.  2 small critiques: (1) the bread that was served with the delicious hand-churned butter was a little stale. (2) the sliders were dope except that the meat was poorly prepared and seemed like cheap meat put onto a gourmet soul slider.  BUT, the smoked trout salad was succulent and the staff was on their game.

8yj6bLmgxjZ42rb67CKM1Q.review_text: Had to wait for a table in the middle of the week at a slightly later hour, which I hate, but the waitress/hostess was nice. I devoured 1/2 the menu since I was so hungry by the time we were seated. Although my excitement was partially influenced by beer and hunger, the food was awesome. Especially the mac and cheese.

Z9bOjahuxvMju3mO3ac9_g.review_text: a very nice, broad selection of wine. nicely lit, pretty cool decorations inside. very friendly owner.  anyway, i tried the malbec, a negrette, a riesling, and some kind of dessert wine. they all were pretty good choices -- the negrette was a bit too heavy for me, and the dessert wine was too sweet.  the bread pudding was pretty good, and the cheese platters and the orange honey butter were pretty delicious too.  will definitely be here a lot.. doesn't hurt that it's right outside my doorstep either.  edit: place is really chill. i always try and bring people here now.

DMwp6ZDmshHRPeQVrYGoqQ.review_text: There's no better place to get fat than at Fat Angel! My girlfriends and I sneaked out of work a little early and got there around 4:30 so we had no problem getting a table. The server was super nice and very informative about the massive wine and beer list. I went with a dry-hopped cider and the girls had a champagne cocktail and a couple of the reds. We loved the selection of charcuterie and pate, served with grained mustard and copious amounts of bread, but let's face it, we came for the flavored butters. We had a hard time deciding which one to try and ended up with the lemon caper sage butter, which was delish! We also got the mac & cheese, which was very good but a bit spicy for me. I couldn't leave without trying the apple bread pudding (I can't leave anywhere that has bread pudding without trying the bread pudding), and it was absolutely amazing! I'm a bit of a bread pudding snob, and this was among the best bread puddings I've ever eaten. And it was HUGE! In fact, all of the portions were huge. We saw another table get a salad we were eyeballing, and it looked fantastic, so I'm looking forward to returning and trying some different stuff on the menu!

f-mz1nBhPJx_J0nSsEwNxw.review_text: This place is amazing! The food is delicious and the beers are unique. My favorite beer was the double chocolate stout! Smooth and Chocolatey! If you don't know what to order just ask the owner. He is super passionate and always has good recommendations!

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: I truly enjoy unpretentious eateries that serve solid food and have a good variety of unique beers and great wines. Fat Angel is exactly that. The place is fairly small, so when we showed up around 7:30pm on a weekday, we were made to wait about 20 minutes. Not a problem as we ordered a drink at the bar, and stood outside, away from the crowds and in the fresh air. When we were seated, we were thanked for our patience, and ordered: +Mac 'n' cheese ($11): with gruyère, aged cheddar, parmigiano-reggiano, it was incredibly good. My date raised his eyebrows at me as I scooped out every last bit of it. No shame in my game. +Meat and cheese plate: we opted for three of the cow cheeses ($5 each, 3 for $14, 6 for $27) and three of the meats: salametto, hot coppa, and Calabrese ($5.25 each, 3 for $15, or 6 for $28). It was served with a sourdough baguette, some fig, grain mustard, and various chutneys. Delicious! (yelp.com/biz_photos/fat-…) +Beer and wine ONLY, but take advantage of the specials on the board, or simply ask for recommendations. They were more than happy to let me sample a few (much appreciated). I chose a tasty pinot and the date opted for a hoppy IPA. Super pleased with the service. A satisfactory meal for about $50? Works for me.

RGgACqNv4zi2kCbNWlVS0w.review_text: I like drinking wine but I am not educated and well versed on it so places like this scare me a little. Luckily my friends that were hosting me for the night come here often. Once we got settled I realized that this place is nothing to be scared of,  it doesn't feel pretentious at all! One friend took the lead on ordering the bottles of wine just by reading their "creative" descriptions that have absolutely nothing to do with wine: one of our bottle descriptions mentioned a tranny's tuck job... hahaha  Food is delicious  the flat bread with mushrooms: yum  sliders: amazing mayo spread with spicy pickles on the side (my fav of the night!)  mac 'n cheese: ooey gooey greatness  pot pie: ehhhhh, although my friends loved it  I would have liked to try the draft wine just so I could say that I've had draft wine  If I could get my bf to SF than I would definitely bring him here on a date!

CrflAVqptP0OKwfsfp8zTw.review_text: Very impressed with the food, service, and beer selection. I recommend the kale salad and mushroom pizza--you won't be disappointed!

9iJOfUH-CiKXA5JM9uXOvg.review_text: Chill vibes...great beers  from Stone Brewery, Mill Valley BrewWorks, and everything in between (on draft).  Typically a ton of selection in bottle as well.  This warm, artisan hole-in-the-wall sits off the edge of the Fillmore District and is a nice escape from the day.  I'm not a huge foodie but check out the selection of cheese and selection of finely sliced meats to go with that Hopageddon Imperial IPA from Napa, CA.

MhqIv4s-tjv0geivhF921w.review_text: Okay so let me say this place is totally cute, the food is good... We were in SF for work and came here on a recommendation from a local.... We were quoted a 30-45 min waited  3.5 hours!   The wait would have been okay if we would have been allowed to sit at the "bar" and order more than olives and nuts but we were told that the bar seating was like a table and we couldn't sit and order... Okay... 3.5 hours later and table turnover on 2 tops that could have been pushed together but were not... A little annoying.  Biggest complaint is lack of foresight by the staff.  The host on duty was relying on 1 table to turnover for 3.5 hours!!!! Have a contingency plan.  By the time we got seated 3.5 hours later after a 30-45 min quote we were all a little frustrated at the lack of leadership.

iK4QagEgn0q30ys4bhBb1A.review_text: One of my limited number of 5 stars for anything.  I love it here.  It is what I would build if I owned a bar.  GREAT beer list.  Smart, knowledgeable, and comfortable.  Food is good and love coming here to hang out but come early for the best spot.

L569rUmLrr37yo1QOdwZqw.review_text: Promising interior and menu but gets a bit drafty inside. I love charcuterie and odd assortments of meats and cheeses generally but was not impressed enough to go back. Good range of beers although I am off the chart because I like malt beers and so not surprised they didn't have any.

KMkc8HcHlqlaiRHfzJhwtw.review_text: Really cute place hidden in a semi-ghetto part of lower fillmore.  Amazing wine list and yummy cheese and charcuterie selection.  It's nice and cozy inside with a bit of front patio seating.  Fun and mellow for happy hour (a bit pricey though)..

d7EOm7WAQfVGnmBSY5pYQg.review_text: This place could easily become a favorite of mine.  Great food, chill atmosphere, and friendly service.  Had the kale salad which was so good I would order it again.  It is also gigantic and absolutely for sharing, as is everything else on the menu.  The mushroom cheese flatbread was perfection and thin like flatbread should be.  The Mac and cheese was also delicious and had a nice kick to it.  They lose a star bc the bread pudding was not good and was clearly microwaved before being served to us.  Skip dessert and you're golden.

tfPC1SmIhXUTZLKMMo9jgQ.review_text: I LOVE GASTROPUBS! There's something about darkened and packed restaurants with cozy yet humbling food that really strikes a chord with me... I think Fat Angel might have been my first SF gastropub foray. I wasn't disappointed!  I came here for pre-show dining before seeing Shabazz Palaces at Yoshi's SF. If you're going to Yoshi's for music, I highly recommend you come here instead of dining at Yoshi's; Yoshi's is overpriced and doesn't taste very good. Fat Angel was only a couple blocks away from the venue.  The wait is a little long, and since the establishment is pretty small, I had to wait outside. There is some bar seating, but I opted for the tables instead. The atmosphere was sexy yet understated, and the noise level was at a comfortable middle between awkward low and overbearing high.  What we had:  Maple bacon butter: As a self-proclaimed butter aficionado, I approve this dish! It reminded me of a buttery reincarnation of Frances' Bacon Beignets. When I ran out of bread, I started eating the butter on its own; NO REGRETS.  Mac n' cheese: I'm not a huge fan of mac n cheese, but since my boyfriend seems to be stuck in fourth grade, we gave it a try. It was AMAZING! They used conchiglie rigate (or what I always refer to affectionately as the "shell pasta", and the dish was served on a cast iron mini-casserole. Yum!  Chicken pot pie: Not as great as the mac n cheese, I'm afraid, but memorable in its own right. If you have never broke the shell on a steaming hot pie with the back of your spoon, you are missing out.  I'll be back for you, Fat Angel.

U0FKyJPwI7aNZEgE4nY_9g.review_text: I don't write on Yelp. Ever. Well, I've got a few cheeky reviews of me being pissed off about restaurants or bars that suck, but never anything that I'm been particularly fond of.   This bar brings warmth into the Fillmore, elevating the quality of venue you should have to survive in this neighborhood. I am extremely happy to have a place I can walk a few steps to and have a local beer.   The first night I went in, I sat and talked to the owners Jason and Cyrick for about 3 hours about their restaurant, and they were not only happy to answer questions about the gastropub like hangout, but more than willing to share about how the bar was built (it contains the inside of an OLD church from Napa) and how they went about selecting a menu, beers, and wines.   Big win. I just don't look forward to the day it's so packed here that I can't get a beer.

FBxhaS2bPmxwT3I8r3CmkQ.review_text: Very decent food, cozy atmosphere, small & quaint place! Do try the Mac & Cheese, and Chicken Pot Pie (not your typical pot pie)! I did not like the duck salami, my friends did, it tasted too greasy and "ducky" for me.

V6le3TWXwigz5l_F4XAHuw.review_text: Tonight was a new and shocking experience for me at Fat Angel. The tatted female "manager" made this evening by far the most unpleasant, degrading dining experience I have ever had.  Even in my college days of sketchy hole-in-the-walls eateries that only broke college students would tolerate in the late night hours with no more than 10 bucks in my pockets did not come close.  It started out well enough. The food is usually good. We actually enjoyed the first two items we ordered tonight. We were even willing to overlook the burnt mushroom flatbread due to our experiences in the past until the "manager" treated us as if we were pandhandling for free food when we informed her that this dish was not of the quality we expected.   "It's wierd that you would eat all of it if you didn't like it!" she mocked as she N0T so gently stacked the dishes and grabbed our forks and knives off the table without our permission.  As a matter of fact, a knife fell off the plate and almost hit my friend.  The waitress who also claims to be the manager did not seem to notice that and did not bother to apologize.  She also did not notice that we only ate half of the flatbread.  The truth is we only ate that first half because we were starving after having to wait for over 30 minutes for it to come out even after reminding three people and didn't want to complain.  It was after we each finished the first piece and tried a bite of the second piece that we realized that it was too dry and overcooked to for us to pretend to enjoy.  When she left the table, my co-workers and I asked each other if this just really happened to us?  Some of us have been going to Fat Angel for years and thinks highly of the establishment and owner. We were quite taken by the attitude of this employee.  She actually returned to our table with the bill and said that she could hear us and that she has taken the flatbread off our bill eventhough once again Ït's wierd that we ate it if we didn't like it!" One of my friends who is a regular there stayed surprisingly calm and stated that we didn't want her to do that, we just wanted to let her know." She interuppted and replied "Yeah, you did. Why would you eat something you didn't like?  So I took it off." As a working professional who works hard for my money and my lifestyle, I was absolutely uphauled!  I have never been so insulted.  We walked away feeling less than pleased!  I would probably not return to Fat Angel for a while; not as long as they keep employees, let alone ""managers" who treat customers that way. Bummer! I used to like the place.

s8nkbQAlrVPfg1u4anGKtw.review_text: Butter. They have multiple kinds of butter. And bread. And wine on draft. And those butters? They're flavored. Lemon caper sage, Garlic chili, Maple bacon, Chocolate cinnamon & Honey.  It's classy, it's sassy and the owner's easy on the eyes and hyperhospitable. It's a little fancier than your average bar but you'd feel comfortable here in something you'd wear to a nice dinner. No need for the little black dress thought it's a perfect date place. After all, if you find a dude you can eat straight butter with, he's probably worth keeping.  They also have cheese plates, fried capers and other apps that look outstanding. Pair them with a hefty pour straight outta the tap and your night is made. This is a place I find myself telling people about again and again. Dear Fat Angel: Please come to Austin.

PJGD7zKksRjePnAIppFoiQ.review_text: My bf and I often pass by this place on our way to quickly's but we never went in because it looked pricey. Tonight we were looking to splurge!   Pros: 1) good portions for the price.  2) Really tasty and refreshing lemonade.   Cons: 1) Inattentive server who gave us attitude when we asked to order drinks while we waited for a table.  2) The restaurant was small and cramped. They put too many seats at the bar so there was very little arm space.  3) There was no ambiance because it was too loud to have a conversation without yelling. 4) I ordered the some salami, hot coppa, and speck. They tasted like grocery store salami. If you want good charcuterie, I recommend adesso in Oakland and boccalone at the ferry building. 5) my bf ordered the chicken potpie. He said that it was bland and that Marie calendars frozen potpie tastes better.   Nothing really stood out here so I wasn't impressed.

0I99ibr1vy7yiHIUdo3Zyw.review_text: Fat Angel is a welcomed addition to the neighborhood, particularly if you're looking for a pre-show drink match up spot with your friends before hitting up The Fillmore.  Beautiful space, friendly staff, convenient location, available parking, delicious eats.... what's not to love?

IGkZa0eanufzVv9FR7kSUg.review_text: Dark and cozy gastropub in the Fillmore Jazz District.   We had an interesting Mint chocolate stout and two other beers I can't remember. Their list is impressive (even a bit intimidating!) so I'd imagine beer/spirits lovers would have a blast! Given that range, there is also a $-$$$, so watch out.   Fat Angel's pot pie came out piping hot--perfect for the two of us to share (especially since we'd just shared a platter of meats). Not too salty (which is often a boon to pot pies) and not too heavy. :) I'm a fan.   We weren't shy about grilling the waitress (out of our ignorance) about the meat options for the chatrucerie board of meats. Do you know what this means?  I actually don't remember what they were anymore, but we went with the Duck Mousse, Hot Copa (pork butt), and one of them that was wild boar..because...boar is awesome!  The meats came out in layered rows, served up with Firebrand sourdough baguette slices and whole grain mustard on a wooden board.   Go, Go, Go!

gji92ao5NAIrb3akKyqTZQ.review_text: For bar food, this spot is great. Try the butters, very yummy, I had the lemon and capers and it was delicious. My friends tried the bacon butter which looked liked foie, and they claimed was finger licken. I'd pass on the flat bread next time or try a different style, we had the mushroom and it was super oily. The Mac N Cheese was very good, not overly cheesy and very peppery which I like. The mousse was ok, bread pudding was more like a cinnamon roll or thick french toast and good. The fact that they have a large beer selection, dessert wines, and a large wine menu for a bar is a definite plus. The decor is hip, love the diverse crowd, it was getting busy when we left at 6pm on a Sunday. Can't wait to return. Hope to see more spots like this in the Fillmore.  Two drinks, a bunch of food, and tip ...3 people, we each paid $40. Could easily have a drink and share a salad and keep it under $30 for the total.

NM8xzqVmP3GcLuc2_INvXQ.review_text: I am going to really hate myself to give away my local hang out but I have to review it because they are so AWESOME.   I been only bringing my close friends here because I am afraid that this place will soon be running over with people not from the neighborhood.  But I want this place to last so I am reviewing it.   They have an excellent list of great wines, many of them are wines that you will probably never heard of and giving your taste buds a good tingle.  The food there albeit very limited is solid and accommodate with the wines that you might order.  The Chicken Pot Pie and the Apple Bread Pudding is to die for.  The owners of Fat Angel (the one I know better is Cyrick)  will take good care of you and understand what you will like to drink and they will remember you.  I didn't go there for two weeks and the owner who I order from only once remember me,  I was thoroughly impressed.  Now this place has now become my hangout place for wine.    So if you are in the Fillmore area for date or a quick drink. This is the place to go!

kORGcgi0Iw2RG8gJl84MVA.review_text: Their salads are huge and their food is satisfying and creative, their beer list comprehensive. I love that they have wine on tap, though I sometimes wish they had a better wine-by-the-glass selection (well, I think the main issue is their selection is  just not really my taste, and I think they could do a good job of bringing in some small production stuff from the central coast, etc, that larger restaurants and bars can't carry due to production limits).  My main beef is just that it's always totally crowded and there is no clear system of organization to get a table, and you can't tell who works there and who doesn't. It's enjoyable if you can swing by on a day when you can instantly get a table and enjoy yourself with some friends.

iCsA9Ak88i6GHHdJ6zJxHg.review_text: This is exactly what Fillmore needed....what a cool spot if you are feeling:   -Great bites & wine pre/post show @ Yoshi's  -Intimate atmosphere before a dance-a-thon @ The Fillmore  -That perfect cozy night that just makes you love San Francisco a little more...   Organs, church pews, fried capers, Pinot, flatbread, and trout salad satisfied by soul....I'll be back again to experiment with their menu.

0lQtq1QIVXXFD4GswV8toA.review_text: Not only is this my favorite neighborhood hang, but its also the best beer bar in San Francisco.  Love the rotating taps and extensive bottle list. Also, can't get enough of their homemade olives - good and garlicky! Great salads, great flatbreads, and yummy meat and cheese plates. A stand out, and one that I look forward to going to each week.

FHe8iR0zF5zt3NSiFyAk7w.review_text: I can't believe i waited so long to try the food at Fat Angel.  They had a good list of beer & wine. And an excellent menu of small plates and comfort foods - i love the combination.  My friend and I shared a salad, mac & cheese and the chicken pot pie - everything was delicious! We were really looking forward to the mac & cheese, which was good. but the chicken pot pie totally stole the show. The chicken is tender and the pot pie crust is thin, crispy and there's a bit of cheese baked on to the crust too..HmmMmmMMmmMm so good!

y4nmzXJbxcT5vsKltFPiRw.review_text: So-  I gave this place another chance after the owner very nicely wrote me and apologized for our negative experience.    I'm very glad that I did...this place is once again awesome in my book!

Bi9pwJu-wpNU_darEkROaQ.review_text: Well-informed and helpful staff in a sophisticated, classy, yet warm and intimate little place. With an extensive, long list of beers and wines, and a unique menu of finger foods and bar snacks, I was lost in the experience and forgot about my date for a second. The possibilities are endless!  What was so delicious: cheese platters with jelly, flat-bread pizza w/ prosciutto, grape, walnut, and Gorgonzola, double IPA (thanks for recommending a great side), and the vibe. I loved all the uncommon ingredients.  Definitely showing some friends this place. Oh, it's nice.

iQ3h131qjlj_dqnnURGdbQ.review_text: We got here while waiting for a table elsewhere, and had a great time sipping Belgian brews, a black IPA and smelling the amazingly looking flatbreads that other tables were having. Staff was friendly and helpful, and seating outside was convenient even as the pub was crowded inside. Will be back!

KUusL15g7gVmPO7_XRp8cQ.review_text: Last night on a spontaneous whim, we arrived at Fat Angel for the second time.  Got their Sangiovese by the glass and was recommended by Derek the bartender to pair it with flat bread. This was Heavenly!!   Loved the combination of roasted red grapes, walnuts, really yummy prosciutto & gorgonzola (which was Not over-powering at all!) Cannot wait to try their other flavors.The flat bread itself was like a thin crust pizza.. perfect with wine or beer because you're not overloaded with carbs after!  Really excited to go back to try their Chicken pot pie (which sadly was sold out when we arrived!) .. as well as their spicy mac & cheese! Just writing this review makes me want to go back NOW! :D

V4unpKMFq8kSHDMw2UW9rQ.review_text: If you're craving beer, wine, and comfort food, look no further than Fat Angel. It will more than deliver on your expectations. My dining partner and I shared some Maple Bacon Butter. It was great; I definitely want to come back to try other flavors like Garlic Chili and Honey. We also got Sliders, a Basil Pesto Flatbread, and a Spicy Mac n' Cheese. This sounds completely unexciting, but everything we tried was really superb. Thanks for the great meal, Fat Angel!

OD6wbZ1jQOW30wYCDD6X3Q.review_text: A GREAT BEER selection for Downtown San Francisco standards. My last two trips to San Francisco have really highlighted the lack of beer selection at the bars, pubs, restaurants, etc. Which I find SO hard to believe! This place is surrounded by incredible breweries (Lagunitas, Bear Republic, Moylan's, Russian River, Mendocino, etc). Are they shipping all their beer to us lucky ducks in Portland who already have an incredible beer scene??? Well I guess... Thank you! But I still want to find good beer in San Francisco.  Thank you Fat Angel for providing me with my first great pint in the city. Fat Angel has 9 Beers on Tap, which vary from local and east coast breweries to beers from Belgium. They also have an elaborate bottled selection. The layout is a bit cozy when sitting at the dining room tables. I always prefer the bar, but they also have some lower bar seating thats right in front of their front window, which opens nicely to beautiful weather. Bartendars were Great and knowledgable. My friend and I decided to order the Wild Mushroom & White Truffle Oil w/pecorino flatbread which was discounted for Happy Hour and it was SO Good! Very thin crust and the mushrooms were incredible! If the rest of the food is as good as the flatbread, I gotta get back and try more of this menu!   Thank you Fat Angel!

0FjQTNMNl7hVK-Zc48X8tQ.review_text: Delicious, lightly peppery zinfandel on tap that can be ordered by the half-bottle. Robust beer (!) menu. Cheese, flatbreads, and luscious butter as appetizers. What's not to love?

eYfqjHibqL8gBzB6tuGuVw.review_text: Is it possible to be in love with a restaurant? I don't even know where to begin, my experience was so good. The ambiance of the place, small, and inviting with candles on each table, reminded me of a tavern I would go to in New England. Our server was friendly without being over bearing, and gave us plenty of time to decide what to order. I had the chicken pot pie with tarragon and a glass of pinot grigio (full size!), and my friend had the mac and cheese with a glass of cab, and throughout dinner the two of us could not decide whose food was more amazing, it was that freaking delicious!  Best of all, the wine and the food were not the normal crazy expensive San Francisco prices.  Looks like I found my new favorite place to eat in San Fran. Can't wait to try the cheese plates next time.

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: Maybe gastropubs aren't my thing, but I didn't think too much of Fat Angel. I had a nice glass of bubbly. It was sweet and light. I enjoyed it. We also got the macaroni and cheese, 3 cheeses, and 3 meats. The meats were far much better than the cheeses. Blue cheese was one of the cheeses I had ordered and it was far too strong for my liking. I would come back again to try something else on the menu.

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: Wow - reading all the reviews I feel like I have to go back and try this place again.    I'll start with the good and end with the blah: location in the hood, extensive wine list, friendly service and the flatbread pizza.  I went here maybe during the first month Fat Angel opened, and both owners were really pleasant and took the time to go over the wine menu with me which is greatly appreciated.  The place is also reasonably priced, which makes it a good place to head to after a long day at work.  That said though, I don't know if I would come back if it wasn't 5 minutes from my house.  I ordered the fried capers and smoked trout salad.  BLAH.  The fish didn't taste right, the capers for some reason had an oddly fishy taste.  I tried the pot pie; I wasn't that impressed but then again, it was my first pot pie so maybe I just don't like that dish.  Another blah point is the decor.  Not a fan - the place isn't cozy, the ambiance feels off and the fixtures (molding, the corners) just doesn't look complete.  The lighting/coloring just isn't pleasant as well.    Anyways, as it's close by and reasonable, I'll head back in the next month to try this place again and re-review if necessary.

_5fFDlrS900UGNF58OkTLQ.review_text: I came here with a group of four on a Saturday night. We had wine, beer and tried the pretzel, cheeses, and one of the pizzas. The food was pretty average and the bar area was a small space. However the service was very good.   If you're looking for a fun, energetic crowd for a group then I wouldn't suggest this place.   If you're looking for a place to drink wine with a significant other this would probably be ok.

3roJp-RoqKVoMgdtuJFM9Q.review_text: CUTE PLACE!  I have always wanted to try this place and I'm glad I did for my bday. Definitely small so try not to go with more than 4! We had 6 ppl, which is doable but pushing it, especially if you are going to be ordering lots of things!  A memorable beer for us was the Witch's Wit! Yummy and light. Chicken pot pie was yummy. Mac n cheese was ok. Flatbreads were yummy, the one with grapes and walnuts was good. we had the meat and cheese platter. good nibble food. maple bacon and philz coffee butter, interesting!  would definitely come again with a group of girls or just the bf!

TLzwLBhPoO33w85VOXz97g.review_text: There was an Angel was always drunk. So he didn't have wings That was why he was a 2nd class  His name was Clarence  So Joseph was like, "Hey Fatso!  You Fatty Angel 2nd class! You are FXXXin' 293 years old with no wing, Goddamn sonofabitch!  So Clarence was like, "What? Are you talking to me? You talking to me? What did you say, Jackass? FXXX off !"  So Joseph said, " I am just sick and tired of seeing your FXXXin' Fat stomach sticking out and drunk like a fish every day. I can't take it anymore. So, Go help Gorge Bailey so I can get you wings. OK? Jackass?"  So Clarence was like, " Oh Shit! I blew it. I wanted stay like this until I get 300 but guess not. OK Jo the Jackass, I'll go down there to jump off from the bridge for the idiot."  So Joseph said, " Go Now! Gorge is ready to jump off!"  That should be what was going on in the original story or behind the scene of " It's a wonderful life."  But our real scene was to celebrate that my GF got a new job. Today was her last "FREE" day Sunday. So we went to see a movie, Midnight in Paris at Kabuki and we loved it. After watchin' great movie together, we always get something to drink. We went to Fat Angel. The place is just wonderful. So many great wines & beers on tap. Yes, wine on tap! We loved this place, small, cozy, clean, price was good, wine was very good, beer was so good, food was good, nice service. We'll be back for sure.    Lower Fillmore is getting better.  Even the Dirty Harry won't say, VFW, very few white disrict anymore.  It's just strange seeing Panda Xpress and Popeye's through the window.

M8STtNrKIrezCnhWxu0c6Q.review_text: Love the ambience, friendly & knowledgeable service and the extensive list of beers.

pKAP3HaZdehkocyWZ_6UTQ.review_text: Brick walls, chandeliers, teeny tiny. Feels like a bit of New Orleans in SF. They were extremely patient accommodating of our large, drunk (coming off of karaoke) group of friends who changed seats and tables like musical chairs (as a former waitress this always makes me cringe).   All I need to say: Butters. There is a category on the menu. For Butters. Get them all. Share. Swoon.

NwP5K-CgOP2IdcL4hqvxUQ.review_text: Great beer list. Great setting. Great cheese plate.

1RDyj80YgQVFyI1fjlpMjA.review_text: Absolutely fabulous. Food was a 10, service was very accommodating and friendly. Wine on draft is a must have and their bottled beer list is very extensive. My wife and I left happy! Best flatbread and best SLIDERS I have ever had.

shkSqT17XGkSc64frKFCbw.review_text: The only reason why I would give this place anything less than 5 stars is because I selfishly want to keep this place to myself. It's an incredible addition to the city, and particularly the Fillmore. They have an impressive selection of wine and even more impressive selection of craft beers from around the world. I always ask either Cy or Jen for a recommendation and it's always spot on. Btw, Cy and Jen are awesome. Good people and great service. The food menu is short but you won't be disappointed with any dish you order. That's guaransheed for all my Rasheed Wallace fans out there. The atmosphere is beautiful. The owners purchased architectural components that previously belonged to a church - notice the organ above the bar, wooden benches along the walls, and golden "fat angel" hanging outside the front. If you're looking for a venue for a date, or low key dinner before going out, or a drink after work, look no further. Rumor has it the owners are looking to open a larger restaurant a half block around the corner on Fillmore. Hope it comes through, they're turning the Fillmore into one of the most desired neighborhoods to live in SF  My favorites on the food menu: Chicken pot pie Chicken caesar salad (comes with fried capers which are delicious and shredded roasted chicken) Sliders (best you'll ever have, trust me)

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: What a great little spot.  Food/drinks are always tasty, the staff is always helpful.  I will admit that the first time there i wasn't a big fan (was mostly due to the draft wine then) however after being there a handful of times, i really enjoy the place.

ZBltO4yUbn333jh0pWoy3Q.review_text: I usually don't give 5 Stars, but I love this place.  The atmosphere is cozy and classy with a wonderful selection of small meals and great wines that make for a wonderful evening.  I've only been here 4 times, but I've been pleased every single time!

uzJv1TmioVGXwuwUeII1dw.review_text: My husband and I stopped in on the way home from work and were pleasantly surprised! We knew to expect good things after seeing the glowing reviews on Yelp, but sometimes you never know.  We lucked out and got there just in time for happy hour! They have deals on wine, beer and their flatbreads. The beer/wine list is very extensive and quite impressive. There's definitely something for everyone!  The flatbreads are awesome. We went with empty stomachs, so one was not enough. We ended up with two! The grape/walnut/bleu cheese was pretty kick ass, the flavors all worked together really well. We also tried the olive/asparagus/pine nut one which was also really yummy. The crust was thin and crispy--just how it should be!  The interior is pretty small (but perfectly quaint!), so get there early to grab a seat! We were able to get a table, but I would have loved to sit at the bar. It was full, maybe next time.

4bRGdwH_be57lglwEbaV6w.review_text: This place just opened about 8 weeks ago and is a real find!  Based on the BACON MAPLE Butter, the PotPie, the Sliders, the BEER! , the Flatbreads, it's just yummmmmmmy!  6 of us went and basically ordered some of everything and shared.  We went at 6:30 on a Thursday night and the place became (by 7:30) packed and hopping.  Knowledgeable staff/owner and good service. We WILL be going back. Oh Yaeh   MAAAAC and CHEEEESE. was good also.  Sliders Rocked!

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: This place is definitely one of the best places I've been to in the city. The location being in the fillmore district and the overall scenery is absolutely great. The place itself is a bit small but has a great atmosphere to it where you don't feel pressured to order more than you really want to and you can take your time catching up with friends.  My roommates and I came here after work one day and we just had a few drink, snacked and enjoyed fillmore street. The waitress was super nice and accommodating. Service with a smile is always appreciated.

iBkzr4A_zMREjXNLBUJd0w.review_text: Excellent beers on tap. You'll never see the same one twice. But you'll love every one you order.

WraI7eUDL7y_onY4jYldWw.review_text: I love this place. It's really small and quaint with a great atmosphere. It definitely sets the mood for either romantic night out or a relaxing meal with a good friend... the kind that reminds you why you moved to San Francisco.   The menu is compact, but the flatbreads are a w e s o m e, and the salads are epic (and, this is coming from someone who doesn't usually like to eat raw greens). Also a great selection of beer.   One thing to watch out for - it's not always easy to get a seat, since I don't think they take reservations and seating is limited. There's outdoor seating, though.   Go, trust me. You'll love it. Your significant other will, too.

pI15RINDqpXIk5492xx7PA.review_text: The food was good so no complaints there but I don't think I ever want to go through the wait for a table here again.   I think I would love Fat Angel more if it was less stressful to get a seat but you can't put in a reservation so you end up just wasting an hour of your life hoping to get seated. There's also no convenient place to wait unless you want to try outside under the heat lamps or if a bar space opens up.  No offense but as nice as Fat Angel is, nothing could tempt me to wait to be seated there again.

Ii2yQ3qHWu9mbF1pzCpGoQ.review_text: Went here with the parents and were sat almost immediately in the window. Lovely interior, great food, amazing beer and wine selection. The staff was friendly, prompt, and helpful answering questions. We ordered the charcuterie plate, pot pie, and the mac and cheese. The charcuterie plate was excellent even for those that were skeptical at first. The pot pie and mac was homecookin' goodness. Hip but not obnoxious a great laid back vibe. We will certainly be back.

Jttbzh-88m_9mly4mNLBlA.review_text: Mac & cheese: 4 stars. I've had a lot of Mac & cheese and this by far was in the top 5. Basil marinara & arugula w/ ricotta flatbread: 2 stars. Eh, not much flavor and wasn't impressed with the flatbread. Chicken pot pie: 3 stars. Pretty flavorful and rich. Bread pudding: 3 stars.  The whipped cream was amazing but the bread pudding itself was not very good. I couldn't get any sense of bread in the pudding. Ambience: sophisticated but also laid back Service: 4 stars. Very attentive but not too attentive that it's overwhelming! I will absolutely come back for the Mac & cheese..

0VYzR15p6G18-2_KCsvuEw.review_text: Stopped by here for some quick drinks before a concert at the Fillmore.  Didn't eat anything here, but loved the organic and fairytale-feel of the atmosphere! Ambiance was magical with their candlelight lighting and delicious aromas from the kitchen.  The spot is quite small with a narrow bar section and closely-arranged tables for diners. This would be a perfect spot for date night or a toned-down girls night with friends.   I do want to give a HUGE 5 stars to the bartender and (seemingly) host who's name is Derek. He's an absolute top-notch bartender here focused on providing high-quality service to ALL customers. He really helped me find the beer that I wanted by letting me taste beer after beer on their tap list--props to you good sir! I also work in the hospitality industry, so I KNOW A GREAT BARTENDER/SERVER when I interact with one.  I'd love to come here for the food next time, and considering the incredible service my friends and I had with Derek, there will be a round 2.

Sz1ChS5E9bCYxaKwnb8Grg.review_text: OK, im obsessed with this place and the fact that its IN my apartment building makes the temptation to go here like every night for a tasty brew with roasted capers, flat bread and glass of vino etc makes for some very difficult decisions when Im trying to go to the gym. Damn you Fat Angel and you're 20s style embiance, tasty beer list and all around awesomeness. Cheers to the staff for knowing there stuff too.

sRjq8IaxHTgOJR0ybhdK_g.review_text: Only came for a couple of drinks.  The atmosphere is great. Server was great.  And selection Wes perfect.

4h6K5CbcCtYhzg7BbVvSew.review_text: We stumbled on this place and will definitely come back thanks to its close proximity to our dwellings.   Dimly lit, quiet, sort of a romantic ambiance.. I could see it as sort of a datey spot. We were there on a Monday night, but I get the feeling it gets pretty busy on other nights. Its sort of a diamond in the rough of the Filmore.  I liked it, but I didn't love it. I got the zin on tap- I was definitely impressed with the quality of wine on tap... I didn't even know wine could be on tap!  we got the chili garlic butter- and then a couple of salads and a pot pie. This place is definitely an order and share things type of place. But our waitress was a little weird and spacey and didn't really give us any sort of low down. The food was ok- I think my friends pot pie was the winner- I had some extreme order envy with my comparatively lame caesar salad.  We decided that we will have to come back and indulge on cheese and butter variations. In general I wasn't super impressed with this place- a little expensive for what it has to offer.

_UYWp3oYG0jxgwENp1JirA.review_text: I consider this to be one of my favorite neighborhood wine bars.  You'd never guess that this little gem existed around the corner from Jubili / Safeway plaza, and what a pleasant surprise it is!  Excellent selection of wines, friendly owners who tend the bar themselves, comfy seating, amazing flatbread and macaroni & cheese.  It's definitely a place I can spend a few hours lounging around.  I'm so glad it's within walking distance from my place!

CgfCocwpIui_MCFnupTryA.review_text: With only one table taken in the entire restaurant, the host would only let us sit by the door, which was open, on a very cold day. I asked again, because I was really cold, and he said that was the only table for 3 he had and it was a very popular place, so they wouldn't be able to accommodate us. It was 5:30pm, and I'm sure we would've finished eating before their claimed rush would come in...

nM1Ldn0n4zdv8kl0K8sXDQ.review_text: This place has become my favorite spot in the city for wine and hanging out.  We come here a lot before shows at the Fillmore or seeing a movie at Kabuki.  The staff is incredibly nice, and even though the place is always packed they sure do hustle to try and make things quick.  I don't know if I want to tell anyone the trick to getting a table, but just... go early.  Around 6:30, the place fills up and people stay for hours so you probably won't get a table unless you're willing to stand around for a long time.    My favorites: - Sauv. Blanc on draft - yummy and comes in at a mere $5.50 during happy hour! - Mac and Cheese - Chicken Pot Pie - Happy boyfriend because there are so many good beers, which means that I get to go here more often and drink wine! (Seriously, I'm not sure why more places in the city don't cater to couples like us, where one is a beer enthusiast and the other a wine-o)

x-atBFOzcuGbLJEp10HzqA.review_text: This fat angel is stripped down, raw and unpretentious~   The interior design has a subtle warmth that welcomes the casual person to the most scrutinizing client.   You can see that everything was well thought out and carefully selected for a casual wine tasting experience.  From the floors that are roughed up plank wood to the unfinished wall sconces and antique chandeliers you can see how deliberate their choices are.  Carrying the upscale casual feeling  even to the small menu that consist of simple items that work well with wines. The flat bread is out of this world and you will never look at sliders the same once you try this fat little angel's little yummies!  The service amazing, probably because were being served my one of the owners. He too, was warm and welcoming.  He took the time to share the knowledge he has regarding wine without taking to much time from us.  There are 38 wines and 2 on tap that rotate out...   *** Oh Yah,  Did I mention wine on TAP?***  This is a new wonderful wine pub that I wish  the very best for them and hope they succeed... My friend was right when she said this place has my name written all over it... It was truly a great experience! JOB WELL DONE!  A+  in my book

swqPgaC_wLtmVbCYxIpOqw.review_text: Delicious little gem hidden in Lower Fillmore! HUGE selection of artisanal beers from all over the world, great food including soft pretzels, flatbread pizzas, mac and cheese, etc.

BSVThVjjFaF5orzkW7Of7Q.review_text: Fat Angel is a good place to just lay back, relax, and drink some wine. The place has a rather romantic atmosphere, and would be a good place to bring a date.   They have an amazing selection of beer and wine there, and the one I picked (Riesling) was nothing short of terrific. I had a good evening overall, and would come back to this place if I'm ever in the area.  The service was decent. The food and drinks here are a little pricey, however, but I would say it's reasonable given the nice atmosphere.

luANxha4t1De1ZXSthwOug.review_text: Very nice friendly staff (i think owners). Great wines, cheeses, meats and pizzas!  The atmosphere was perfect too, we went on a Thursday night.

1-t0BIYYSrmvkjEXpXWfuw.review_text: 9 of us walked-in to the Fat Angel Sunday night at 5pm. The staff let us know we were welcome and that they could accommodate our group - a respectful group who in 90- minutes was headed to Yoshi's for a 7 o'clock comedy show. All orders were placed with the wait staff within five minutes of one another. During the next 90 minutes, half of our party was served and had finished eating two highly explosively spiced mac and cheeses, with no menu warning) the other three Mac and cheese dinners showed up equally explosive an hour later, when it was past time to be leaving for Yoshi's. Salads arrived to no one in particular- that was left for us to sort out. Among the original order we placed  five plates of sliders. Four arrived during the last15 minutes and the "no onions" order arrived with five minutes to spare.  In courteous frustration, mid meal time, I did speak up to wait staff to explain that our aim of dining out together was missing the mark, as five of us were finished, and four had not yet seen any plates of food at all.   A gentleman arrived, and addressed our table and apologized for our missed meals due to the fact that they were working with just one chef. It occurred to us all simultaneously that warning us of lack of cooks when we walked in the door would had honored our time, money, and the joy of sharing food with friends and family - something The Fat Angel Staff staff does not consider of value.  For our trouble, they comped one drink and one order of sliders which I passed around the table - time being what it was. TFC hardly made a a genuine attempt to compensate for five half- eaten meals and the lost patronage from a group of people who appreciate inventive, tasty, food served properly

Lah9iW-kefklTZRBx3xdIQ.review_text: Draft wine?  Delicious and ecofriendly, gotta love it. The Free Flow sauvignon blanc was light and very refreshing and just what I needed after my bike ride to the fillmore district.  I convoluted my order and received a glass instead of a bottle of the wine, and the owner immediately comped my glass. Then we moved to a table and shared the wild boar and some maple bacon butter and bread to top the experience off.  The table service was fantastic and the decor is phenomenal.  I'll definitely be back.

notPJ9iEf1aw_wuu_4fsdg.review_text: Fat Angel is a craft beer gastropub that is the perfect blend of artisan fanciness and casual garage grunge. It's difficult to describe, but very pleasant to experience.  The list of craft beers, both bottled and on tap, is phenomenal. Being an avid IPA drinker, I was blown away by the IPA selection here -- ordering three different IPAs and loving each one. I can't wait to try all of the beers here; challenge accepted.  The food is definitely better than your average gastropub, but nothing amazing.  -------------------- FOOD:  Flatbread w/ Mushroom & Truffle Oil: This is a dish that's excellent upon first bite, but gets progressively worse as time cools the cheese. I mean, you can't really go wrong with mushroom and truffle oil on anything, so the taste was definitely there. When the cheese hardens, however, it just tastes stale. Sidenote: I spread some duck liver mousse on it and it was incredible.  Pretzel: It was okay. I wish there was another sauce than mustard.  Cheese Plate w/ Duck Liver Mousse: The duck liver mousse was excellent. When spread upon the bread (or the flatbread), it gave me a faint glimpse of what I loved most about foie gras before the ban.   --------------------  Fat Angel is an excellent joint for beer enthusiasts. If you love craft beers, then you really can't go wrong with this place. Even if you're a craft beer newbie, the knowledgeable and friendly bartenders here will lead you in the right direction. If you're not a beer lover and you're looking for excellent gastropub fare, you may be disappointed.

E-ws0CUwkAYlv5JEfRr9mA.review_text: FAT FAT Angles will sing to you when you dine at this glorious neighborhood establishment, just opened by two very enthusiastic and energetic young gentlemen. The sound of these angels was in the food my friends, as you will see and experience it when you dine here. Service is 5 Stars !! This duo will make sure every part of your dining experience is truly amazing. Be prepared for a feast. Fat Angel is definitely one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants. I'm becoming a regular here since it's very close to where I live.  Must Try: Caesar Salad - I hope they maintain the size, it's huge. If you love Pork like I do, try all pork and meats !! We tried the duck  also- delicious The Flat breads are excellent too. It said on their blackboard the other day:  "Wine is the drink of the Gods, Milk is the drink of babies, And water is the drink of the Devil"   My girl trusts me, it's the devil inside me that she doesn't trust. But when I drink the drink of the Gods, the devil inside me suddenly wakes up. weird.  I wish these guys all the best and good fortune. Welcome to the mo'

llv82wOgwY1UePkjhyNQ2w.review_text: Awesome little hole in the wall, just off the main roads of San Francisco. Came here with a friend to try it out, was amazing, decided to come back with the girlfriend. Ended up coming here on a Friday night around 7:30 and pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to wait more than 15 minutes to get seated. Would've expected some insane wait time,  but the staff was super friendly and we got a drink while we waited.  Positives: Food was AWESOME, get the chicken pot pie. It'll fill you up and tastes amazing! Aside from that, all their little meat and cheese dishes are fabulously paired with jams and mustard to provide an incredible tasting meal. Ask the waiter for his/her opinion, and just trust them if you can't figure out what you want. Staff is super friendly, one of those small businesses where every customer is precious to them, and it shows. Atmosphere is romantic, great for a date.  Con: It's a bit small. There's something like space for 20-25 people, and the place can get a little cramped. But really... being a small cozy romantic restaurant can be a nice change of pace. Not going to take away a star just because their business is so good that it's a little hard to move around. Just know that it's going to be a little cramped if you go on a busy night.

mqul5PvFQzuWuXSypgmvdw.review_text: I have heard about this place from friends so I decided to check it out. I had the slider mini burgers. Hands down the best sliders I've ever tasted. I suggest if you go, this is a must-try item. I also got to try the homemade chicken pot pie and the mushroom flat bread. Needless to say, my tastebuds were pleased! I'm not a big fan of wine so the owner helped me pair my meal with a glass. They are down-to-earth, friendly and patient people. Did I mention very knowledgeable about their food and wines? Here is my rating broken down: 1st star- excellent customer service 2nd star- place is kept clean and very nicely decorated 3rd star- seated promptly & wait time for food was fast 4th star- GREAT FOOD!! 5th star- unique. easy parking. definitely coming back!

xnlVxgrLP5HgaKZobRuHZA.review_text: Came here before a show at the Fillmore. Advice: don't come here if you have anywhere to be, because 1. the wait takes forever and 2. you'll want to stay and appreciate the drinks, food and atmosphere for as long as possible.  We put our name on the list and a seat at the end of the bar opened up, so I sat and my boyfriend stood next to me at the corner end of the bar to wait it out. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. They knew everything about every beer they had. It was kind of overwhelming just how many there are. Sounds like the rotate them out regularly. Also, the menu is printed daily, which leads me to believe the menu is also rotated, but based on previous reviews, it looks like they have some signatures.   So, we decided to order at the bar. TRY THE SLIDERS. Literally best mini burger I've ever had. If there's even a chance you might not want to share, just add the extras for $3. Also tried the bacon butter (it was ok, my date loved it) and the capers (perfect alternative to mixed nuts on the bar). I MUST come back to try some of the charcuterie and every single one of the salads. We just didn't have time this time around!  Right as we were paying the bill, they called out name to be seated. They had said 25 minutes or less, which was obviously an optimistic guess, but it was ok because I was glad we got to eat there and weren't late for the show!

OUDaJuPhq5dHi6XRPAGTCg.review_text: Really a hidden gem.  If Fat Angel was located in SOMA or the Mission I'm sure there'd be a line out the door, but unusual spot of Fillmore mostly keeps the crowd to those in surrounding neighborhoods.  It's a great place to stop in for some cheese, sausage and fine Belgian beers.

M19NwFwAXKRZzt8koF11hQ.review_text: (See pics)  Review #1094.  A good place to come by for a pre-dinner drink and / or snacks when you are in the area. Or if you just ate and want somewhere to go and chill.  We were waiting for our walk-in table at State Bird so we decided to grab a glass of wine and some appetizers here. They have a good selection of wines and a variety of cured meats and smaller dishes.  The vibe was casual and the place was quite busy. A small place but with enough tables and chairs in addition to a bar seating area and a few outside seats) that are in the back of the street makes it a great place to avoid all the foot traffic outside but bustling inside.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: Fat Angel has one of those names where you sort of want to go just because it's called Fat Angel. Like, what type of product does a place called Fat Angel serve? Since I've recently become a developing bourbon connoisseur, now whenever I think of angels and a gastropub, I think of "angel's share" which is a term that describes the evaporated liquid of processing bourbon in a barrel (before it's ultimately bottled after however long it stays in a barrel). Because of this knowledge, I thought this might be a bourbon joint. It's actually a wine bar.  This is a small joint that doesn't get crowded right away, but usually does about an hour and a half into the restaurants opening. So, if you can't get a table at State Bird Provisions around the corner, this is an alternative for some people who want to eat ASAP.  The macaroni and cheese is amazing. The crumbs on top make the dish 3 times better. This is the only dish of food I tried. The other dishes on the menu sounded amazing though.  The drinks are expensive so don't binge here (a beer might cost you $10). I ordered this one sour bourbon beer and it clearly said it was $8 on the chalkboard but the bartender charged me $10. He fixed it for me but it's always annoying when that happens.  Overall, nice place to grab a drink before heading off to do something else on Fillmore.

S7zVbmIA1MHaTBqoZ6x8-Q.review_text: This place is a GEM.  First of all, totally inconspicuous on the outside, not to mention off the beaten path of Fillmore. I had no idea a place this cute and hip was even in this area of Fillmore!  They have tables outside, but it was too cold, so we sat inside at the bar. The decor is beautiful. The bar stools were made from old tractor seats, so they are heavy duty metal. They look really cool. The bar is marble and there is an awesome chandelier hanging over it. Additionally, there is a super cool moosehead on the wall too. Hunting cabin chic.  They have wine and beer on tap, in addition to many bottles of each. They don't appear to have liquor, although they had a Lillet cocktail (is Lillet a liquor?). We opted for a half bottle of the Cab Sauv on tap, which came it what looked like an old soda bottle. All the water bottles are reused wine bottles too--I love the green-ness!  Wine was so good we ordered another bottle! And they have delicious munchies too!  We ordered the mushroom flatbread with truffle oil and parmesan (I think it was parm...). SO good. We also ordered a cheese plate--$5 for one cheese and it comes with bread slices, honey/jam, and these salty-sweet nuts. Food was prompt and yummy. Too bad I wasn't more hungry--they had some amazing other dishes: other flatbreads, mac and cheese, and pot pie!  We got there around 5 and it was empty, but filled up quick! It was packed by 6:30.   The two guys working the place (I think are the owners) were very attentive and friendly. You can tell they really love what they do.  I fell in love with Fat Angel...it truly is a gem in the Fillmore.

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: My friend and I grabbed a quick dinner here on a Sunday night. It was still pretty crowded, so we sat at the bar. I got the wild mushroom and truffle flatbread with pecorino and he got the mac 'n' cheese. The food was just okay--the flatbread was over-baked and too hard, and the mac 'n' cheese had way too much paprika or whatever was on top. The service was friendly but inattentive--we had to wait quite a while for our bill, despite sitting right at the bar. The noise was also a tad loud even with the windows open. Overall, glad I gave it a shot, but I think the greatness was lost on me since I didn't order anything to drink.

UXCbdc_Tksomv3bORw38sw.review_text: I contemplated my review for a few days after visiting Fat Angel - for a few reasons...couldn't decide if I loved it or not...
