Here are the pro's:   -delicious, draft wine  -SLIDERS - they are AMAZING  -nice decor   Here are the con's:   -waited 60 minutes for a table after being told it'd be 15-minute wait  -pricey 'house' wine - $11/glass  -very small - not recommended for a large party   I'm glad I visited - but not sure if I'd visit again, mainly because it is so small and hard to get service. As others mentioned, the more popular it becomes, the harder it will be to get a seat.

U_-asDknLBGg5C4biz1iyQ.review_text: this place is GREAT !!! i realize the menu is limited... but the wine list is NOT !!!  AWESOME mac'n'cheese !  the butter is LEGIT !  ...awwww mannn!  the owners are SUPER humble !  LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT ! LOVE IT !   TEN STARS !!!  crazy thing ... i don't even live in the city!

A5PqLu1bVHd3uWYJoK9gsA.review_text: 1. Great selection (see their website and make sure to check out the ridiculous descriptions)   2. Friendly and knowledgable staff  3. Chocolate butter?! What? Love it!  4. Warm and intimate ambiance  5. Classy place for a date or friend meet-up

WDsr8RnPqbceR3s2yZYr3Q.review_text: Yeah it's kinda awesome.  They have a massive beer selection and miniscule amounts of seating, which makes you wonder if this place isn't in fact a giant beer storage facility with a small dining room attached.    And a nice dining room it is!  Cozy, dimly lit, check the photos, you get the idea.  Anyway, I had the Brontide, which is a smokey dark saison that was very well balanced and generally wonderful.  Also their big pretzel is a classic to accompany anything.  Will definitely be back.

3hWhXTkU83jsm3jIA-rkIg.review_text: YUM YUM YUM! I just moved to San Francisco this past weekend and Fat Angle is probably one of my favorite places to eat thus far! Located just across the street from my apartment it is very convenient for me to eat there.  They have a great selection of beer! Organized by type, some of these bottles can get quite pricey $30+ so be careful when ordering. But if you like beer they are sure to have something you like!  The food is delicious!  They have a small menu, so in the few times I've been I have been able to try a majority of the items:  Flavored Butters, Cheese, and Meats served with bread -- Almost like a charcuterie platter. It all comes out together on a platter served with bread. I loved the meats and cheeses. Awesome quality and the saltiness goes well when drinking.  Chicken Pot Pie - Delicious! A bowl filled with creamy chicken and veggies (carrots and peas) topped with a crispy crust. Not too doughy since the crust isn't completely surrounding the pie.  Burger Sliders -- My favorite thing here! Juicy meat with some amazing aioli. Also goes great with the pickled jalapenos which are served on the side.  Mac n' Cheese - Cheesy with a kick. The heat seems to linger for awhile, but it is so good.  Flat Breads - Extremely thin crust! Thin and crispy!  Great place to grab some beers and delicious food. My only complaint is that the restaurant is really small, so sometimes the wait can be long.

4XpJ4HKD5OQ3H5Gy330CkA.review_text: W(h)ine after work (clever happy hour ploy) is perfect at Fat Angel! Not a huge venue, but its coziness and warmth adds charm to this wine bar in the Western Addition. Their happy hour specials are decent--$1 off draft wines and draft beers and $2 off flatbreads.   Never having tried wine on draft, my companion and I ordered a draft cabernet and a pinot noir, respectively. We both enjoyed them...enough to order another. In addition, we ordered the mac 'n cheese and the wild mushroom and white truffle oil with pecorino cheese flat bread. The mac 'n cheese, while was delicious, both admitted to having had better, as theirs lacked a richness. The flatbread was just the right amount of crispness, and ingredients were fresh and very present. I'd definitely order that again.   Staff was friendly and attentive; coming by our table just the right amount of times where we didn't feel neglected nor annoyed. Wine list was extensive (by the glass and bottle), as was the beer list. Prices were moderate; glasses ranging from $8 (whites) - $13. Ambiance is chill and relaxing; perfect for catching up with a friend, a romantic date (lighting is dim), or group outing (though again, the venue isn't huge).   I'm a fan, and I'll likely go again as I enjoyed the wine and food, ambiance and service. Great addition to the Western Addition!

MFOuCaxi1857wiPX2n3mRQ.review_text: from two visits.... Great drink options, including wines and lots of unusual beers. Interesting, tasty bar food options, but small portions for the price. Friendly and knowledgeable bar staff. It is tiny and cozy inside, so you may have to wait.  There is outdoor seating, but it can be chilly.  Bring a lap blanket and you are good!

uUVZJm9yxNl5FBsXbt4WBg.review_text: ***Warning the race card will be used***  So if you get all butt hurt about cultural honesty, perhaps you move it to the left...?  In July of 2010, I stumbled into this bar with 90 minutes to spare prior to series of spa treatment appointments at Kabuki. I went in for a glass of wine and peace of mind. The day was cray and I was the hottest of messes! I should also add that it was 3pm in the afternoon, July 1st and as a social worker I had spent the entire day in the TL...and I looked like I did too! So I walk in, looking like a vagrant. I'm Black in a rapidly gentrifying area.  And I was already livid at the effort it took to get a cab to the area (As cabbies saw me, perhaps thinking I was a junkie, or money less scammer and would pass me by) So I'm thinking...there is no way I'm going to get great service, as...well....our White brothers and sisters see what the choose to see sometimes.....and often it lacks accuracy or the whole story...  However, I walked in with all the disheveled entitlement of a bag lady needing a drank...and got superb service from the chick bartender(who herself disclosed an interest psych/social welfare)...tried an amazing Red wine from Argentina, and had land meat for the first time in 4+ yrs when the Free range Sliders were explained as one of their choice dishes (my digestive track is still pissed about it however). I started coming here monthly.  I love this place....there can be some hipster attitude, but is usually minimum at best.   I took my partner last night and we sit down to a meal and spend 90 bucks.....but totally worth it... The trout salad and fried polenta is to die for....I have spent hours here just trying the ales.... Keep up the great work Fat Angel...and thanx for always treating me well; Doo Rag, or 'Hair Did'!!

5LU5tH8fP43nd3JMfvm7yA.review_text: This place is so cute and cozy that I didn't want to leave. The lighting and decor is so inviting and festive! They have a pretty good wine list which I was happy about.... their beer list is a good too for you beer lovers out there. The service was great and I was glad to see that the staff had some wine knowledge. Too many times I've been to wine bars and the staff have zero knowledge about their products! We didn't have any food so I really can't comment on that, however, I saw some of the food coming out and it looked GOOD!

tLdB60s3XvQdDc0lEqaIQQ.review_text: What a gem this place is! It's right off of the main strip. It has a great, edited draft beer menu as well as draft wine, the wine I didn't get to try. The server/bartender was knowledgable about the beer, friendly and prompt with service. The flatbreads were tasty. And I even liked their whimsical menu.

jbxoZuPAAuSHLk0XawFf1g.review_text: Classy yet relaxed atmosphere... unexpected for the location. Wine on tap! Tasty sliders! The biggest ceasar salad I've seen in my entire life! Take a seat and enjoy...

epIp3mfCqrtGGsKAcbsdBg.review_text: Been here twice - one of my favorites so far in the city and the best place to go to after a movie at the Sundance Kabuki. Sampled quite a few of the draft wines and tasted the cheese and meat platters - all delicious.

Ay0EvOQjbaOJcL77kF7VPQ.review_text: This heavenly boîte tucked away in the Fillmore Center is a recent discovery, having been recommended by a foodie friend of mine who loves FA's mac & cheese.  Yummy!  For me, what stands out about FA's mac & cheese is that it's made with Gruyère, topped with toasted bread crumbs and comes out sizzling in a cast iron casserole.  The portion is large enough for two, so one can try other things on their limited menu.  I was in a group of 4 in my first visit and along with the mac & cheese, we had their sliders, flat bread and a nice bottle of reasonably priced red wine.  All of us had a wonderful time!  On a return visit with a friend, we sat at the bar had very good wine from the tap and shared FA's chicken pot pie and a frisée salad.  The salad could easily have fed 4.  The pot pie portion was huge, too, but both of us agreed that it was too heavy.  It's more in the style of a shepherd's pie--too thick and potatoey.  I much prefer a creamier pie that one can spike with a shot of sherry.  The Big Four still ranks as my personal favorite for pot pie.  The Fat Angel, having just celebrated their first anniversary, attracts an attractive, young, hip crowd probably more into FA's very good beer list than their wines.  I find the decor very attactive--done up with the fixtures of an old church.  Organ pipes line the wall behind the bar and pews serve as banquettes.  Sit long enough at the bar with a few glasses of wine and one can easily think of Christine Daaé being serenaded by the Phantom!

AIjA_jJQyAhoxtYd335Ekg.review_text: This is a gastropub, so there are certain things you expect.  1. Decor that is en pointe, but odd/industrial enough to seem edgy.  Doll arm coat hangers = check!  2. Food that is basic but flavorful, and with enough twist to (again) seem edgy.  French bread with flavored butter (maple bacon, Philz coffee, etc) = check!  3. Delicious hand crafted cocktails served at higher prices than the size/effort warrants.  Pimm's Cup = check!  4. Waiting for a table, even at a seemingly non-traditional time.  45 minute wait = check!  At least they text you when your table is ready so you can either enjoy their bar (more Pimm's, please!) or walk around the area and view other establishments.  This was a great place.  The food isn't hugely filling for the price point, but you can order lots, feel rich, and semi-full.  A great evening all around.

p-rz5nElTuSyUV1Dzui6Yg.review_text: Hmmm...what actually made it to the table was good...it was just not satisfying as a meal. We ordered cheese and meat and then a pot pie to split. The cheese and meat came. Had to go to the counter 3 times to ask for stuff and only the bread came. Meaning  Ordered 2nd glass of wine twice, entree never even came. Had to go to the counter and ask for the bill with no pot pie since it never came. Both the entree and the wine didn't come... until we asked for the check and then suddenly wine orders were fulfilled and you could find the waitress.   When we ordered there were 2 others in the restaurant. The people next to us who arrived during our charcuterie got their meal...as well as half of the other people who came in after us.  Food and wine is good if you get some. The service is going to kill this business.

2Yg3D3xUNNzmn-SicXZOnA.review_text: Fat Angel is pretty packed and crammed when packed with outdoor and bar seating. The ambiance is nice and lively though. Their alcohol, especially beer selection is amazing and wine on tap sounds super cool!   The food is just okay though, typical wine/bar food. I tried the Maple Bacon Butter, which is smokey and delicious but the bread that just comes with it was disappointing. It crumbles when spreading the butter on top of it. I also had the Wild Mushroom & Truffle Oil Flat Bread--super earthy and salty. The flatbread was a bit too dry like cracker. The Mac n' Cheese smells and tastes super cheesy. It as yummy!

KxsmqQlZNeJyisYMH5xHNQ.review_text: The food is ok, but the drink menu is extensive. I tried the maple bacon butter, wild mushroom and truffle oil flatbread with pecorino cheese, and the chorizo meat platter. My favorite was the butter.  Service was ok - they forgot the meat platter. But the wait staff generally don't bother you - you could chat with your friends for hours, and you won't get kicked out.

p7GcbNJav26_VnZKvW5tHw.review_text: Second time here and it's still great. Definitely a small place for a small group of people. The focus here is mostly on the libations part... Obviously from the name :) The food is pretty good though (just a bit on the expensive side for what you get). Even though it is pricey, it's worth it to get a couple of the small plates (especially the meats and cheeses) since it pairs really well with the drinks. Also, keep in mind, the menu changes every now and then, so it's kind of a different experience (at least from the two times I've been there).  They have a bunch of beers on tap and a vast selection of wine and bottled beer. They have everything from cheap to like... almost $72 for a bottle of beer (didn't really pay attention to the wines because we weren't really there for wine). The second time I've went here, we had just gotten out of a very beery brunch at 21st Amendment, so we didn't really order much alcohol; only Drake's 2013 Jolly Rodger Imperial American Black Ale (how awesome is that name). It was the last bottle though... but damn that was good. Highly recommend it... if you can find it somewhere else XD  We ordered the lemon caper sage butter (maple bacon is better), sliders (meh), mac and cheese (yum!), and a meat plate with salchichon, two slices of duck liver pâté ('cause we're so fancy), speck, duck salami, and truffled wild boar. The meat plate was definitely better this time around (don't remember the last one we had), and you get a brown bag filled to the brim with bread (which is crazy yummy). The meat plate also comes with a great mustard which brings it all together. Would definitely avoid the sliders though... came out a little soggy... and honestly not very unique/flavorful. The mac and cheese comes in a tiny little cast iron with these awesome breadcrumbs on top.  I like this place for the random selection and the chill atmosphere. Luckily the second time we went, it was waaaaaaaaaaay quieter (we were the only ones in the resturant, minus some of the tables outside) and it was great to hang out with a couple friends. It did start to fill up a little bit by 6 pm (halfish full) but by then we were pretty sated and happy.  Would come back, would recommend, but really the attraction here is the drink! The staff is super friendly too. Definitely has hipster written all over it :D

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: First of all, the apple bread pudding is a must order!! I'm a big fan of bread puddings and this could possibly be the best I've ever had. There's speculation at our table that the bread in the pudding is actually (gasp...) donuts!! Regardless of what it was, we (or I) devoured it.  We also got the endive salad and the flatbread. The flatbread had great flavor and the ingredients married perfectly; the only suggestion that I would make would be use a focaccia or actual pizza dough instead of the almost cracker like "flat bread". We also enjoyed the salad.   The place was rather crowded and it took us around 45 minutes before we got a table. They really need to put some heat lamps outside and maybe a happy hour menu. All in all, I liked the atmosphere and the large wine/beer selection.

4Y81J2Tdq5XAnkeYmCZ2ow.review_text: Even better than I remembered! The grape, gorgonzola, walnut, proscuitto flatbread is heaven on a wooden platter (made by a fat angel, of course!) A great match for my herbal beer from Mill Valley, or the draught Pinot Noir that followed.   You could plop this place in Portland and no one would bat an eye. It's got that antiquey, hunter's lodge meets grandpa's library feel to it. And the music is always right on, sexy and soulful just like the wines.   Our waitress was fantastic too! There is something really special about never having an empty glass, and she made this happen even with a full house to manage. Fat Angel to the rescue!

sqXHWa4C8zarwdxUuDF9PA.review_text: HANDS DOWN best service I've ever had!  The BF and I had just got done biking the golden gate bridge... and we were craving some good food and drinks... put back on those calories we had just pedaled away.   Of course SF was freeeeezing! But as soon as we got inside - we were warmed up! Not too hot, just perfect! We got lucky! The house was full - but a minute after we arrived a couple had just left so we scored some good seats!  I started off with the Riesling. A nice light fruity crisp wine. Yummy yummy. After 2 glasses I was definitely feeling warmer!  We ordered the Firebrand sourdough baguettes with cheese & meat. The platter came with spicy mustard, some fancy smancy jellies and sauces, and nuts. The server was so nice! I had no idea about the types of meats - I don't normally eat this type of food. But I'll definitely start! He gave us a break down of each type of meat, how it was seasoned and processed!   We went with: CHEESE:  Vella Dry Jack   hard cow Roaring Forties Blue   semi-soft cow  MEAT: Salami Hot Copa  AND on top of that! The server felt bad because our plate was accidentally given to someone else (we didn't even feel the wait was that long). SO he hooked us up with another cheese and meat on the house!  Chorizo Truffle Tremor  soft goat  The Vella Dry Jack was my favorite! It was dry, but in a good way! The truffle tremor was good too! A bit strong, but very tasty! Especially paired with the yummy sauces  and the spices in the meats! I loved all the meat! It felt like so much food! But we ate pretty much all of it!  I was planning on this being a starter, but I was so full! We ordered the chicken pot pie as our main entree - and as soon as we got the dish I had to make room for it. A different take on the traditional dish. It was served in a bowl - so it had the appearance of soup - with a square shaped crust placed on top. But with a nice surprise! As you eat the dish - you will find more crust on the bottom and sides of the bowl! The crust is my favorite part, so I was happy! Yummy chicken - thick soups full of veggies, carrots, sherry, & tarragon.  Once we were absolutely full we hung out. Finished our drinks. It was really nice. The setting was perfect! I wouldn't have wanted to spend my last night any other way. I wish we had one of these places in Hawaii. Great for intimate settings - or just to hang out and catch up with the friends. Warm, cozy, clean, nicely decorated. Part of the drop ceiling had beautiful copper tiles with chandeliers hanging from it. There were lots of different types of lighting,  chandeliers, candles, track lighting: the combo of all of them spot on!  I'll admit the drinks were a bit pricey. But not too bad & the experience I had made it all worth it.   I definitely recommend it!

Mk2wBq7175hxUYuFIJpBpA.review_text: 5 stars for ambiance   Soooo cozy and nice on the inside! But too busy to seat our group of 6 indoors, so we sat outside.   5 stars for service.   The waitstaff was super friendly!  4 stars for food  Mac and cheese is okay, but certainly not the best this connoisseur has ever had. Sliders were amazeballs. Pot pie excellent, with strong notes of tarragon. Flatbreads pretty good with intense flavors.

ltfsBefhwBH4K_dnUyGucg.review_text: Good wine and food.  Great place to go or a late night drink and cheese platter. Very solid wine on tap.  I'll have to try more on the menu and update my review.

z76mIl-fEHc7sd1YvyBAjA.review_text: Living in the Fillmore district, Fat Angel is my go-to place when I just want to grab a drink(beer/wine) during the week and just want to relax and chill. It is a very nice intimate place which serves a good collection of wine and even better collection of beers.   The place is tiny and generally fairly crowded. So, there might be a wait but the ambiance is top-notch and the staff is friendly and nice. It is a fairly expensive place but very good to go for a drink or two.   P.S. get their fries!!!!

h3ezsB1D7N3YwMt67eXAjg.review_text: Let me start by saying that Fat Angel has great food, beer, and a very friendly staff--if you ever have a chance to meet them.  They seem to be overwhelmed by the popularity of their place and are understaffed to deal with the scads of people trying to patronize the place.  Good luck trying to find a seat and getting served.  Oh yeah, the beer selection is exceptional, though we could only get served one drink in the time given.  We both had flat breads (I had duck sausage, Luann had a lemon butter) and though I ordered a mac' n cheese they delivered a chicken pot pie my wife ordered the sliders.  The food was all comp'd because they got the order wrong, but admittedly it was delicious.  If not for the service, I'd probably give them 4 stars.  They have a good idea, they just need to figure out execution part.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: I was looking up places to check out after the Yelp event at Yoshis...and came across Fat Angel. I saw the positive reviews but what really caught my eye were the wines on draft...whoa? That sealed the deal. We strolled up around 7ish on a Sunday..the place was still pretty quiet. The decor and setting is romantic and cozy...perfect for dates. I couldn't take my eyes off the stunning chandelier above the bar!  The bartenders were both friendly and tenacious. We tried the sliders, the flat bread and some mortadella... What I really wanted were the Mac-n-Cheese and Pot Pie..I guess that will have to wait til next time...and what we had were pretty good...  This wine bar has only been open for two weeks..and currently have two wines on draft..They also offer a solid list of unique and adventurous wines.   Fat Angel is definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood and I look forward to coming back!

EMRSUY3hkSje0zUx5Z9Urg.review_text: Fat Angel, you are too cute and a wine bar to boot. Love your cool chandelier over the bar and overall design. Just wish you would fix some of your chairs with uneven legs.   Found Fat Angel on Yelp while searching for a place to go before the Fillmore. I tried the Sangiovese/Merlot/Montepulciano (super rich) and the Malbec and they were very good. For food we tried the two flat-breads on the menu. Both were delicious with the mushroom being the best.   Next time I have to try the maple bacon butter which is a killer combo I have tried on a donut. Sounds great with a rich red wine.   Service is OK but a little slow, so relax and don't expect perfect service. The location, interior, food and wine are worth a visit.

7HXSL_YdprSSMfpJyBh8Rg.review_text: Food is so delicious! I never liked Mac n Cheese, but I loved theirs. It gets really crowded and we had to wait for a hour and half to be seated but it was totally worth the wait.

8RTzoq1ei6dRFgM4ZTPjNQ.review_text: This place is awesome. The beer selection is great, and I love the wine on draft :). The food is not your typical entree style; it is meant to share - and SO good! Duck salami, smoked trout salad, and their butter selection is ah-mazing! Try the garlic chili one - yum!! And they are not stingy about the bread they give you with the butter - so good!

76iZo2qcv91007X-JUSsNw.review_text: Cozy little spot that if I lived closer to I'd visit more. Picked some nice wines and noted their great beer selection, I need to go back and try more beer.  Had assorted charcuterie and cheese selections and they were good- but the only problem was they didn't bring what we actually ordered. We ate for a few mins then asked the waitress which of the 3 meats was which and then she realized the mistake. The same thing happened to the table next to us w/ their cheeses and another table as well. The flatbread we had ordered came out much later than we had hoped- we almost forgot about ordering it. It was good though.  Not a big deal, but worth noting that they have some minor kinks to work out.

KDewJBJknfWvQyHHFNbfdg.review_text: After nearly a fistful of years of coming here, I've learned to not attempt to fly in the face of the flapping wings of the high volume nights of Fat Angel. Instead, times like Sunday at 7 or Tuesday at 6 are times that match the relaxation of ordering butter, bread and wine. In the way the inside decor gives you a reprieve from the city design disaster that is the Fillmore Center, bread, butter and wine should come in a relaxed environment, not when you're fighting for tables. We accomplished a feat that seems as likely as not asking the server to take a photo immediately because of it: 10 of us gathered tables and enough chairs outside to all sit here. I'm not into the S&M of SF's competitive seating scene, but I am way into a GSM with garlic chili butter on a calm night in a special place like Fat Angel.

AlpltTc9Y8k8A4x5239JUw.review_text: fat angel is like everything i want in a local establishment - lots of cheese, homemade bread, fresh local salads, artisan bar bites (sliders, flatbreads and the like), charcuterie, an extensive beer/cider/wine list and taxidermy on the wall. i absolutely love this place!  yes, it's bordering the sketchiness that is the western addition but its tucked away so you almost forget where you are.  the wait is sometimes a little too long to justify, but if you catch them at a good time you'll be happy you stopped by.  besides the flavored butters, charcuterie and cheese offerings - the kale salad, sliders and gorgonzola flatbread are absolutely delicious. you've gotta order those!

kXSjBL6-Y68wWjt2cNaSRw.review_text: One word: Awesome.  In a city chock full of divey after work bars, this is my favorite happy hour place in the city.    Love the vibe - unpretentious, interesting but not distracting decor, and always lively after work but not over-the-top rowdy.  Love the drinks - the ever-changing draft beer selection is always interesting (maybe 10 beers total - just tried the Hop Wallop, very nice), the beer and wine bottle list is pretty long, and prices are reasonable across the board. Love the food - try the flatbreads, fancy mac n cheese, and the olives - all varying levels of bad for you but oh-so-addictive.    Only a couple gripes with this place - the location is a bit sketchy and the food menu, although pretty tasty, is short and never changes.

3l67H7uMgatj8oIi_ORW1Q.review_text: Incredible spot for a casual date or pre-Fillmore night out.  A small side-street off Fillmore, great indoor ambiance and outdoor seating, too.  We ordered red wine and the house nut + cheese platters, which were excellent on the warm night.  No-pressure service, unhurried conversation and relatively little street noise to interrupt the evening.  I left impressed, only $-2-0 lighter, without having a chance to try their unique craft/belgian beer menu...I will be back for sure :)  A little reluctant to write this review, and reveal my new secret find ;)

jVaiCNmWOjoI0led5LZuyA.review_text: This place has outdoor seating and a bit of space indoors. Honestly, the beer selection is ridonk. They're categorized and organized in a way that will appeal to anyone - yeasty, hoppy, bitter, sour, reserves, etc. They also have wines on draft, and their draft beers rotate too. It's definitely a little pricey, but the ambiance is great. Sit and chill on a nice day with your friends while eating their fantastic mac n'cheese or polenta fries (both are amazing; you'll thank me later). Oh, and they play The Gaslight Anthem, The Decemberists, and Death Cab. Fantastic music selection. I do wish it were less pricey, and that there were more than just one unisex restroom.

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: This place should be a girl's best friend.  Wine (on draft) and cheese (x6).  Not to mention bread & multiple types of butter.  We pretty much tried everything.  Champagne cocktail for $10 was delicious. Half-bottle of wine for $20 netted 3 full glasses. Also tried truffled cheese, truffled wild boar salami, spicy salami, hard cow cheese, humboldt's fog goat cheese , and duck liver mousse(my fave).    Maple bacon butter was delicious. they had about 5 other variations of butter to try too. Whipped and light. It almost doesn't feel like you're ingesting a million calories!  Endless bags of bread slices and baguette slices.  We were 80% full based on the charcuterie platter we made ourselves.   Kale salad was also delicious, as well as the mac & cheese (could have been spicier). Sliders were good too - the bread was a softer, more croissant-like bun with sesame seeds.   Would come back again but maybe try an additional butter and not do the mac & cheese. It was good but nothing special.

3wjqn70BkV8nXzqBDLpUvQ.review_text: Love it..... Wine is tasty and you can get it on tap. There is also a few beers on tap that are decent. The decor is amazing; according to their website "Our restaurant was built with reclaimed, repurposed, and recycled materials from around San Francisco". It's completely not snobbish and low key. And for God's sake, they have butter on the menu! There is a parking garage next door but beware....they do not validate.  And yes it might be in the 'hood... but it is my 'hood so its all good with me. A little diversity never hurt anyone.

ccQvyiUeqsXhweY2hHrHAw.review_text: Amazing beer selection -- who knew that there were great Belgian-style beers made on the Pacific Coast?!  PranQster is a new favorite of mine.  Great indie rock tunes and a friendly and outgoing barkeep.  That's everything you could ask for right there!

7ftbR3edBrCLC8UtMnaVSw.review_text: Nice place to hang out with friends after work.  This place is real: -  Small by good wine list. -  Friendly staff (would be a plus if they had a cute waitress). -  They have good food in terms of a wine bar (... don't know how they make them... but the sliders were amazing... really....) -  Cool atmosphere/lighting. -  Doesn't have shitty music. -  Again, I don't know how it works but it is a good place to have a good time with good wine and food.

VIW-4GDAKGaXUdLtTVSFqQ.review_text: Fat Angel is a dimly lit, cozy bar with fun decor.  It has mouth-watering eats (Chinese nuts, various flatbreads, salads, MACARONI AND CHEESE!) and an extensive beer and wine list.  In my experience, the price point is more reasonable if you order a drink off of the chalkboard (i.e., on draft).  It seems to me that several of the drinks on the paper menu are fancy and pricier.  This is a great spot for a date, happy hour, or stop on your way to see a show at the Fillmore.  So glad it exists!!!

ZfiQsWC8Z57fVvtvPa9DIg.review_text: Hands down my favorite place to relax and eat amazingly delicious food in SF. The owners and staff are super friendly and helpful when choosing beers and wine. Even though every table is filled (even the ones outside... yea people love it so much girls will eat in 45 degree weather)  you are treated as if you are the only customer at the bar. It's that great! I would recommend it for groups of 4 or less. I also recommend the Tempranillo and Sliders. Best sliders ever! :)

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: Loved (almost) everything about Fat Angel besides the crazy wait. People tend to lounge around due to their awesome selection of wines, beers, cheese & meat platters. I was tempted to, but the long line piling up at the door made me feel bad.   Chicken pot pie is a MUST. Their apple bread pudding was pretty great too. Despite the craziness, staff was super accomodating, patient, and knowledgeable.

3WRCQrMEeixuGLcbQkEPOw.review_text: Seems crazy to pay that much for appetizers and beer when in Japantown.   Another just ok place. The massive beer selection is pricey, and the appetizers are tiny.  We left hungry and without a buzz.   Service was good, earning the place a 3rd star.

vJ3GBzU92U-RrhC1M-OTVA.review_text: Cool interior,  Yummy food,  Good beer!

v-kh_W7iWpKOIux2Gx2q1g.review_text: Special spot -   Loved the mushroom flatbread and endive salad. I want to try more next time! Happy to see it was packed!!

scIyLRiFryYbzCcJG5l1Fg.review_text: The wine and ambiance gets a total 5 stars!!!  I love the draft wine and had the Grenache blend and it was delicious at least it still was delicious after 3 glasses.  My friend had the pinot and that was pretty good.  The ambiance is awesome.  I mean the chandelier is sick and the setup of an swank almost Parisian speakeasy.  The cork rim around the back bar was cool and the organ pipes above were great.  Okay why isn't it five stars, well a couple of things.  The bar seats were very uncomfortable (they did have hooks which is a plus), and at 7:30pm the one person working the room was overworked and service suffered a bit (not his fault) since it was a packed room.  Also, they should be a slight bit more generous on the cheese portions, it seemed quite small for $5 per cheese.

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: I've been back to Fat Angel a couple of times after that fateful missed connection, and they always deliver a great time - tasty bites, nice atmosphere, and a GREAT beer selection.  If you haven't been here, I don't know why not.  It's a great first date spot too!
